MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a calf and a separator for processing milk

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.es: El señor Eleuterio oriundo de Aguaicastilla de la ciudad Chuquisaca, tiene tres hijas que se encuentran estudiando, su domicilio es propio  se encuentra ubicado, en la localidad de  Puerto Rico hace 5 años, el se dedica a la ganadería,  comercia el ganado en la feria asproa los fines de semana a parte tiene un ingreso  por la compra-venta de vehículo y motocicleta. El destino del crédito es para la compra de material de construcción para la construcción de  un cuarto en su casa para así brindar mas comodidad a su familia ya que poco a poco pudo construir su casita pero le falta algunos cuatros y el tiene el deseo de que en un futuro pueda tener su casita terminada Se siente muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo que se le ha brindado.
texts.en: Eleuterio, a native of Agua Castilla in Chuquisaca, has 3 daughters who are in school.  He has had his own home, located in the town of Puerto Rico, for 5 years.  He works with livestock.  He sells the livestock in the Asproa market on the weekends, and he also has another business buying and selling automobiles and motorcycles.  He will use this loan to buy construction materials to add a room to his house so that his family can live in greater comfort.  He has been gradually building his little house, but it still lacks some rooms, and in the future he wants to be able to completely finish the house.  He is very grateful to the institution for the support that is being provided to him.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Gelinda

texts.en:
Gelinda is a 49-year-old married woman with two children, aged 24 and 22. Gelinda's husband works as a farmer.

Gelinda is also a farmer. She helps her husband grow rice on their land. Gelinda also runs a sari-sari (general) store. She sells items like bread and canned goods. Gelinda plans to use her loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies, and also more items to sell at the store.

In the future, Gelinda hopes to have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies, and more items to sell at her store.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic is a married man and blessed with four children. For the last fifteen years, he has been selling clothing to earn a living. He has employed one person to help him manage the business. 

In the next five years, he wants to manage a wholesale business selling used clothing. He is requesting a loan of 30,000 KES to buy men's trousers to sell. Since he decided to join Faulu Kenya, he has been able to educate his children and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy men's trousers to sell.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es: LA SEÑORA  LORENZA, es una persona de 49 años de edad, de estado civil casada, alcanzo a estudiar la primaria, vive actualmente con su esposo y ya no cuenta con dependientes económicos a cargo. La actividad económica de la cliente y su esposo es la producción agrícola y los principales productos que cultiva  son la papa, haba, arveja y papa lisa en sus propios terrenos que se hallan ubicadas en la comunidad de Villa Mojón del municipio de Pocona que esta distante a 101 Km. desde la ciudad de Cochabamba. La señora O. guanto a su esposo manifiestan ser personas responsables y trabajadores que quieren incrementar su producción agrícola y para tal efecto se ven en la necesidad de solicitar el presente capital de inversión para la compra de fertilizantes químicos y  abono de gallinaza que son los principales insumos que promueven un mejor rendimiento de los cultivos agrícolas.
texts.en: 49 year old Lorenza is married, achieved a primary school education, and currently lives with her husband and does not have any economic dependents in her charge. She and her husband have an agricultural business and the main crops they cultivate are potatoes, beans, peas, and a root vegetable called papa lisa. They grow these on their own land in the community of Villa Mojón in the municipality of Pocona which is 101km from the city of Cochabamba. O. and her husband are responsible and hardworking people who want to increase their agricultural production and for this reason they are requesting the present loan to buy chemical fertilizer and chicken manure fertilizer which are the main inputs that promote a better agricultural yield.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and chicken manure fertilizer

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en: Hasmik is from the town of Artik in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She was born in Artik and has lived her whole life there.  Hasmik has a high school education and also has been trained as an accountant.  Due to the limited number of jobs in Artik, Hasmik began farming five years ago.  This has brought income for the family and allowed her to help her relatives living nearby.  Hasmik would like a loan to purchase livestock and feed.  She expects the family income to increase by twenty percent with the investment.  Hasmik has four wonderful children – three daughters (twenty, twenty-five and twenty-eight years old) and a nineteen-year-old son.  She wants her business income to grow so that she can continue supporting her children and grandchildren.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and feed

loans.name: Collique Unido Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Delsy Elia, tiene 29 años de edad, vive en la zona de Collique en el distrito de Comas al igual que sus compañeras del grupo "Collique Unido".
La Sra. Delsy Elia se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y ropa a pedido, inició éste negocio hace unos años primero con la venta de productos de belleza, poco a poco y visitando a sus clientes ellos no sólo pedían cosméticos o perfumes, le empezaron a pedir ropa y es así que ella piensa en ampliar su negocio e invierte un poco de capital en ropa.
gracias a su negocio ha logrado obtener su independencia económica y brindar a su familia lo necesario para viri tranquilamente.
El pr+estamo solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de juguetes para aprovechar la venta en la campaña navideña.
texts.en:
Delsy Elia, 29, lives in the Collique zone in Comas District as do the rest of her fellow members of the “Collique Unido” group.

Delsy Elia sells beauty products and clothes on order.  She started this business a few years ago first selling the beauty products.  Gradually her customers started asking her not only for cosmetics or perfume but also clothes and that’s why she intends to expand the business and invest some capital in clothes.

Thanks to her business she’s become independent economically and is able to provide her family everything necessary to live in peace.

She will use the requested loan to buy toys to take advantage of the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy toys.

loans.name: Felipe Hector

texts.es:
Felipe vive y trabaja en famous Nazca, or Nasca, Perú. The city is well known for the legendary Nazca Lines- a series of ancient, immense and inexplicable geoglyphs etched into the desert surrounding the city, generally attributed to the Nazca culture, which inhabited in the region from 300-800 AD. As such, the city attracts a considerable amount of tourism. But Nazca is also known for its hardworking people, who have preserved despite frequent earthquakes, tsunamis, and a high level of poverty in the region.

Felipe, es un hombre soltero de 69 años de edad, el se dedica a prestar el servicio de alquiler de habitaciones, eligio este tipo de trabajo por la edad que no puede ya trabajar en otra actividad.
Felipe es un hombre  luchador que sigue enfrentando a la vida con muchas fuerzas y ganas de salir adelante.
Felipe ,  empezó su negocio en el año 2009 , gana semanalmente S/.180 nuevos soles. Con el préstamo de S/. 2000 soles que recibirá gracias a KIVA,  Felipe invertirá el crédito en el mantenimiento de su casa (Arreglo de baños y pisos).  Su sueño de Felipe es construir mas habitaciones para alquilar, su asesor cree es que un excelente cliente .
texts.en:
Felipe lives and Works in famous Nazca, or Nasca, Perú. The city is well known for the legendary Nazca Lines- a series of ancient, immense and inexplicable geoglyphs etched into the desert surrounding the city, generally attributed to the Nazca culture, which inhabited in the region from 300-800 AD.  As such, the city attracts a considerable amount of tourism.  But Nazca is also known for its hardworking people, who have preserved despite frequent earthquakes, tsunamis, and a high level of poverty in the region.

Felipe is a single, 69 year old gentleman who rents out living accomodations.  He settled on this type of work because of his age, since he can’t do any other type of work.

Felipe is a hardworking man who continues to face life with great enthusiasm and force of will and a desire to get ahead.

Felipe began his business in 2009, when he only earned 180 PEN.  With a loan or 2,000 PEN ($750), that he got thanks to Kiva, Felipe will fix up the bathroom and floors in his home.  His dream is to build more homes to rent out.  The loan assessor thinks of him as a great customer.

loans.use: to fix up his home.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with five children, one of whom is in school. Her husband is a fisherman who contributes to the family's basic needs. Fatuma owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

Fatuma has operated a vegetable grocery for the past two years; her potential clients are her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of rising prices of commodities in the market. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the loan of 15,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) she wants to purchase more stocks of vegetable such as tomatoes, onions, cabbages and sweet potatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of their quality financial services.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of vegetable such as tomatoes, onions, cabbages and sweet potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: María Mercedes tiene 43 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Desde hace mas de 12 años que tiene este medio de vida, el precio de los productos que compra aumentan por lo que no puede comprar variedad en su mercadería. El motivo de la compra que solicita es para ofrecer calzado, cremas, perfumes, pulseras, aretes, cosméticos entre otros productos. Sueña con lograr incrementar su inventario y al mismo tiempo brindar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
María Mercedes is 43 years old and sells general merchandise. She has earned her living in this manner for more than 12 years. The prices of the products that she buys have increased, so she is not able to maintain a variety of merchandise.

The reason for this loan is so that she can offer shoes, crèmes, perfumes, bracelets, earrings, cosmetics, and other products. María dreams of increasing her inventory so that she can provide better service.

loans.use: to buy shoes, crèmes, perfumes, bracelets, earrings, cosmetics, and other products.

loans.name: Severino

texts.es: El señor Severino es soltero no tiene hijos, el vive en casa de su tía en la localidad de Sacaba, el señor Severino se dedica al servicio de transporte, cuenta con movilidad propia,  pero no es afiliado al sindicato de transportistas, es decir que trabaja con la afiliación de un conocido.  El sale todos los días a las 6 de la mañana para trabajar y descansa a las 6 de la tarde, es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz con la institución ya que el préstamo es para la compra de un motor nuevo para su herramienta de trabajo, ya que esta es su única fuente de trabajo.
texts.en:
Severino is single and does not have children. He lives in his aunt’s house in the town of Sacaba. 

Severino works in the transport service, and has his own transport, but he is not affiliated with the union, that is to say he works in association with a friend. He leaves every morning at 6:00AM for work, relaxing at 6:00PM in the afternoon. 

He is a hard working person who feels happy with the institution for providing the loan so he can buy a new engine for his mode of working because this is his only source of work.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for his transport service

loans.name: Aarón

texts.es:
El joven Aarón desea reparar el techo de la cocina de su casa ya que están en malas condiciones y cuando llueve se le mojan todos sus muebles. También le preocupa la salud de el y  de su abuelita quien vive con el.
Aarón es empleado de una compañía de limpieza desde hace ya más de dos años y su abuelita le ayuda con las ganancias que obtiene de las ventas de su negocio de ropa usada y nueva en diferentes partes de la ciudad. 
Solicita el préstamo para comprar la madera y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de reparar el techo. Desea mejorar su vivienda y el patrimonio que tiene.
texts.en:
Aarón wants to repair the kitchen ceiling in his home, since it is in very bad condition and whenever it rains his furniture gets wet.  He is also concerned about his health and that of his grandmother, who lives with him.

Aarón has worked for a cleaning company for more than two years.  His grandmother helps him with her earnings from her business selling new and second-hand clothing in different parts of the city.

Aarón is asking for a loan so he can purchase wood and pay someone who will take care of repairing the ceiling.  He wants to improve his home and the assets he has.

loans.use: to repair his ceiling.

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en: In Guayaquil not many people can afford to buy their own video game consoles like the Playstation or Xbox, yet the kids love to play the games just as they do in the rest of the world. Businesses like Barbara’s have emerged where they rent out playing time on video game consoles from their home. Barbara has three TVs and three Playstations with a variety of games that the kids can choose to play. She saved up $500 from her part time job in a travel agency to buy the used the consoles and the televisions. Barbara also sells ice cream and soft drinks to the video game players and kids from a nearby school. She is seeking a loan in order to buy another console and make improvements to her home/business.

loans.use: Continue investing in clothes and cosmetics

loans.name: Kimpo Elwa

texts.en: K., married with six children, has been in business since 1994. He started his business with the capital of $100. He increased his business capital to $600 by 1995. Attacked by armed thieves one day, they stole all of his merchandise and capital and his business closed. In 2001, K. resumed his general business with the capital of $150. He is planning with a loan of $700 to purchase children’s items such as clothing, shoes, school supplies, and baby clothing as there is a high demand for those goods.

loans.use: He wants to diversify his business by adding children’s items to his merchandise

loans.name: Sedri

texts.en: Sedri H. Aslan ogli is from the Saatli region of Azerbaijan. He is 52 years old and has seven children. To improve his living conditions, he started his animal breeding business in 1998. He wishes to expand his business and raise his standard of living. For this purpose he needs a loan of $600 from Agroinvest to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario lives with her parents in their home located on May 4th street in the Buenos Aires zone, La Paz. She is 22 years old and she is in the food service business. At first, she would sell her meals door-to-door, but now she has modified one of the rooms in her home to hold a small, account based restaurant. She does not have any children: she works to make a living and pay her expenses. She wants to invest the loan amount to redecorate the restaurant in order to give it a more pleasant ambiance and attract more patrons. An account based restaurant allows its customers to pay for their meals on a monthly basis, in return customers are guaranteed one meal per day for a whole month. Her credit history with Impro indicates that she has had access to a 6-month-term credit line in January of this year. Her balance has been totally paid off on time. Her good payment history places her in a position to request another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosario vive en casa de sus padres en la calle 4 de mayo de la zona Buenos Aires de la ciudad de La Paz. Tiene 22 años de edad y su actividad es la venta de comida; anteriormente vendía en la puerta de su casa, pero actualmente tiene una pensión modesta dentro de la casa en una habitación que fue habilitada para este fin. No tiene hijos, trabaja para poder subsistir y cubrir sus necesidades. El crédito que solicita es para implementar mejor su pensión y tener un ambiente acogedor y poder captar más clientes. Vale la pena aclarar que una pensión es un pequeño restaurante donde los clientes tienen un contrato mensual para tener un almuerzo seguro cada día del mes y pagan por todo el mes. El antecedente histórico de Rosario con Impro indica que ella ya tuvo acceso a un primer crédito en Enero del presente año por 6 meses y a la fecha el crédito esta pagado en su totalidad. Su calificación como buen cliente le permite acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Capital de trabajo

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
Filomena, like many Bolivian women, was left by her husband to be both father and mother to her four small children that depend on her. She works making cow's milk and sells potatoes and potato starch. She uses her income to support her children.

She lives in the Villandrani community (one hour the city of La Paz).

She will invest her loan in the purchase of a cow of average breed to increase her milk production.

This is her first loan with Impro; her socio-economic evaluation shows her ability to repay the loan and also cover her family's monthly expenses and qualifies her to be granted the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Filomena, como mucha mujeres de bolivianas fue abandonada por su esposo, quedando ella como padre y madre de sus cuatro pequeños hijos que dependen de ella. Filomena se dedica a la producción de leche de vaca y comercializa papa y chuño, ingresos con lo que cubre la manutención de sus hijos.

Vive en la Comunidad de Villandrani (A una hora de la ciudad de La Paz).

El crédito le invertirá en la compra de una vaca de raza mediana para incrementar la producción de leche.

Es el primer crédito con Impro; la evaluación socio-económica realizada muestra la capacidad de repago del crédito como también ingresos suficientes para cubrir los gastos mensuales de su familia y la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Fifteen years ago, shortly after Ukraine gained it’s independence from the Soviet Union, Oksana started her own small business, taking advantage of new, free market opportunities. Over the years, she has gained much valuable experience as an entrepreneur and has been able to help provide necessary income for herself, her husband and daughter.

Oksana presently sells an assortment of women’s outerwear. She is evaluating the competition and would like to bring in products that other vendors don’t have. Oksana operates from a little kiosk at an outdoor market, but soon hopes to obtain a self-standing store facility that will be a big improvement to her business.

As it gets closer to the winter season, demand for Oksana’s products will grow. She has requested a short term loan of $500 to help purchase new clothing inventory and be better prepared for this busy time of year.

loans.use: To purchase clothing inventory

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Thorn I. (age 52) has been widowed since 1997. She lives in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers north of Phnom Penh. She shares her one-room house wI. three of her children, one son-in-law and one grandson. Though Thorn learned to weave from her mother many years ago, she’s been working at it commercially for only about seven or eight years. She has also taught her daughter, now age twenty-one, (see photo) who joined on a second loom. They both laughed that the daughter is now the better weaver because her eyes are better than her mother’s.

Thorn is requesting this, her third loan from MAXIMA, in the amount of $300. She will use the funds from the loan to buy materials for weaving. Prior to taking out a loan, Thorn worked on a barter basis wI. a local middleperson. The middleperson would advance her an amount of weaving thread. Out of that thread, Thorn would give back two finished pieces and get the profit only from one. She now makes more profit as the cost of the thread is less and the price she gets for the finished cloth is more – as long as she conducts all the transactions in cash.

In addition to weaving, Thorn also farms rice wI. her son-in-law. Her farm plot is five kilometers from her house so weaving productivity declines during planting and harvest seasons due to the demands of farm work and commuting. In addition to paying for family living costs and the fees for her one child who remains in school, she is saving money to buy a cow.

loans.use: To purchase silk and nylon thread and other materials for weaving

loans.name: Xuan Thi

texts.vi:
Mr. Thi, 48 years old, is an active person. Besides his main activity of making tofu, he also raises a few pigs and offers a service of rice processing for farmers in the area. Incomes from many occupations keep the family’s economy stable. His wife sells tofu and helps him tend those pigs and process rice. He would like to take out a loan to buy bean and feed for his pigs. He prefers loan with weekly repayments because it make him conscious about spending and saving.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


AnhThi 48 tuổi, là người rất năng động trong việc làm. Anh chủ yếu kiếm sống bằng nghề làm đậu phụ để bán. Ngoài ra, anh còn nuôi lợn và xay xát gạo thuê. Nhờ có nhiều nghề nên kinh tế gia đình rất ổn định. Vợ anh hàng ngày đi bán đậu và thời gian còn lại thì cùng chồng nhận xay xát gạo và nuôi lợn. Anh dự định vay vốn để mua thêm đỗ về làm đậu và mua cám cho lợn. Anh rất thích hình thức vay vốn hoàn trả theo tuần vì nó giúp anh có ý thức hơn trong chi tiêu và tiết kiệm.

loans.use: To purchase bean for making bean curd and feed for pigs

loans.name: Mauricia's Group

texts.en:
This group of women work everyday selling goods door-to-door. They live and run their businesses in an area of Paraguay where there is a great amount of poverty. People from neighboring cities migrate to their city to sell goods and work in various businesses. These women want to increase their profits and eventually own shops of their own. It is their aspiration to continue to live outside of poverty.

With the loan, they will purchase canned goods, non-perishable foods, animals, and home products.

loans.use: to buy canned goods and other non-perishable products.  Other goods to be purchased include animals and various home goods.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel is a young man filled with hopes and dreams. He studied Agronomy at the university and has since learned his craft closely with much practice and effort. He offers livestock and agricultural manor services to people that request it and breeds bees in an area of his home. Every week, he extracts honey from the space where he houses the bees to sell in his older brothers’ stores. His wish is to contribute to the tranquility of his elderly mother and has decided to increase the artificial honeycombs he has at home and set up an area to counsel the people in his town.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Manuel, es un joven lleno de sueños y esperanzas, estudió Agronomía en la universidad y desde ese entonces con mucho esfuerzo y práctica ha conocido su profesión de cerca, presta servicios de señoría ganadera y agrícola a las personas que lo solicitan y está criando abejas en un espacio de su casa, semanalmente del lugar que les ha otorgado como morada de reposo extrae miel para comercializarla en las tiendas de sus hermanos mayores.Su deseo es contribuir con la tranquilidad de su anciana madre y ha decidido incrementar lo panales artificiales que posee en casa e implementar el espacio para asesorar desde este lugar a los pobladores de su ciudad.

loans.use: Inject capital to increase the quantity of artificial honeycombs and expand a section of his house to use as a counseling area.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 31 years old and is married with 4 children, ages 3-13. Amina owns a small cafe, which she started in 2006. Everyday, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Saada

texts.en:
Saada is 40 years old and is married with 2 children, ages 20 and 16. Saada has been a charcoal seller since 2000. Everyday, she works from 7am to 9pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Gulissa Guisselle

texts.es:
The business of owning a grocery story is an activity that requires constant investment in products in order to sell to clients and keep them satisfied. In the sector of Somotillo, Gulissa M. devotes herself to attending her grocery store, which she has owned for the past year and which is the only way she can support her home and her children.

Today, the problem she has been facing is lack of funds to purchase merchandise needed by her customers. Nevertheless, she has searched for support in Ceprodel to obtain credit that would allow her to purchase products to sell in her area and thus continue to support her humble abode.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio de pulpería es una actividad que requiere de mucha inversión constante de productos para lograr comercializarlos a los clientes y acapararlos para que siempre puedan estar satisfechos con la atención. En el municipio de Somotillo la señora Gulissa M. se dedica a atender su pulpería que desde hace un año la posee siendo este el unico sustento para mantener su hogar y sus hijos.

Hoy en día, la problemática que ella atraviesa es que debido a que no posee el recurso económico, no ha logrado adquirir su mercadería para ofrecer, no obstante, ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita la compra de los productos para comercializarlos en su sector de habitación y así continuar con el mantenimiento de su humilde hogar.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Grace Anjei

texts.en:
Grace was born on 15/8/1959, and is married with seven children with one below 15 years. Faced with some challenges in life like ill health, the death of her father and younger brother, and being a school dropout, life was very difficult and complicated for her until she came to GHAPE in 2006. Thus far, she has obtained two loans of $40 and $300 respectively and the repayment was satisfactory.  The loans accomplished many things, such as paying school fees for her children and grandchildren, supporting the health of her family and feeding the family.

Given this loan, Grace plans to construct a new pig pen, electrify the pig pen to give light to the pigs when they are about to deliver at night. She also plans to buy 10 piglets to add to the ones she already has, to prepare a packing space for her firewood, and to continue buying and splitting of wood. She promises to start repayment at the fourth month from the date of disbursement.  

With the profit from the loan, she plans to expand her business, continue to pay school fees for her children and grandchildren, and take care of the health and feeding in the family.

Grace prefers a loan from GHAPE because the means  of repayment is easier, the loan scheme is encouraging, the interest paid on GHAPE loans is relatively low as compared to other financial institution, and lastly, GHAPE does proper follow up with their clients to ensure the loan is manage judiciously.

loans.use: To buy materials for new pig pen, and piglets and firewood

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok V., 39, is as widow and has started business selling various kinds of grocery products since 2000 to the people in her community and typically makes around $4 per day in revenue. She has two children aged 15 and 10 who are enrolled in a primary school. Each month she spends around $30 on food, $10 on utilities and $50 for her children’s education.

A diligent mother, Mrs. Sok V. has to work very hard and to make sure that she can afford her family’s expenses. In the past she was a businesswoman who worked near the Thai border but because her son got seriously ill she decided to give up her business and came back home to look after her son and other kids. When she was back home she opened a grocery store.

Now she is asking for a loan to purchase more grocery products to expand her inventory. Her customers' demands are growing so she has to increase her products to meet their needs.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to expand her inventory

loans.name: Khoeng

texts.en: Mrs. Khoeng S. lives in Ampil Village in Kandal Province. She owns a small grocery store in the local village. Her husband, Mr. Phai Rorn, is a farmer. In order to meet the family expenses, he tries to work hard on the rice field where he cultivates twice a year. In his farming, Mr. Phai Rorn faces an obstacle because he does not have enough money to purchase rice seeds for cultivating. Therefore his wife decided to ask for a loan for her husband, and she would use the rest of the loan to buy more pesticides to protect the crops from insects. Mrs. Khoeng S. is 29 years old and the mother of two children who are too young to work or study. Previously, Mrs. Khoeng S. had obtained a loan from Acleda Bank to hire a laborer to plow the rice field, and to buy rice seeds and pesticides. She has fully paid it back.

loans.use: To purchase rice seeds for cultivating and buy more pesticides to protect the crops from insects.

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.en:
Shahnoza S. is 28 years old, and she comes from a large and humble family. She is married and is the loving mother of 3 children. Her father's hard-working and demanding nature showed her, from the time she was a little girl, the significant value of work, which has served her well because she has been successful in various activities throughout her life.

Now, she dedicates herself to raising and selling cattle. With the income she generates from this business, she is able to provide a better quality of life for her children, who are her greatest joy and her best friends. Consequently, she is seeking a 12-month loan in the amount of 3,500 Somoni ($1,050) in order to buy more young cattle to later sell when they are fully grown. With this investment, she will be able to substantially grow her earnings and improve her quality of life. Please support this dedicated mother's proposal.

loans.use: To expand her business and to improve her family's living conditions by purchasing additional cattle

loans.name: Mali

texts.en: Mrs. Mali S. M. was born in 1975 and lives in Kampong Svay Village in Kandal Province.She is a 33-year-old widow without any children. She has a plot of land on which she plans to cultivate rice to earn a living. However, she currently does not have enough money to buy more rice seeds, so she is requesting a loan for this purpose. She hopes to increase her rice revenue and improve living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy more rice seeds

loans.name: Arche De Noe Group

texts.en: Leontine started her business in 1981 and has been a faithful client with Hope DRC (a microfinance program) since February 2008. Over the years, Leontine has acquired solid experience in business. She first began selling sacs of corn, peanuts and beans, until 2005 when she had an accident on a boat and was hospitalized for three months. After the recovery, Leontine decided to change the business because of a broken finger that she got from the accident.  She opened a general boutique in late 2005 and has been operating this business to the present day. She sells soaps, sugar, salt, milk, toilet papers, oil, cans, and other household goods. Her business strategies are based on the high quality of goods, strategic pricing, caring for clients and never running out of inventory. With her next loan she is planning to rent a place to move her business indoors in order to avoid the heavy rains. Her dream is to purchase a boat in order to serve rural people as river transport. Leontine is married and a mother of four children.

loans.use: To rent a place to move the business indoors in order to avoid the heavy rains

loans.name: Fatimata-Touré

texts.fr:
Madame T. est âgée de 47 ans et elle a pour l’activité la vente des bijoux et des sacs de sortie.  Elle achète quelques produits à Cotonou, la capitale du Benin, et les autres articles au grand marché de Lomé, la capitale du Togo.  Elle les revend à Agoè, un quartier au nord de Lomé ou elle habite.  Elle a commencé ce commerce depuis 2004.  Elle a une fois bénéficié d’un crédit au près de WAGES, et elle a bien remboursé.  Avec ce deuxième crédit, elle peut acheter 40 complets de bijoux et 2 douzaines de sacs de sortie.  Avec ce nouveau stock, elle peut servir ses clients pendant les fêtes de fin d’année, parce que les choses qu’elle vend peuvent servir de très bons cadeaux pour les femmes.
Madame T. est née à Sokode, une ville située 175 km de Lomé.  Elle est mariée avec un revendeur et ils ont 4 enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. T. is 47 years old and sells jewelry and handbags. She buys several products in Cotonou, the capital of Benin, and she buys other products at the large market in Lomé, which is the capital of Togo. She sells these products in Agoè, an area in the northern part of Lomé where she lives. She has been involved in this since 2004. She has taken out one previous loan with WAGES, and she repaid the loan in full. With this second loan she is requesting, she can purchase 40 sets of jewelry and two dozen handbags. With this new stock she will be able to serve her customers during the year-end festivals, since the goods that she sells make very good gifts for women. Mrs. T. was born in Sokode, a city situated about 175 km from Lomé. She is married to a retailer and they have four children.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of jewelry and handbags

loans.name: Marizel

texts.en:
Marizel G. is a 37-year-old mother of two children. She married so early; that is why she never finished her college education when she was younger. She has two children and happily nurtures all of them to fulfill whatever dreams she failed to achieve. She calls her business “G. Coco Lumber and Charcoal." With her husband’s support, together they are able surpass all the challenges in their family.

Because she is into retail, Marizel developed a character that knows how to sell. She knows her products and clients well, and this helps her achieve her target sales. Now, she is requesting a loan from CEVI to purchase additional materials and capital for the business. Marizel desires to increase the size of her store, which she believes in doing so, will reap larger earnings. She is also considering looking into some other possible ways to contribute to the family income.

Like other CEVI clients, Marizel also enjoys the credit assistance, trainings, and insurance coverage as the benefits.

loans.use: To purchase additional charcoal to sell

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Greetings from Angelique M. in Gatsata Sector, Gasabo District, Kigali (capital of Rwanda)! Angelique is 31 years old and the mother of 2 kids. She has no orphans to raise.

She started her business two years ago. She has a spare parts store with capital of 1,100,000 RWF at Gatsata Sector where she has many customers. She wants to increase her working capital.

This entrepreneur is requesting a loan worth 500,000 Rwf which will be repaid in eight months on a monthly basis

loans.use: Increase her working capital

loans.name: Um

texts.en: Mrs. Um S. is a villager in Preaek Ta Noup village in Kandal province. She is a hard-working woman. She is a 59-year-old widow with a child who is employed in a garment factory. Since her child’s workplace is far from her house, she usually pays a lot of money for a motorbike taxi to transport her child to work. Thus, Mrs. Um S. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for her child and to reduce her expense.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her child and to reduce her expense.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị D. 35 tuổi hiện đang sống cùng chồng và 3 con tại huyện Mê Linh - Hà Nội. Chị D. tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2002 với nghề chính là chăn nuôi. Hiện tại ngoài chăn nuôi chị D. còn đầu tư vốn để buôn bán rau. Với mức thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng gia đình chị D. đang ngày càng có thêm điều kiện để cải thiện cuộc sống.
Vòng vốn tới chị D. mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ để đầu tư mua lợn về nuôi và đầu tư thêm vốn để buôn bán rau.
texts.en:
Mrs. D. is 35 years old, and is living with her husband and three children at Me Linh District, Hanoi. She joined TYM Fund in 2002 to invest in her livestock raising business. Besides raising, Mrs. D. also invest her loans in selling vegetables. At an income of 5,000,000 VND per month, Mrs. D. and her family has more opportunity to improve their living standard. She would like to borrow 20,000,000 VND to invest in more pigs to raise and to invest in her vegetables business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Souad

texts.en:
Souad is a 40 year old woman who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon with her husband and their three children. Souad has been working as a seamstress for four years. Her clients are her friends and neighbors.

This is Souad’s third loan cycle and she has always paid on time. Her previous loans helped her to improve her work. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. Souad decided on starting her business because she wanted to supplement her family’s income. In the future, she plans on expanding her work.

Souad has requested a loan of 500 U.S. dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase an electrical sewing tool.

loans.use: To purchase an electrical sewing tool

loans.name: Mr. Sambath Ban Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Thirteen people living in Chher Teal village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mr. Sambath B. is the 40 year old village bank president. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice to earn a living. In this plantation, he faces an obstacle because his field is infertile and this is badly affecting his crop. In order to solve this problem, he decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and he will use the rest of the loan to purchase fuel to pump water to support the field and make his crop more productive. His wife, Mrs. Keo Phanith, is a housewife who is a good cooker and a good mother. Mr. Sambath B. has seven children, one of whom is a construction worker, while another two are waiters in the restaurant, three others are enrolled in the local school, and the youngest one is too young to work or study.    

Five members in this group loan are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Those with end-of-term loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and purchase fuel to pump water.

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.en:
T. Trần Thị (627981323) is a 23-year-old female living in the town of Hưng Nguyên. She is married and has an infant child.

T. owns and operates a business providing transportation services to local community members. She has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month.

In 2004, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.

T. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. The loan will be her 5th loan from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
"My husband and I started having a business in 2004. We have a small piggery. We grow and sell pigs to our neighbors for income and to support our daily needs", says Rosita A., 63 years old, from Baclayon, Bohol.

She would like to ask for a loan of PHP 21,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase feedstock for the pigs. She is interested also to venture into another line of business to supplement their income.

CEVI helps small businesses grow. It offers credit assistance, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase feed for the pigs

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
Rina T. is from the village of Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old, and is married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Rina owns and operates her business in the retail sector running a "sari-sari" or general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products, such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste, in the local community. Rina has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 1500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Rina joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from GDMPC. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rina is now requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC. Rina plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her store and to support her family's needs.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en: Esterlita E. is from the village of Malibangcao, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old, married, and has seven school-aged children. Esterlita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting coconut and banana for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Esterlita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Haydee

texts.en:
Haydee E., a 42-year-old farmer and mother of six children, is married to Armin E. Sr. who is also a farmer. She learned from her husband, starting to help on the farm in 1986, and now knows very well the whole process of growing rice from planting to harvest. She is asking for a loan of Php 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. to buy fertilizers and chemicals. Haydee actively participates in the CEVI cluster meetings held monthly in their barrio.

CEVI provides their clients with credit assistance, training and insurance coverage services.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and chemicals.

loans.name: Isidra

texts.en:
Isidra R. is from the town of Calabayan, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 52, widowed and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Isidra owns & operates a business making & selling food snacks to the local community. Isidra has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Isidra joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Isidra is requesting a oan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients to make food snacks. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchase raw ingredients to make food snacks

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: La señora Maria Isabel A. Narváez  tiene 48 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 5 hijos, la mayoría de los cuales ya son mayores de edad. La señora Maria  se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida.  La ubicación de su negocio es en su humilde vivienda. Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace 10 años, en la búsqueda de fuentes alternativas de ingresos para la manutención de su familia. Ella empezó vendiendo muy poco, ahora posee una clientela bien establecida, además que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y ganarse la vida d una manera muy humilde. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de materias primas para la elaboración de sus comidas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar aceite, frutas y carnes. Su sueño es llegar a tener un restaurante, que brinden mayores ingresos a su familia en general.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: Yen T. D. was born in 1969.  She lives in Xom Cho – Uy No – Dong Anh – Ha Noi with her husband and 2 children. Her husband is a driver. Her son is a university student and her daughter attends secondary school. Yen T. D. sells betrothal gifts for rent. Her monthly income is about 6.000.000 VND.  She has been involved with SEDA for four years. This time, she wants to borrow 6.322.000 VND (or $375 USD) to buy more betrothal gifts for rent.

loans.use: to buy more betrothal gifts for rent

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Approvisionner son magasin

loans.name: Rene

texts.en:
Rene I. is a farmer in Norala, South Cotabato. During harvest, he earns 30,000 to 50,000 PHP from his 3.4-hectare rice field. He obtains finance at a high interest rate from a rice trader. That is why he joined Kiva partner Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI), which only charges 2 per cent interest per month.

Rene is now requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to financially support his farm and buy the required necessities. Such a loan is very helpful for farmers like Rene, who only have limited business capital.

loans.use: To finance his farm

loans.name: Bassarou

texts.fr: Cet homme a appris la menuiserie ; en 2003, il a ouvert son atelier de menuiserie dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. Il est marié et a à sa charge un enfant. Cette activité lui permet de subvenir aux besoins financiers de sa famille. Il dispose de nombreux clients fidèles qui apprécient énormément la qualité de ses travaux. Il fabrique des lits et armoires à la mode en ce moment. Il a besoin de s’approvisionner en planches et aussi certains outils neufs ; c’est pour cela qu’il sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 01 défonseur, 10 planches double, un appareil de menuiserie dénommé Moelle 6 circulaire ainsi que d’autres outils nécessaires.
texts.en:
This is a man who learned the trade of furniture-making. In 2003, he opened his own workshop in the Agoè district in Lomé. He is married and has a child to support. This business of his enables him to provide financially for his family. He has a number of loyal customers who greatly appreciate the quality of his work. He makes beds and armoires that are in style at the moment. He needs to stock up on lumber and also on some brand-new tools; this is why he’s requesting a WAGES loan for purchasing a router, ten double boards, and a piece of carpentry equipment called Moelle 6 circulaire, as well as some other necessary tools.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy carpentry tools

loans.name: Mrs. Toeurn Loch Village Bank Group

texts.en: Nineteen people who are all living in Ta Soeng village in TaK. province make up the village bank loan. Mrs. Toeurn L. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members, and they all will use their loans for different purposes. Mrs. Toeurn L. is a farmer who own a 1-hectare field to cultivate rice. Aside from this farming, she is a pig breeder. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets for breeding to earn more income. Her husband, Mr. Khat Sarith, is a construction worker who can make a small income to support the family.  Mrs. Toeurn L. is 26 years old and the mother of three children who are all too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for breeding to earn more income.

loans.name: Philemon

texts.en:
Philemon is 35 years old. He runs a small retail business selling spare auto parts and paint. He's been in business for five years and has one employee. He successfully repaid a previous loan from Faulu for Kes. 20,000 and requested this loan for Kes. 40,000 to add stock and expand his business premises.

He describes himself as social and very hardworking and says that since he became a member of Faulu he has diversified his business and his income has increased. In the future, he hopes to invest in the stock market and real estate.

loans.use: Add to his stock of paints

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica D. is currently in the business of selling bread at home and is requesting a loan to purchase more bread and cakes to sell.  Monica is 29 years old and is Married with a husband that is a driver. She has 2 school age children.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more bread and cakes to sell.

loans.name: Virgincita

texts.en: Mrs. Virgincita B., 44 years of age, is married and is a resident of Sumirap, Tangub City. They are blessed with nine children of whom four are still studying and the rest are now working. Her husband is doing manual labor jobs and at the same time is engaged in farming. With this situation, it has been so hard for her to raise their big family. She decided to engage in fish selling and was able to sustain this business for three years, even in times of hardships. She joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) a year ago because she is very much interested in PMPC's various products and services. Having successfully repaid two previous loans, she was able to borrow an amount of 7,000 Philippine pesos for her third loan to obtain needed capital for her business. Her dream in life is to be able to send all her children to college so that they will have a better future and be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: Additional capital for fish selling business

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị's Group

texts.en: H. Nguyễn Thị (10107030006) is a 35-year-old female living in the town of Đông Anh, Hà nội. H. is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Vạn lộc (2). H. is married and has two school-aged children. She operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month. In 2006, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,450,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. H. is now requesting a new loan of 6,322,000 VND which will again be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. The loan will be her 5th from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About the other borrowers in the group: 1. Nguyễn Thị L. (10107030009) is a 38-year-old female who is requesting a 5,014,000 VND loan to support her general store. 2. Ngô Thị T. (10107030008) is a 41-year-old female who is requesting a 5,014,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** H. Nguyễn Thị (10107030006) là 35 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Đông Anh -Hà nội. H. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Vạn lộc (2). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán. H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 2,000,000 VND. Vào 2006, H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. H. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5,450,000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,322,000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Nguyễn Thị L. (10107030009) là 38 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,014,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa. 2. Ngô Thị T. (10107030008) là 41 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,014,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông ngH.. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh NgH. Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia S. is a single woman who supports her family by running a general store, providing an electronic reloading service and buying and selling rice. She lives in Sto. Mapait, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store, electronic reloading and rice retailing businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 13,000.

Delia S. is now borrowing PHP 20,000 so that she can continue to sustain the growth of her general store, electronic reloading and rice retailing businesses. This will be her seventh loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Delia S. hopes to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio M. is from the village of Baculud, Iguig, Cagayan. He is forty-nine years old. Antonio is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Antonio owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Antonio has been engaged in his business for over twelve years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP every harvest (every four months).

In 2007, Antonio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Antonio  successfully repaid a previous loan of 28,000 PHP from ASKI. Antonio is requesting a new loan of 33,000 PHP, which he will use to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. This will be Andres's sixth loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-five branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: Amigos Emprendedores Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “AMIGOS EMPRENDEDORES”, actualmente se encuentra en el IX ciclo y esta conformado por 15 personas trabajadoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, es un banco comunal conformado por socios que viven en la provincia de Cusco del departamento Cusco.  Cusco es una cuidad que se caracteriza por su Centro Histórico, sus paisajes, su historia siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región Sur del país.

Las actividades económicas de los socios a las que se dedican son el comercio como por ejemplo venta de prendas de vestir,  venta de comestibles, venta de comida, venta de ropa y venta de útiles escolares y otros brindan servicios de guía de turismo. El banco comunal tiene varios ciclos de funcionamiento, como manifiestan las socias, se encuentran contentas y satisfechas con los servicios de crédito, ahorro y capacitación, por el tiempo de permanencia en el banco comunal un aspecto de valoración es el ahorro por la posibilidad de capitalización que les brinda este servicio. 

Lorenza es socia del banco comunal Amigos Emprendedores, tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos (Maria, Lisbeth y Patricia). La socia se dedica a la venta de ropa en el centro comercial “San José” en la calle Trinitarias de la ciudad Cusco. Lorenza nos cuenta que ella trae ropa de la ciudad de desaguadero como por ejemplo casacas. Ya son 10 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone su trabajo. La socia requiere el crédito de los 800 soles para comprar útiles escolares. La socia también nos cuenta que cuando empieza la campaña escolar guarda su mercadería de ropa y arreglar su tienda para vender útiles escolares. 
        
Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
The “AMIGOS EMPRENDEDORES” (ENTERPRISING FRIENDS) communal bank is in its 9th loan cycle; it is composed of 15 hard-working persons who are always seeking opportunities to get ahead in life and to provide, through their daily efforts, a better future for their children. They reside in Cusco province, Cusco department. Cusco is a city that is renowned for its historical city center, its scenery and its history; it is an enchanting city in the south of the country. The members are involved in a variety of commercial activities. Some sell clothing, others sell food. Others sell clothing or school supplies and some are tourist guides. The communal bank has had several loan cycles and the members state that they are happy and satisfied with the credit services, the savings and the training they receive. They are particularly happy with the savings they can accrue by leaving their funds in a common account over time. Lorenza is a member of the Amigos Emprendedores communal bank. She is 45 years old, married, and has three children (Maria, Lisbeth and Patricia). She sells clothing in the “San José” shopping center on Cusco’s Trinitarias street. Lorenza tells us that she brings the clothes, like coats, from the city of Desaguadero. She has been in this line of work for 10 years and has done well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. She need and 800 sol loan to buy school supplies. She tells us that when the new school year is about to start, she puts away all her clothing and concentrates on selling school supplies. The members as a whole are grateful for the opportunity granted by this means and pledge to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school supplies.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia  S. is 45 and married with 10 children.  She owns a business venture, selling both food & daily use products in the local community.  Asia  has many years of experience in this business.  Asia  needs a loan of WST $2500 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2007, Asia  joined SPBD.  This is her 4th loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Asia 's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Haydee Mercedes

texts.es: Haydee tiene un negocio que ella misma administra hace 5 años, empezó trabajando para otras personas, como vendedora y ayudante así pudo aprender  y decidió aperturar un negocio de confecciones de ropa para  niños, además juntamente con su esposo cantan música vernacular algo que hacen desde jóvenes. Estos trabajos les ayudan a solventar los gastos familiares  así como también la educación de sus hijos, sus objetivos son poder cancelar el terreno que obtuvieron con mucho esfuerzo y emprender una  pequeña empresa de confecciones. El préstamo obtenido lo invertirán en comprar telas e hilos para su nueva temporada de confecciones. La Sra. Haydee esta agradecida con el préstamo.
texts.en:
Haydee has a business that she has been managing herself for five years. She started working for other people as a salesperson and an assistant. That way she was able to learn. She decided to open a business making children’s clothes. Also, she and her husband sing vernacular music. They have done this since they were young. These jobs help them pay the family expenses. They also pay for their children’s education. Her objective is to be able to finish paying for a piece of land that they got through much effort. She wants to undertake a small clothes making company. She will use the loan to buy fabric and thread for the new season of making clothes. Haydee is grateful for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric and thread

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim Y., 58, is an older woman who lives with her husband and seven of her children in Takeo province. She grows rice, but her plantation is just enough to support her family members. Her husband is a fisherman. He catches and sells fish at the local market. On average, he is able to make about US$ 2.50 in profit a day. Three of the children are in school, while two are construction workers. 

Every month, Kim Y. spends about US$ 30 on food, US$ 5 on utilities, US$ 15 on her children's education, US$ 5 on family transportation and another US$ 15 on miscellaneous. So to reduce their transportation costs, Kim Y. needs to take out a loan to purchase a motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert L. is from Annafunan West, Tuguegarao City. He is 39 years old, married and has 1 school-aged child. Robert owns and operates a business providing transportation services in the local community. Robert has been involved in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Robert joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Robert is requesting his first loan, of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Lezeil

texts.en: Lezeil A. is from the village of Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 27 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Lezeil owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Lezeil joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Lezeil is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Lun

texts.en:
Mrs. Lun L. (pictured above), aged 55, is a widow with four children: two sons and two daughters. Two of them are married and live outside the family home, one is a driver and the other one stays at home. The family lives aL. National Road Number six, about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Lun has been selling chickens and ducks for 15 years. She hopes to expand her business to be able to get extra income to support her family. Therefore, she is asking for her first loan of $250 to purchase chickens and ducks for resale.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and ducks for resale.

loans.name: Abil

texts.ru:
Adil rodilsya v 1989 qodu.On ne jenat. On jivet v Absherone regione so svoyey semyoy. Adil uje 2 qoda v etom businesse. Adil molodoy i eto u neqo noviy bizness. On sam soderjit mamu i svoyu sestru kotoroy 16 let. Eta mashina ostalas emu ot otca .

Seychas Adil nujdayetsya v sude 2000 AZN chto bi kupit zapchasti dlya eqo mashini, Chtobi koqda on yexal v Derevni eqo mashina ne portilas po doroge potomu chto koqda mashina portitsya po doroge kliyende bolshe ne yezdat na etoy mashine peresajivayutsya na druquyu a on ne xochet teryat svoix kliyentov. On shitayet chto eta ssuda emu ochen pomojet. 

Tak on smojet uderjivat svoix kliyentov, posle cheqo u eqo budet rasti pribil, i on xochet v budushem vidat zamuj sestru i samomu jenitsya.
texts.en:
Adil was born in 1989. He's unmarried and lives with his family in the Absherone region. He's been in business for two years; he's young and it's a new business for him. He's the sole means of support for his mother and sixteen-year-old sister. The taxi was left by his father. Adil needs 2000 AZN to buy spare parts for his taxi, so that when he takes it out of town it doesn't break down on the road. If if does, his customers won't come back, but will go elsewhere, and he doesn't want to lose his clients. He imagines the loan will help him quite a bit. If Adil can support his clients, business will grow. He hopes that in the future his sister will get married, and he'll marry, too.

Translated from Russian by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy the spare parts to repair his taxi

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina B. is from the village of San Roque, Enrile, Cagayan. She is 56 years old. Adelina is married and has eight adult children. Adelina owns and operates a business providing recycling services. The main source of income for the business comes from hauling plastics & other recyclables for local businesses and community members. Adelina has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2005, Adelina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Adelina has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. Adelina is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional plastics & other recyclables to sell. This loan will be the tenth loan taken out by Adelina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional plastics & other recyclables to sell

loans.name: Celerina

texts.en:
Mrs. Celerina C. is from the barangay of Catadman in Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is the 62-year-old wife of Epefanio. They are blessed with 2 children, one who is married with a family and the other who is an office worker. Celerina runs a sari-sari (variety) store, earning about PHP 1,000 a month while her husband earns about PHP 6,000 as a construction worker. Their children also help out with finances in times of need. 

Celerina joined PMPC in 2005 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and from her previous business. Celerina has successfully repaid a PHP 3000 loan and is now requesting her fourth loan, for 4000 PHP, to purchase housing materials needed for renovation and repairs.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy housing materials for renovation and repairs.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: Fatmata B. I. is married to a driver and has 2 dependents.  She sells materials for different types of sport in the central market of Makeni city. Fatmata has 25 years of experience in her sporting goods business, which was initially financed by her husband. Fatmata has a good loan repayment history.  She needs a loan of 3,000,000 SLL to buy more items for her shop and hopes to use the proceeds of her loan to educate her children and to buy a  piece of land.

loans.use: To buy more items for her shop.

loans.name: Thuan

texts.en: Thuan T. N. is 49 years old with two children. She runs a small restaurant that serves breakfast and lunch to residents of the neighborhood. She is a professional cook so her restaurant is always crowded with customers. She earns 130.000 VND profit per day.  She is always very good about repaying her loans from the Seda credit program. Now, she is requesting a loan of 8,066,000 VND to invest in her restaurant.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba A. sells panties, dresses and body creams at Elmina. Araba has been through junior high school. She is married and has two children. She is responsible for feeding the family. Her loan will be used to buy various body creams for sale. She hopes to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: buy various body creams for sale

loans.name: José Nolberto

texts.es: El Sr. José Nolberto R. es originario del municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón, se desempeña como director del colegio Monseñor Bosco de dicho municipio donde tiene 12 años de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda con el que compraría cerámica.
texts.en: Mr. José Nolberto R. is from the Santa Rosa del Peñón municipality.
