He works as the principal of the Monseñor Bosco School of the same municipality, where he has been employed for 12 years.  This is the first loan he requests with Ceprodel, which he intends to use to make improvements to his home such as buying ceramics/tiles.

loans.use: To purchase ceramics/tiles.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily D. R. is from the village of Brgy. Vista Alegre, Bayombong,Nueva Vizcaya. She is 51 years old. Emily is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Emily owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling variety of different products in the local community. Emily has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Emily joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emily has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Emily is requesting a new loan of 18000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Emily from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the  business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Hanna

texts.en:
Hanna is a married woman with five children, all of whom have graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For over ten years, she has operated her retail shop, rental house and water vendor businesses; neighbours and passersby being her potential customers. Hanna faces a major challenge of delayed payments from creditors who take goods on credit. She hopes to purchase a matatu (fourteen passenger van) in the future. 

She decided to join Yehu to get education on business management and to access loans to boost her business. With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase 4 sacks of rice for her retail shop.

loans.use: To purchase 4 sacks of rice for her retail shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en:
Seraphine is 24 years old and is married with 2 children who are 2 and 4 years old. She lives in Kanazi district, where she owns a shop selling a variety of goods, as her photo indicates. Her business is open from 5 am to 8 pm every day.

Seraphine's current profit is too low to expand meaningfully, but she believes that a small amount of additional capital would positively change her life. For that reason, Seraphine is requesting her first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to purchase a variety of goods to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida L. is from Mantic Tangub City. She is 51 years old. Nida is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Nida owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Nida has been engaged in her business for over 10 years, and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Nida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from GDMPC. Nida is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Nida from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

loans.name: Peris Osoro

texts.en:
For five years, Peris M. has practiced farming (both dairy and horticultural) in Kahawa Wendani, just a few kilometers from Nairobi city centre. Besides farming, she also runs a posho mill and rental houses.

She is 59 years old and widowed, with one son. Peris supports her son and his wife, two grandchildren, and also a sister who is physically challenged. This is her first loan from KADET LTD and she plans to buy more animal feed and complete a rental house.

The expected income from the business after this loan she will use to pay back the loan and complete her house by doing some finishing upstairs. Peris hopes to succeed and ensure that her grandchildren have a good education in the future.

loans.use: To buy animal feed, and complete rental houses.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es: Efraín, de 32 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Noria (29) y sus tres pequeños  hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.Trabajando muy duro Efraín ha logrado que sus chacras se vuelvan muy fértiles y productivas. Todos los días labora con dedicación en sus tierras, haciendo que sus cultivos sean cada vez mejores. Lo cosechado lo lleva a vender al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Pichanaki, donde generalmente recibe muy buena paga. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar, ya  lleva seis años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos a zonas alejadas. Con el tiempo, espera comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar sus plantaciones y aumentar sus ganancias.Es  el segundo préstamo de Efraín con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal, es un socio muy responsable y siempre esta al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en el grupo.Efraín tiene planeado invertir  los dos mil soles solicitados, en la compra de  abono e insecticidas, para sus tierras, y espera mejorar su producción.
texts.en: Efraín, age 32, is a very simple and hard-working man. He lives in his own house, together with his wife Noria (29) and his three small children, for whom he wants to provide a better quality of life. By working very hard, Efraín has been able to make his fields very fertile and productive. Every day, he works in his fields with dedication, constantly improving his crops. He takes his harvest to sell at the wholesale market of the city of Pichanaki, where he generally receives very good earnings. What he likes most about his work is cultivating his crops. He has done this work for six years already, and he thinks the hardest part is transporting his products to distant areas. Over time, he hopes to buy new land to expand his plantings and increase his earnings. This is Efraín's second loan with MFP; he has been very punctual with his previous payments and he plans to continue in the same way. In his communal bank, he is a very responsible member who always keeps up to date with the agreements made by the group. Efraín plans to invest the two thousand Peruvian soles he is requesting in buying fertilizer and insecticides for his fields, and he hopes to improve his production.

loans.use: Buying fertilizer and insecticides to improve his crops

loans.name: Soltonbek

texts.en:
Soltonbek S. is 55 and married. He and his wife have six children. Their youngest son lives with them and helps in the household.   

He and his wife earn their living through livestock breeding, which they started in 1995. They began this activity with the sum of 20,000 KGS and managed to maintain the farm with sheep, horses and milk cows. Using the revenue from reselling fattened livestock,  Soltonbek was able to pay for the education of his elder daughters.
 
Soltonbek works hard to make this business successful and now plans to develop it with the help of a loan of 50,000 KGS. With the revenue from this investment, Soltonbek wants to pay for the education of his younger sons. In the future, his family plans to enlarge their number of cattle. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors. Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a 28-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating 2 businesses: meat vending and livestock trading She lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.

Analyn now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 in order to help fund business operations. This will be her 3rd loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 5,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Analyn hopes to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to theNWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to fund business operations

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida S. is from the village of Maslog, Balbagon, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 43 years old, married and has 1 adult-aged child. Aida owns and operates a food stall, making and selling a variety of Filipino dishes such as pancit bihon, sampayna, humba and nilagang baka in the local community. She also operates a retail store selling assorted products. Aida has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2011, Aida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aida is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional ingredients for her dishes and to increase working capital. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Aida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients and to increase working capital

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en: Jean Damascene is 28 years old, and he has two children who are 2 and 6 years old. He is a moto-taxi driver, and he is requesting a loan in order to buy another motorcycle for using in his business. With the profits he plans to feed his family.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle for his business

loans.name: Jorge Antonio

texts.es: El sr. Jorge es una persona joven emprendedora, quien vive en casa de sus papas,  antes trabajaba como chofer asalariado  y con el esfuerzo de su trabajo y un financiamiento  indica que  logro comprar su propia movilidad, actualmente esta afiliado a un sindicato de transportistas en taxi de la ciudad de el alto. El tiene su propia familia que por razones de salud  su esposa radica temporalmente en el departamento del Beni con sus dos pequeños. La meta que el se trazo es ahorrar y darles una vivienda propia aquí en el alto para que su familia nuevamente este reunida, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en el arreglo de su movilidad ya que esta presentando algunas fallas y esto le ocasiona problemas con los clientes ya que no les puede llevar a su destino así que con el dinero del crédito pondrá a su movilidad en mejores condiciones, el Sr. Jorge Esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mr. Jorge is a young person with entrepreneur's spirit. He lives with his parents, used to work as a contracted driver but now has his own vehicle. He shared with us that thanks to his work he was able to buy it and is presently a member of the Drivers’ Union in the city of El Alto.

He has his own family, his wife and their two small children are temporarily living in the Department of Beni for health reasons. His goal is to save and give his family its own house in the city of El Alto so that they can all be together again.

The loan will be utilized to repair his vehicle, because it has some mechanical faults and they cause problems with his customers. The loan will make it possible for Mr. Jorge to get his vehicle in better condition. He is grateful with the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Chea was born in 1956 is a widow with three children. Two of her children are seamstresses in the garment factories one is a laborer. Mrs. Chea is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land which she uses to grows rice and corn for a living. She would like to grow rice in the dry season but does not have enough money. Mrs. Chea is therefore asking for a loan to hire laborers to plow her land and buy fertilizer and pesticides to grow rice and corn.

loans.use: to hire farm labor and buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ESTRELLA D. OROPESA”; Este banco está ubicado en el poblado D. Oropesa,  provincia D. Quispicanchis y  departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Guillermina; es  viuda; la socia tiene 58 años D. edad; la socia tiene 4 hijos los cuales son ya independientes, la socia tiene un pequeño kiosco D. venta D. golosinas y pasteles en el colegio D. la comuna, la socia elabora tortas y sándwich, ella también hace gelatinas, pasteles, jugos y refrescos. La socia requiere el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra D. productos para implementar el kiosco. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. golosinas y otros para el kiosco.

La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. dicho préstamo D. forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Sra. Guillermina is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen Estrella D. Oropesa” which is located in the village of Oropesa in Quispicanchis Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 58 years old, widowed, and has four children who are already independent. Guillermina has a small kiosk at the local school where she sells candy and pastries. She also makes cakes, sandwiches, gelatin, juices, and soft drinks. Guillermina needs a loan to invest in the purchase of products for her kiosk. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy candy and other products to restock her kiosk.

Guillermina is extremely grateful for this loan and promises to complete her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase candy and other food products.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: La señora Lourdes tiene una tienda donde comercializa cosméticos para damas . El crédito lo requiere para comprar: rubores, lápices  labiales, cremas, así podrá  aumentar su capital, sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos. Vive en alquiler la misma esta ubicada en la zona de Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz;  es soltera y no tiene hijos. Esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Lourdes has a store where she sells women’s cosmetics.  She needs the loan to buy blush, lipstick, and creams.  That way she will be able to increase her capital and her sales in order to increase her earnings.

She rents where she lives in the Alto San Pedro zone in the city of La Paz.  She is single, and she does not have children.

This is the first time that she has requested a Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy blush, lipstick, and creams for her business of selling cosmetics.

loans.name: Tessito Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé le 10 juillet 2002. Il est composé de 07 femmes issues du même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame KHADY qui est à gauche de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 36 ans. elle est Mariée et mère de quatre enfants et de trois autres qui lui sont confiés par proches.

Elle fait un petit commerce de légumes. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d'activité pour avoir pratiquée depuis environs trois ans.

Ce prêt lui permettra de financer son activité de vente de légumes.

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
This group was created July 10, 2002. It is composed of seven women who come from the same neighborhood. Their main activity is retail.

Khady, on the left side of the picture with the raised hand, is the group's leader. She is 36 years old. She is married and a mother of four children, with three others who have been left in her care by relatives.

She retails vegetables. She has significant experience in this business, since she has been active in it it for about three years.

This loan will allow her to finance her vegetable retail activity.

Her objective is to support her husband in providing for the family.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Pedro Alejandrino

texts.es:
Pedro Alejandrino tiene 54 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y los hijos, vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SEÑOR DE LA SALUD, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Soloma, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandia, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz

Pedro se dedica a la agricultura la siembra de maíz y arroz, las compras las realiza en Ventanas y las vende en las ferias de todos los días en especial  la de los domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos  y la variación del clima. Su sueño es comprar mas terreno para seguir trabanjo y dejar a los hijos de herencia.

Le gusta hacer deporte y reunirse con la familia.
texts.en:
Pedro Alejandrino, 54, is married and lives with his wife and children in the Ventanas Canton in the province of Los Ríos.

The communal bank "SEÑOR DE LA SALUD" is located in the Soloma District in the Echeandia Canton.  The group is involved mainly in agrilcutural activities with short-cycle crops such as corn and rice.

Pedro grows corn and rice and makes his purchases in Ventanas.  He sells his products in the fairs held everyday, especially on Sundays.

He is requesting a loan to buy seeds and feritilizer, which will help him acquire the necessary supplies.  He is up against challenges such as insect plagues and crop illnesses, as well as climate variation.  His dream is to buy more land so he can keep working and leave his children something to inherit.

He enjoys sports and getting together with family.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with two children. Francisco has a shop that sells mainly coconuts for copra. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy coconut for copra.

Francisco has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Francisco hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts for copra.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana de 42 años reside en la localidad de Palcamayo. Como madre soltera se caracteriza por ser una persona responsable y muy dedicada que cuida de sus 2 hijos: Rocío y Anderson, a los que quiere mucho. Como mujer trabajadora y luchadora, todas las mañanas se dedica al cuidado de sus cultivos de arveja, espinaca y zanahoria, productos que cuida con mucha dedicación y esmero. En todo este tiempo pudo adquirir sus propios terrenos agrícolas, más la demanda que genera las verduras en el mercado de la ciudad; le obligan a alquilar otros terrenos para sembrar en mayor cantidad. Paralelo a esta actividad, se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de verduras a la capital del país donde viaja desde hace 12 años. Su trabajo consiste en la compra de diferentes variedades de verduras y hortalizas, los cuales en unión con su propia cosecha. Lo comercializa al mercado “La parada”, de la capital donde según sus propias palabras “termina de vender en 2 horas”, menciona. Ahora ha sembrado espinaca que cosechará dentro de una semana. Le va muy bien en su negocio y sus aspiraciones son mayores, pues quiere abrir una tienda de fertilizantes y abono en su localidad, donde la mayoría de sus pobladores son agricultores. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen María” y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donde agradece su colaboración, ya que le ayuda a seguir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Juana de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en completar sus ahorros para la compra de 5 bolsas de semilla de arveja de la variedad letrilla, que cuesta un promedio de S/. 850 cada una.
texts.en: Juana is 42 years old and lives in the town of Palcamayo. As a single mother, she is characterized by being a responsible and very dedicated person who takes good care of her 2 children, Rocío and Anderson, whom she loves very much. As a hard-working and persistent woman, every morning she works in her fields growing peas, spinach and carrots, which she cares for with great dedication and effort. Over the course of time she was able to acquire her own agricultural lands. With the current demand for vegetables in the city's market, she also needed to rent other lands to plant in greater quantities. Parallel to this activity, she works buying and selling vegetables in the country's capital, where she has been traveling for the past 12 years. Her work consists of buying various kinds of vegetables and produce, which she combines with her own harvest. She sells them at the market in the capital called "La Parada," where, as she mentions in her own words, she "is finished selling in 2 hours." Now she has planted spinach, which she will harvest within a week. Her business is going very well for her, and her aspirations are great: she would like to open a store selling compost and fertilizers in her town, where most of the inhabitants are farmers. She belongs to the “Virgen María” communal bank. This is her sixth loan with MFP, and she is grateful for this support, since it helps her keep advancing toward her goals. At the same time, she is once again committed to fulfilling her payment schedule, as with the previous loans she had. She also appreciates being part of her communal bank, because all of its members are responsible people with a great sense of solidarity. When she receives this support, Juana will invest the funds she is requesting to add to her savings to buy 5 bags of pea seeds of the Letrilla variety, which cost an average of 850 Peruvian soles each.

loans.use: to buy 5 bags of pea seeds.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent, 32, has operated his food kiosk in Naivasha town for the last six years. He is married to Mary and they have two school-going children.

He was introduced to KADET by one of their field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan to restock his food kiosk with cooking oil, flour and sugar, items which he buys in bulk.

In the future, he hopes to expand his food kiosk and open a bigger kiosk where he can serve many people at the same time.

loans.use: to buy cooking fat, sugar and flour in bulk.

loans.name: Fausto Antonio

texts.en: Fausto lives in Tegucigalpa, Honduras, where he makes a living by selling construction supplies. He has run this business for the last 11 years and owns a dump truck for delivering sand and gravel. Faustino is requesting a loan of 15,000 HNL to purchase inventory.

loans.use: to purchase gravel, sand, bricks, and cinder blocks.

loans.name: Celsa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA 3”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Celsa; ella tiene 47 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de pollos y pescados, ella vende en el mercado de Urubamba desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia también tiene sus tierras de cultiva donde siembra hortalizas, repollo y culantro y luego los vende en las diferentes mercados, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de pollos y pescados y también para mejorar las tierras de cultivo. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pollos y pescados y también para comprar semillas para las tierras de cultivo.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This loan applicant belongs to the “SAYHUA 3” Community Bank. This bank is located in the Urubamaba district in the Urubamba province in the department of Cusco. This member is named Mrs. Celsa. She is 47 years old and lives with her partner and their three children. This member varies her daily activities between businesses. One of the businesses is selling chickens and fish. She sells these in the Urubamba market from 6:00am until 6:00pm. She also has cultivated farmland where she grows plants like cabbage and cilantro. She sells these items in various markets. She would like to increase her fish and poultry sales business and also improve her farmland. She is asking for this loan in order to buy chickens and fish and also buy seeds for her farmland.
This member is happy to have the opportunity to have this loan and promises to pay her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy chicken and fish and also seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en: Pablita is 51 years old. She's married with only two children. She lives in Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. Her children are already working. Pablita has been in a buy and sell business for 13 years. She a dealer of Avon and other beauty products. She earns 5,000 PHP a month just for this business alone. She's been a member in the cooperative for almost four years. Eight times she was able to take a loan from PMPC. She's a good paying member. She wants these loans to be able to purchase more products and to be able to earn more.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es: Blanca Estela D. 39 años D. edad, habita en casa propia junto con su compañero D. vida en zona cercana a la ciudad. Ella se dedica al comercio. Gracias a sus habilidades ha logrado establecer una tienda en su hogar D. residencia la cual ha mantenido durante  mucho tiempo y es la que le ha permitido tener acceso a mejores ingresos los cuales le han ayudado a mejorar su calidad D. vida. Se destaca entre la competencia por poseer artículos que en ninguna otra tienda se hayan, ya que ellos, los va a comprar ella personalmente al proveedor. Blanca es una mujer ejemplar, trabajadora y emprendedora la cual no se cansa D. trabajar. Ella sueña con ver su negocio florecer y poder satisfacer a una mayor demanda que le permita mejorar sus niveles D. venta. Para esto ha tomado la decisión D. solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL con el fin D. comprar variedad D. productos: aceite, arroz, azúcar, frijoles, detergente, golosinas, etc. que le permitan atraer a mas clientes y por consecuencia lograr su sueño.
texts.en: 39 year old Blanca Estela lives in her own home along with her partner. Their home is close to the city. Thanks to her abilities, she has been able to establish a store in her home and has been running this for a long time and this is what has enabled her to make a good income which in turn has enabled her to improve her quality of life. She stands out among the competition for having items for sale that the other stores don't have and she buys these personally from the supplier. Blanca is an exemplorary woman, hardworking, and enterprising who never tires of her work. She dreams of seeing her business flourish and having the satisfaction of greater demand that will enable her to increase her sales. For this reason, she has taken the decision to request a loan from INTEGRAL with the goal of buying a variety of products: oil, rice, sugar, beans, detergent, sodas, etc, that will let her attract more clients and so achieve her dream.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products: oil, rice, sugar, beans, detergent, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Meralyn

texts.en: Meralyn is a married woman with four children. The oldest child is 21 years old while the youngest is only three. Meralyn and her husband are both farmers. They grow rice to sell to their community. Meralyn's husband mainly manages their farm, while Meralyn focuses on selling fresh fish at her town's market. Meralyn does her best to augment their income and sustain their family. She plans to use her loan to purchase farm inputs and more fish to sell. She hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and more fish to sell

loans.name: Odo Trust Bank Group

texts.en: Esther is 44 years old. She is divorced and has three children. She has been selling roasted plantains and yams at Nyamebekyere, a suburb of Berekum, for the past two years. She deems it a big opportunity to expand her business. She wants to use the loan to buy more yams and plantains to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve sales so she can save more for her children’s education and also add another business. Esther belongs to the community group called “ODO” which means Love Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to the loan and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase plantains and yams in bulk

loans.name: Víctor Guadalupe

texts.es: El Sr. Víctor, es un empleado de una tienda de auto partes, él y su apreciable esposa acudieron a la institución para solicitar un préstamo para comprar un portón para su vivienda ya que su casa actualmente  no  cuenta  con  uno  y nos  comenta  que  desea  brindarle  más  seguridad para su niño pequeño de cinco años, posteriormente quieren pintar el exterior de  su  domicilio, agradece  el  apoyo  brindado para  la realización de  su proyecto.
texts.en:
Victor is an employee in a repair shop. 

He and his sensible wife came to the institution for a loan to buy a gate for their house as they currently do not have one. He tell us that he wants to give his little five year old son more security. 

At a later time he wants to paint the outside of his house. 

He is grateful for the support that helps him with this project.

loans.use: to buy and to pay for installation of a security gate for his house.

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
This is Bonifacia, 67, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is a widow, and mother of five children.  All of them are already working and have their own families.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Bonifacia operates a dried fish stall. What she basically does is buy dried fish from a wholesaler and then repack them and sell them per piece/pack at a profit. Products can range from dried fish to dried anchovies and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php14,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Bonifacia dreams of expanding her store and helping her children through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of dried fish needed in her business

loans.name: Gloria Esperanza

texts.es:
Gloria, vive con su familia, conformada por su esposo y un hijo, ella administra una tienda en la que ofrece D. toda clase D. productos necesarios en un hogar, la idea fue D. ella, para ayudar a su familia, lo atienD. D. 6:00am a 8:00pm.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la inversión en el negocio, comprara mercadería como jabón, detergentes para lavar ropa, trastos, papel higiénico, la inversión le ayudara para crecer y poder atender la demanda D. los clientes.
Su objetivo es llegar a tener el negocio fuerte, que atienD. a todos los clientes D. la zona, convirtiéndolo en un minisúper.
texts.en:
Gloria lives with her family composed of her husband and son.  She runs a store that stocks all sorts of items needed in the home.  The idea was hers to help her family and she’s open from 6am until 8pm.

She’s asking for a loan to invest in the store.  She will buy merchandise like soap, laundry detergent, kitchenware and toilet paper.  The investment will help her grow and meet customer demand.  Her goal is to have a strong business that meets the needs of all the zone’s residents turning it into a mini supermarket.

loans.use: to buy soap, laundry detergent, kitchenware and toilet paper.

loans.name: Wilmer Jhony

texts.es: El joven wilmer tiene 22 años es conviviente tienes un hijo de 2 años de edad, actualmente trabaja Chef es decir cocinero en un prestigioso restaurante, por las noches estudia gastronomia, Wilmer nos cuenta que no es facil estudiar y trabajar a su vez, pero su motivacion para salir adelante son su hijo y esposa, Wilmer solita el prestamo para seguir pagando sus estudios. Sabemos que Wilmer cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Wilmer is a young man who is 22 years of age. He is in a common-law relationship and has a two-year-old son. Wilmer currently works as a chef at a prestigious restaurant. In the evenings, he takes cooking classes. Wilmer says that studying and working is not easy, but he is motivated to succeed on behalf of his wife and child.

He is requesting a loan so that he can continue paying for his studies. The staff of EDAPROSPO knows that Wilmer will accomplish his goals through hard work and great effort, and the loans will be a great help to him.

loans.use: to pay for his cooking courses.

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en: Ivy is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. Ivy has a shop that sells canned goods, beverages, and snacks such as halo-halo (flavored-ice salad). She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks. Ivy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ivy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks

loans.name: Martha Liliana

texts.es: Martha  de 21 años vive con su hijo de 2,  en el municipio de Puerto Colombia, lugar ubicado a orillas del mar donde tradicionalmente habitan extranjeros poetas, artistas que se inspiran en este lugar. Marta es la propietaria  de una miscelánea donde vende regalos, tarjetas piñatería perfumes y variedades femeninas y para el hogar que son una necesidad de los habitantes de esta población. Su negocio se divide en dos locales en una está su miscelánea y en el otro un café internet donde ofrece servicios de fotocopiaje, fax, telefonía celular y llamadas locales e internacionales.  Su negocio funciona desde hace 4 años y sus ventas siempre se han mantenido con una tendencia creciente, porque además es un punto de recaudo un banco, donde puede pagar su cuota de préstamo y de servicios públicos. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el comprara ropa, juguetería porque son las mercancías de mayor salida en el fin de año lleno de fiestas y alegría familiar, donde usualmente se incrementan sus venta y lograría él éxito de su inversión.
texts.en:
Marta is 21 years old and lives with her two year old son in Puerto Colombia, located along the sea, where foreign poets and artists live and are inspired.  Marta owns a boutique where she sells gifts, cards, piñatas, perfumes, feminine items, and things that people need around the house.

Her business is divided into two locations; one is the boutique and the other is an internet café, where she provides photocopy, fax, cell phone, and local and international calling services.  She’s been in business for four years and it’s been growing, because she also offers bill paying services and people can go there to pay on their bank loans or utilities.

This Kiva loan will be her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy clothing and toys because these are the things that sell best at the end of the year, which is full of parties and family glee.  Sales usually go up and this will make her investment successful.

loans.use: to buy clothing and toys.

loans.name: María Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Proyecto 2003 se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo (Manta), este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, tiene 24 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen una niña de 4 años de edad. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le agrada por la rapidez con que salen los créditos.

Ella es una muy buena madre y ama de casa que además se dedica a preparar y vender bocadillos y comida rápida como: empanadillas, panes de almidón, corviches, y jugos de frutas entre otras cosas. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 15h00, como su casa está muy cerca de una escuela de la localidad tiene bastantes ventas, lleva dos años en este negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va utilizar para comprar aceite, plátano, maní, frutas y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos.
 
Su sueño es tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
Proyecto 2003 Communal Bank meets every two weeks in Jaramijo (Manta) canton, a place known for its pretty beaches that bathe the shores of this beautiful place.  The majority of the residents here are very hardworking and work in maritime jobs.

Here we met María.  She is 24 years old and married, and has a four-year-old daughter from this relationship.  Her husband is a fisherman.  This is her second cycle in the communal bank and she likes it because the loans are granted so quickly.

She is a very good mother and housewife who also works preparing and selling snacks and fast food such as turnovers, cornbread, "corviches" [a dish made from green bananas and fish], and fruit juices, among other things.  She works every day from 8:00 until 5:00.  Since her house is very close to a neighborhood school, she has many sales.  She has been in this business for two years and it is going very well for her.

She is going to use this loan to buy oil, bananas, peanuts, fruit, and other supplies to prepare the food.
 
Her dream is to have a big restaurant.

loans.use: to buy oil, bananas, peanuts, fruit, and other supplies.

loans.name: Byambasuren

texts.en:
Mr. Byambasuren is a 46-year-old who lives with his wife and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He was employed as a welder before, but the salary wasn’t enough to meet his family's necessities, so he started driving a taxi four years ago. Beyond the taxi business, he services cars for more earnings. 

Byambasuren’s wife is pregnant and is going to give birth soon. He is very worried about his old house’s condition as the new baby is coming. The loan he is requesting will be used to repair the roof and other parts of his house.

loans.use: To repair the roof and other parts of his house.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Carmen tiene 65 años de edad, vive en el barrio San Antonio con sus dos nietos y se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tiene mas de 3 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, sus clientes le visitan a su casa para comprar las tortillas, no sale a vender por su edad,  ya no puede andar caminando bajo el sol, pero muchos clientes la prefieren porque sus tortillas son grandes y sabrosas.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de maiz, leña, cal y agua.
Su meta es poder tener una pulperia fuerte en su casa.
texts.en:
Carmen is 65 years old and lives in the neighborhood of San Antonio with her two grandchildren.  She makes and sells tortillas for a living, which she has been doing for more than three years.  Her customers come to her house to buy her tortillas; she doesn't go out to sell them because of her age.  She can't go walking around in the sun anymore, but many of her customers prefer her because her tortillas are big and tasty.

She will use her loan to buy corn, firewood, lime, and water.

Her goal is to have a solid grocery store in her home.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime, water, and firewood

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en: Eduardo is married with two children. He is 59 years old and lives in Upper Centro, Tudela. Eduardo is a farmer and grows rice crops to earn a living. He has been doing this for 20 years. Eduardo has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional fertilizer for planting crops. He has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Eduardo hopes to send his children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizer for planting crops

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
Born and raised in El Paso, Texas, Jorge and Felix operate Beta Group, an electrical company. With zero working capital, Jorge opened the hometown business three months ago, offering electrical services, and after only one month was able to hire his business partner, Felix. 

In their business, Jorge and Felix offer security accessory installations and general electrical work. They plan to hire additional team members to provide better service coverage for the city, but currently work together on all projects. 

With more than 20 years of experience in commercial, industrial and federal government projects, Jorge describes the business as a “perfect balance of high-quality project management, installation, maintenance, and analysis.” However, to further their business, they needed a loan to cover start-up costs. After a referral from Chase Bank, they ventured to Accion Texas Inc. for a loan to fund insurance, workers’ compensation bonds, and licensing to better secure contracts. 

With Jorge as the primary borrower and Felix as the coborrower, the team were approved for $5,475.

They are beginning by offering services starting at $65 and allowing their company to be competitive in their industry. Through their experience, Jorge and Felix expect their business to profit $125,000 within their first year.

loans.use: to purchase workers' compensation bonds and insurance, and to cover start-up fees.

loans.name: Tojiddin

texts.en: Tojiddin is 25 years old. He is married but has not any child. He lives with her wife who is a housewife and parents. Tojiddin is a student of the Islamic University of Tajikistan. Tojiddin studies well. He is one of the best students. He is going to learn Islam well to teach other people. He must to pay for his tuition but he has not enough money for it. He is asking for a loan of 725 USD to pay for tuition. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Dieu Est Grand Iii Group

texts.fr: DIEU EST GRAND III est un groupe  est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Anne Mariannick, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 24 ans a fréquenté l’école. Anne Mariannick est mariée à un certain Laurent. Le couple a un enfant, scolarisé et à leur charge. Anne Mariannick vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par son mari. Anne Mariannick vend des mèches, des chaussures et des tissus depuis sept ans environ. De façon secondaire, Anne Mariannick vend également des produits vivriers ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses propres besoins.  Anne Mariannick s’approvisionne à Lomé au TOGO et au NIGERIA. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Anne Mariannick sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DIEU EST GRAND III, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des mèches, des chaussures et des tissus.

loans.name: Mujeres Triunfadoras De Micaela Bastidas Group

texts.es: 7 mujeres  responsables de distintas actividades comerciales  todas ellas las integrantes del grupo comunal “MUJERES TRIUNFADORAS DE MICAELA BASTIDAS”, una de ellas es la Sra. Reyna  de 51 años de edad casada  y con 1 hijo. La Sra. Reyna se dedica  hace 22  años al negocio de VENTA DE ROPA.  La Sra. Reyna  nos cuenta que ha llegado a fidelizar a sus clientes lo cual le generando ingresos  para cubrir los gastos de su casa.  En el futuro le gustaría confeccionar ropa para poder vender sus productos  y obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en comprar más mercadería (ropa en general) para poder tener más ingresos. La Sra. Reyna es la primera de la izquierda que se encuentra sentada la cual lleva un polo blanco con mangas largas. A la vez se despide con un abrazo de Kiva y  Edaprospo  diciéndoles que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
Seven responsible women with different commercial activities are members of the Mujeres Triunfadoras de Micaela Bastidas community bank. One member is Reyna, who is 51 years old, married, and has one child. For 22 years, Reyna has worked selling clothing. Reyna tells us that she has gained the loyalty of her customers, which generates income to cover her household expenses. In the future, she would like to sew clothing to sell her products and earn more income.

With the loan provided, she will invest in the purchase of more merchandise (clothing in general) so she can earn more income. Reyna is the first on the left, seated, in a white shirt with long sleeves. She takes her leave with a hug for Kiva and Edaprospo, telling them that she will meet all of her proposed goals.

loans.use: to purchase clothing.

loans.name: Rumen

texts.en:
Rumen H. has rich experience inn restaurant business. For over 17 years he had worked as a warehouse manager in the ex-state catering company. The company was closed and he decided to start a business.

He rents premises and makes it a restaurant. This restaurant works more then 10 years. It is situated on a trade center of the city.

Rumen H. is married and has two sons. They all work in the restaurant. His wife is a cook and the boys are waiters.

Now Rumen wants to make some repairs in his restaurant nad needs $ 1 600.

loans.use: For repairs and equipment of the restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renovate and expand her restaurant

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
This entrepreneur has a small shop that sells mobile devices. He got married six months ago and feels he has a big responsibility to his family. Therefore he needs to develop his shop and increase his income through this business. This loan is his first experience with Microfinance.

In his own words, "I feel I will be able to get a loan, pay it back...and increase my income." He wants to be a competitor in the area and be the first mobile shop buying and bringing new and modern types of mobile devices.

Note: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, etc.).

loans.use: Buying new kinds of mobile devices and developing the shop

loans.name: George William

texts.en:
George William is 59 years old. He is married with three children, a boy in University, a girl in primary school grade seven and the last boy in primary school grade four. He is an electrician by profession. He opened a shop which deals in electrical materials especially those used in wiring houses. He has 19 years experience.

He requests a loan of US $1200 to purchase more stock; i.e., electric wires, earth load, extension cables and many more items. When he increases the stock, he will attract more customers, increase the sales and the profit margin will go up.

He plans in future to open a spare parts shop for bicycles, which are in high demand in the area. He plans to pay back the loan within a period of 8 months.

loans.use: To increase  stock of electrical supplies

loans.name: Maria Petrona

texts.es:
Maria is an artisan who weaves wraps, bedspreads, comforters and handkerchiefs. She is 23 years old, married and has three children. She goes to the nearest city to sell her items to wholesalers. Maria is part of a collective with two other artisans, María Gómez Vásquez and María Hernández Jiménez. With the loan, they plan to purchase thread and fabrics at wholesale and in this way save on expenses and improve their earning margins.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

MARIA PETRONA , es artesana , teje chales , colchas, cubrecamas y servilletas , tiene 23 años , casada , tres hijos , para vender su mercadería viaja a la ciudad más cercana y las ofrece a los mayoristas . Forma parte del grupo Clavel 1 junto con doña María Gómez Vásquez (artesana) y doña María Hernández Jiménez (artesana). Con el préstamo invertirán en la compra de hilo y géneros al por mayor y de esta forma ahorrarán en los gastos y obtendrán mas ganancias.

loans.use: Purchase thread and fabrics

loans.name: Tina

texts.en: Mrs. Tina O. is 40 years old, married with five children, and lives in Asaba Delta State. Her business is selling provisions and foodstuffs. She would like a loan of $800 to increase her store's inventory. She has been in LAPO for 3 years and started her business in the year 1996.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en:
Mrs.Lorn C., 47, and her husband have been married since 1998. They have seven children, ages 4-30. Two are still in school, but the others are grown and working. Lorn is a farmer and weaver, two skills she utilizes seasonally. She learned to weave from her mother when she was a girl and has now passed on that skill to her own daughter. Her husband also farms.

Lorn is presently requesting her fourth loan through MAXIMA in the amount of $1,000. She will use this loan in part to pay for the plowing and preparation of their fields. Lorn has already sprouted her tomato, watermelon and potatoes, and the transplants are growing quickly in the shaded area she's prepared in front of her home. She will also purchase papaya for planting. Everything is almost ready to plant and she estimates it will take nearly a month to get everything in the ground. It will then be 3 months before she can begin picking the vegetables and a full year for the papaya to produce fruit.

In the meantime, they will support the family with money from the loan, and to provide an added source of income, a portion of this loan will also be used to purchase silk materials and pay for the preparation of the loom for her daughter to weave.

loans.use: Buy raw silk and prepare fields for planting

loans.name: Amancio

texts.es:
Amancio is 50 years old. He works hard in his small farm of fruits, which for a long time has become the main source of income to provide for his beloved children. The responsibility to fulfill the rolls of father and mother in his home was very difficult . When he was told that he was going to have his first baby he was very happy and he has been since then.

His children are his motivation to keep working hard in obtaining every time better fruits in his harvest. Amancio’s new goal to start in the coffee production, since he did a business research and found out that the investment of the other families members of his community has been very profitable. He ask for your support to reach his desire to continue working for the well-being of his four beloved children. He ask for $525 that will pay off in six months.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva volunteer.

Amancio a sus 50 años, trabaja fervientemente en su chacra de frutas, la cual desde hace mucho tiempo se ha convertido en la principal fuente ingresos económicos para sus queridos hijos, la responsabilidad de cumplir los roles de padre y madre en su hogar era muy dificultoso pero no imposible ya que desde que le informaron que iba a tener su primer bebé estuvo muy feliz por la buena.La retribución diaria de sus hijos a través del inmenso cariño que le manifiesta impulsa a Amancio a seguir trabajando como hasta ahora para obtener cada vez mejores frutos en su cosecha y además para plantearse el nuevo reto de su incursión en la producción de café ya que durante meses realizo un estudio y se dio cuenta que la inversión de las otras familias miembros de su comunidad ha sido muy rentable..Requiere de vuestro apoyo para alcanzar su deseo con el deseo de seguir trabajando para bienestar de sus cuatro queridos hijos.

loans.use: Expand and capitalize his business

loans.name: Jessica Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mrs. Jessica M. sells food that she has prepared herself. She makes it in her own home and then transfers it to a local market, called Santa Ana de Chinandega, in order to sell it.

Jessica has had her business for three years. She began the business with a small amount of personal savings that she had been collecting since she was very young. She started selling food on the outskirts of the market on benches in which she offered outdoor meals or picnics. Before starting this business Jessica worked as a housewife, but her difficult economic situation led her to begin a food-sales business.

Nowadays Jessica has obtained a more comfortable space so that she can spread out her things with sufficient room to be able to sell her foods. Jessica has three children and she has been struggling hard for many years to educate them. They are studying in elementary school, and their only means of support is Jessica’s business.

The institution Ceprodel has given Jessica a hand by helping her grow the business. She has received a total of 18 loans over three years which have had a direct impact on her business.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

La actividad de la sra. Jessica es la venta de comida preparada por ella misma el cual la elabora en su hogar de habitación y luego la traslada al mercado Santa Ana de Chinandega para comercializarla.

Tiene 3 años de tener su negocio y se inicio con un bajo monto producto de ahorros personales que almacenaba desde muy joven. Ella inició vendiendo comidas en las afueras del mercado en unas bancas en las cuales ofrecía alimentos al aire libre. Antes de tener este negocio trabajó como ama de casa pero la difícil situación la impulso a implementar este negocio.

Hoy en día la señora Jessica ha conseguido un lugar bastante cómodo ya que puede extender sus enseres con suficiente espacio para poder vender los alimentos. Ella es madre de tres hijos que por mucho tiempo atrás ha venido luchando fuertemente para educarlos ya que están estudiando la primaria y su único medio de sustento es su negocio.

La institución Ceprodel le ha brindado una mano apoyándola en el crecimiento financiero de su negocio desde hace 3 años con un total de 18 créditos los que han tenido impacto directo en su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase food

loans.name: Dany

texts.en:
Dany runs a food stand in the neighborhood of Parta Alta in the city of Tarapoto, San Martin. She sells “Juane” (rice and chicken wrapped in a palm leaf), fried rice, french fries, and hot dogs. She prepares food daily to sell in the evening on the corner of a busy intersection near her house.

Dany is 36 years old, married, and has two children. Her children are young, so she is happy that she can work from home during the day and spend time with them. She started the business 5 years ago to help earn money for her family and gain some independence. She now has many loyal customers and an active social life. She says she gets to meet people from all over the region, which she really enjoys. One day she would like to save enough money to send her children to university.

A member of the community bank Las Orquidias, Dany is requesting a loan of $425 to repay over 6 months. With the loan she would like to buy new tables, plates, and cups so she can serve more customers.

loans.use: She would like to buy new tables, plates and cups

loans.name: Anthonia's Utulivu 2 Group

texts.en:
Anthonia is 27 years old and is a single woman with 1 child, 3 years old. Anthonia is business and trading woman; she started in 2008. Everyday, she works from 9am to 10pm at her business.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more inventory for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Joyce and Asha, who have salons.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Nusreta

texts.en: Nusreta is a housewife from the town of Derventa. She is married and she has 3 children. Her husband works and he is earning  around  600 KM (about US$ 480) monthly. Nusreta will use this loan in the amount of US$ 975 to renovate the space in which she is growing mushrooms. Her wish is to start up a business selling the mushrooms in order to earn additional money for her family.

loans.use: To renovate a space to grow mushrooms

loans.name: Halil

texts.en: H. Halil is 32 years old. He is married and has three adorable children. He works hard to give them a good education and to make them happy. Halil is a market vendor. He sells houseware like dish and plates, tea sets, tea towels, and thermoses. He has been in this business for five years. His eldest son helps him with the business. His store is located in the central local market “Panjshanbe”. The business is successful and generates stable income, allowing Halil to support his family. Now Halil wants to increase the range of goods sold and he requests 1000 $ US Dollars for the term of 6 months. Halil would like to thank everyone for supporting him and promises to repay the loan in time.

loans.use: Purchasing of the house ware like dish and plates, thermoses, tea towels, tea sets in order to increase the range of goods.

loans.name: Ramota

texts.en:
Ramota B., 33, sells kitchen utensils, a business that she has had for the past eight years. She lives in shibiri, Lagos state, Nigeria with her husband and four children.

She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past two years. She is requesting a loan to buy more kitchen utensils for her business. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more kitchen utensils for resale

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy O. is 29 years old and married with a child. She lives in Benin City. She sells shoes and bags. She travels to Lagos State to buy shoes and bags and sells them to customers in Benin City. Mercy needs the loan amount of US$ 525 to buy more shoes and bags for sale. Mercy expresses her gratitude to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and bags for sale

loans.name: Than

texts.en: This is the third time that Mrs. Than S. has asked for a loan to improve her living conditions. She owns a small grocery store in Preak Roka Village in Kandal Province. Her husband, Mr. Tun Vuthy, is a construction worker who earns a small income to support the family. Mrs. Than S.’s family has little money and they cannot afford to build a new house. Therefore, she has decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy timber to build a new house for her family. Mrs. Than S. has four children one of whom works in a garment factory while the other three are enrolled in school. Previously, Mrs. Than S. had obtained a loan to start her current business and she has now paid it back.

loans.use: to buy timbersto build a new house for her family.

loans.name: Dario

texts.es:
El Señor Dario de 28 años de edad vive desde hace 4 años con la señora Sandra, el matrimonio tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad.

Don Dario, desde pequeño trabajaba en la carpintería con su padre. En el 2004, fue cuando decidió emprender su propia carpintería con un pequeño ahorro con el que contaba y un poco de ayuda que recibió de sus padres. Actualmente esta fabricando roperos de 4 y 5 puertas ya que estos artículos tienen mayor circulación y le deja mayor porcentaje de ganancia.

Como sueño personal desea ampliar más su carpintería para poder poner a la vista los refinados muebles que fabrica y de este modo dar a sus cliente una mejor atención.

El cliente solicita el crédito para la compra de madera, terciadas y clavos.
texts.en:
Dario is 28 years old and is married to Sandra. They've lived together for 4 years and have a 2 year old boy.

Ever since he was a little boy, Dario worked at the carpenter's workshop with his father. In 2004, he decided to open his own carpenter's workshop with a little savings and some help from his parents. He's currently making 4- and 5-door wardrobes as they are in demand and he is able to make more money.

As a personal goal, Dario would like to expand his workshop in order to display the refined furniture he makes, and that way, serve his customers better.

Dario is soliciting a loan to buy lumber, plywood and nails.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lumber, plywood and nails.

loans.name: Chin

texts.en: Mrs. Chin Y. was born in 1962 and lives in Dock Por Village in Takeo Province. She owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn her living. Her husband, Mr. Hoy Loem, is a cow vendor who buys cows for breeding and re-sells them later at better price. This business is going well and they want to expand it so she would like a loan of $250 to buy a cow for breeding. Mrs. Chin Y. hopes to increase her income and improve their living conditions by selling the cows. Her husband appears with her in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: María De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
La señora María P. es originaria de la bella ciudad de León donde actualmente se dedica a laborar en la venta de frutas y verduras.
Desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana ella abre sus puertas para iniciar con la comercialización de los perecederos y desde el momento que abre su establecimiento, es visitada por los clientes que demandan de las frutas y verduras.

Como todo negocio en desarrollo, el negocio de la señora P. requiere de inversión y para ello ha solicitado un crédito en CEPRODEL para la compra de los perecederos y de esta manera continuar con el negocio que es su único sustento.
texts.en:
María P. is originally from the beautiful city of León where she works selling fruit and vegetables. During the early hours of the morning she opens her doors to start marketing her perishables and from the moment that she opens her establishment, she is visited by clients that demand the fruit and vegetables. Like all developing businesses, Mrs P.'s business requires investment and for this she is requesting a credit with CEPRODEL to buy perishables and in this way continue with her business, which is her only support.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de las frutas y verduras

loans.name: Mohammad Nasim

texts.en:
M. Nasim lives in district 1 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and lives with his own nuclear family. He is the only one to support his family. He has a retail shop and he has been involved in this business for more than 5 years. During this time he has attracted some good numbers of customers. He would like to make his business stronger, and therefore he needs some money.

He has requested an individual loan of 30,000 Afghani with a term of 12 months to complete his stock and start working hard to be more successful in his business. Nasim said, "I am sure that after a period of time I will be a good retailer."

He is happy.He wants to thank AFSG for this process of loans in Afghanistan that helps the poor people in this country to become successful and help their families to educate their children. In future, he wants to thank lenders around the world.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Sam-Un

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam-un M., 58, is a widow with one daughter who is a silk weaver. Her daughter was married and lives with her. The family lives on an island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sam-un has been a silk weaver since she was twelve years old, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell at market in Phnom Penh. Now, she is requesting a loan of $250 to purchase silk material to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Florencia Teofila

texts.es:
Florencia empezó con su tienda de abarrotes y gaseosas desde hace un año y medio año. El local que alquila es parte de la casa de su madre en Comas; tuvo que organizarse así por que donde vive ella su negocio no es rentable. A parte de la tienda, Florencia también vende cosméticos.

Empezó sacando préstamos de otro banco, pero hace un mes se animó a juntarse a las alcancías comunales de EDAPROSPO gracias a su hermana que le contó de las posibilidades de ahorros que vienen con los préstamos. 
Mientras que su esposo, maestro de construcción con contrato de trabajo, se encarga de pagar por la luz, la electricidad y la comida, a sus treinta y nueve años Florencia es responsable de cubrir los demás gastos, el gas, útiles que falten de la casa, y los consumos de sus dos hijos de quince y diez años.

En el futuro le gustaría agrandar su tienda, amoblarla, y ponerle algo de seguridad, puesto que ha sufrido un robo hace poco y quiere evitar estar en riesgo.
texts.en:
Florencia began her soft drink and general store a-year-and-a-half ago. The business space that she is renting is a part of her mother’s house in Comas. She had to set up her store this way because the business is not lucrative where she lives. Aside from running the store, she also sells cosmetics.

She started out with loans from the bank, but one month ago, she made up her mind to join the community bank of EDAPROSPO thanks to her sister, who told her about the chances of savings that come with the loans. While her husband, a construction worker with a contract, pays for the electricity and the food bills, 33-year-old Florencia is responsible for covering the rest of the expenses, such as the gas bill, other utilities, and anything that their children, ages 15 and 10, may need.

In the future, she would like to expand her general store, furnish it, and install security equipment because she was recently robbed and would like to avoid being at risk.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks and other beverages

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia D. is 45 years old from Malalinta, San Manuel, Isabela.  Her husband Rogelio Sr. is a farmer in their village.  Their marriage was gifted with four children: Grace - 23 years old, high school graduate and working as a domestic helper in Dubai; Glenda - 18 years old, college student; Gretchen - 17 years old, high school student and Rogelio - 15 years old also a high school student.  She is thankful that \her eldest daughter assists them with their financial needs.  

Rice farming has been their main source of income.  But aside from it, she also ventured in the hog raising business as an alternative source of income.  She believes that the business could be of great help for them especially in providing the educational needs of her children.  Cecilia is requesting a loan of PHP 4, 000.00 to sustain her hog raising for she do not want to depend too much from the remittances of her daughter abroad.  She intends to use the loan to buy feeds for the hogs.  

Cecilia said that one could earn income on her own as long as she works hard.

loans.use: To sustain her hog raising business

loans.name: Fahari Yetu Group

texts.en:
Saidi J., age 40, is married with five children ages 16, 13, 9, 7 and 4.  He has a garage which he started in 2000.  He works from 8am to 7pm, daily. Saidi is able to earn a monthly profit of around $336. 

This will be Said’s sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the five loans to increase stock by buying spare parts, compressors and paint and has paid the loans back successfully.  He now hopes for a new loan to increase capital  and to buy more spare parts.

Said will share this loan with subgroup C of the Fahari Yetu group.  The subgroup has six members who run cafes and general stores.  These members hold each other accountable for repaying their loans.  In the picture, Said is the only man.

loans.use: Increase capital and buy more spare parts.

loans.name: Souhayla

texts.en:
Souhayla is a 54-year-old divorced woman who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with her two children. Souhayla has owned an Internet shop since 2004. She requested a loan of 800 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise and change her shop décor. This is her second cycle and she has always paid on time. 
Her previous loan helped her improve her shop. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she didn’t have the startup capital. Souhayla decided on doing her business because she had experience in computers. In the future, she plans expanding her shop.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and change her shop décor.

loans.name: Saroen

texts.en: Mr. Saroen S. is 29 years old and he now lives in Krasang village in Kandal province. He is a farmer who owns a piece of land where he cultivates rice. He is also a construction worker. His wife, Mrs. Sorn Thary, is a tailor in her house. Although this couple tries to work hard, they still can't earn enough income to build a suitable house for their family. Thus, Mr. Saroen S. decided to ask for a loan to add to his savings in order to buy timber to build the house. He has two children who are enrolled in the local school. His wife is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To add to his savings to buy timber to build a house.

loans.name: Reyhan

texts.en:
Reyhan Z. is a 38-year-old woman who is married and has two sons.

Reyhan sells furnishings and women’s perfumes. These items are very popular among young ladies who are going to marry.

Reyhan started her business more that ten years ago when her husband passed away and she stood alone without any source of income. Now she is the owner of her own store and brings up her two sons who are high school students.

Reyhan applied for a $1500 loan to increase the number of the items she sells. Your generosity could help this brave and hardworking woman!

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Shafqat Parveen Fazal Karim Group

texts.en:
Maqbool akhtar baji and Irshad baji each want a loan to repair their auto-rickshaws (local three-wheeled motor vehicles).

Shafqat parveen baji is the group leader of these above mentioned ladies. These ladies belong to a city named Borewala, Pakistan. Shafqat baji is a very good human being and her members respect her a lot.

Shafqat baji runs a clothes-sewing business to share the financial burden of her husband. Her husband runs a grocery shop in the community, with three years experience. She is applying for a loan to diversify her husband’s grocery shop into a grocery store.

loans.use: To diversify her husband's grocery shop

loans.name: Abdul Qudis

texts.en:
Abdul Qudis is the son of S. M.. He lives in Kabul Afghanistan. He is 50, married, and has 6 children. He has 10 years experience in the field of farming and he works hard on his land to earn money for the completion of his family member’s requirements because all of them benefit from the income he generates. 
He would like to take an individual loan of 30000 Afghani to expand his business in order to support his family members in a better way and to purchase seeds and the other required tools for his land.
Finally, he would like to mention that Kiva is such an effective process that can support the entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and required tools for farming

loans.name: Khanthy

texts.en:
Mrs. Khanthy A., 48, and her husband, Mr. Hok Vorn, 58, live on an Island in Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They were married in 1979 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. Their daughter is married and lives in the family home. One of their sons is an air-conditioner repairman, and the youngest son attends university.

Khanthy has been a silk weaver since 1980, a skill she learned from her parents. Her husband is a farmer. In addition, the couple also raises pigs. Khanthy asked for a previous loan to purchase piglets and silk materials for her weaving business. She is now requesting another loan of $500 to purchase feed for her pig raising business.

loans.use: To use for raising pigs.

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Домуллоджонова Шахноза занимается пошивом женской и мужской одежды на дому. Своё изделия она оптом сдаёт продавцам на рынке на продажу. После первого займа она расширила свой ассортимент товара и получила хорошую прибыль.У Шахнозы сейчас много заказов на летную одежду, поэтому она хочет досрочно погасить займ и планирует закупить летную ткань на пошив женских платьев и мужских сорочек. Она благодарна кредитором за поддержку её деятельности.
texts.en:
Shahnoza D. is involved in sewing women's and men's clothing at home. She sells finished products wholesale to retailers who then sell them at a market. After her first loan, Shahnoza expanded her goods selection and received a good profit. She now has many orders for summer clothing and, thus, wants to repay her loan early and plans to purchase summer fabric in order to sew women's dresses and men's shirts. She is grateful to our creditors for supporting her business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of summer fabric

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For growing peanuts

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa B. is 54 years old and has thirteen children. She runs a sari-sari (general) store and a rice farm. She has been a Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI) client for quite a long time now.

Ninfa has requested a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI to support her sari-sari store. Basically, she will use the loan to buy additional merchandise to attract more customers in order to increase her sales.

She said she likes CEVI because, aside from charging less interest on their loans, they also bring education to all their clients.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy W. is 57 years old and married. She has three children. She lives in Muguga where she has a dairy farm. She supplies milk to vendors in and around her town and to a dairy plant in the area. She has been in the business for about nine years. 

Nancy has never borrowed from another MFI. This will be her fifth loan with KADET. She intends to use the loan to buy a water pump for her her dairy farm. 

Her future hopes and dreams are to have eight cows in the next three years producing over 80 liters of milk per day. 

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Buying a water pump

loans.name: Harrieth
