texts.en: Harrieth C. is a married Tanzanian entrepreneur. She runs a foodstuffs shop at Tamata ward in Dar es Salaam. She sells a variety of foodstuffs to customers such as maize flour, wheat flour, beans, rice, sugar and cooking oil. She purchases the goods from wholesale and retail shops and sells to retail customers. She uses her business income for her family's daily needs. She has been in business for four years. She needs a loan of Tshs 800,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Maylinda

texts.en:
Maylinda M. is from the village of Poblacion, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years old. Maylinda is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Maylinda owns & operates a manufacturing business. The main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing & selling wood products to local businesses and community members. Maylinda has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Maylinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maylinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Maylinda is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase machinery to expand the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Maylinda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase machinery to expand the business

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah is 32 years old and married with six children between the ages of 3 and 17. All her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members. Hadjah owns a three-room house where she lives with eight people. The family doesn’t have access to electricity or piped water.

Hadjah has a stall where she sells bananas. She pays for transportation costs to and from shopping in Mbarara. On average, she receives thirty customers a day. She works in the outskirts of Kampala.

She has been in this business for six years and with MCDT for seven years, servicing her twentieth loan and working with the same group mates. Her monthly expenses include feeding the family, accommodation and medication. Her business challenges include transportation and the rainy season, which makes movement of vehicles impossible. Hadjah wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas. She wants to see her business grow bigger so she can start selling at wholesale prices only.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Circle Cambodia Sewing Cooperative Group

texts.en:
Five single women in their early 20's recently formed a new sewing cooperative called Circle Cambodia, creating a new chapter in life and a fresh start. These women work together and live together in Phnom Penh, and their bond of friendship runs deep,  as they have overcome incredibe adversity together. 

All of these women come from difficult family backgrounds, namely large single parent families. One of the women was orphaned at an early age and another suffered from abuse. With the assistance of a counter-human trafficking NGO, the women left their families in the rural provinces and moved to Phnom Penh to attend vocational training school. This NGO provides alternative livelihood options for children deemed to be at high risk of trafficking due to vulnerable family situations. Once sewing school was complete, the five women of Circle Cambodia found employment with a woman who ran a small tailor shop out of her home. This woman did provide housing, but unfortunately she made some poor financial decisions and became heavily indebted, and within a short time she started withholding salaries from her employees, using the money to pay down her own debt instead. Without having another place to live, the women of Circle Cambodia were trapped in an exploitative working and living situation. One year later a tailor shop customer found out about the injustice of the working conditions, and she facilitated a way out for the women, provided them with a new place to live and a promise of future business once the women were able to buy their own sewing machines.  

Phany, one of the youngest women in the group, has the most sewing experience. She has been sewing since 2003 and is an accomplished seamstress. She excels at cutting patterns - a skill she is teaching the other group members who started sewing in 2007.  Phany's cheerful personality, friendly demeanor and quite confidence seems to be a unifying force in the group. Phany grew up in Kompong Cham province of Cambodia. Her father died when she was young, which resulted in great financial hardship for the family as Phany's mother tried to support her 10 children. Prior to coming to Phnom Penh, Phany was working in the fields, picking beans, for a wage of $0.75 a day. Phany enjoys sewing, and her outlook on the future of Circle Cambodia is bright. 

Each member of the Circle Cambodia co-operative requested a loan of $145 to be used for the purchase of a sewing machine. The disbursal meeting was filled with excitement, and the women already had plans for an afternoon trip to the market to shop for machines. Circle Cambodia has secured initial orders and they look forward to expanding their business to include Cambodian customers and possibly even foreign customers through an online global marketplace. The women take English lessons for one hour each day, and the women are teaching an illiterate member of the group how to read in the Khmer language. The Circle Cambodia co-operative  dreams that one day their business will be successful enough for them to start training new employees who come from similar vulnerable backgrounds. 

About SIGU:
This loan is the first made by AMK's Special Interest Group Unit (SIGU). As part of the Product Development department, SIGU was developed as an initiative to further reflect AMK’s mission, and to serve more ‘vulnerable’ groups that are currently underserved by microfinance services. These groups include women who are victims of trafficking, domestic violence and other gender-based traumas, people living with HIV/AIDS, street people and children and people with disabilities. AMK is currently focusing on assisting women who are victims of trafficking, domestic violence and other gender-based traumas. Current SIGU projects include developing microfinance specific financial literacy training and creating a pilot credit program specific to this population.

loans.use: buy sewing machines.

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en: Mrs. Ma.Teresa P. is from the village of Lucos, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old, is married, and is blessed with four school-aged children. Ma. Teresa owns and operates a business selling lumber for construction in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for more than five years earning 4,000 PHP net monthly. In 2007, Ma. Teresa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Ma. Teresa is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. This loan will be her 8th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Nyadid

texts.en:
Nyadid M. is currently in the business of selling various items in a shop such as rice,sugar,salt,soap, etc. and is requesting a loan to stock up on more items for her retail shop.  Nyadid is 35 years old and is married with a husband that is a soldier. She has 6 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a wholesale shop.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Replenish more items for her retail shop

loans.name: Hani

texts.en:
Hani S. is a young Palestinian man, 25 years old. He works as a police officer in the Palestinain National Authority.

In addittion to his job, as his monthly salary is not enough to cover his expenses, he owns a small grocery store in his village. At this store he sells, canned food, candy, vegetables, gas cooking canisters, children toys, etc. He appears in the photo at his store.

Hani requested 1,000 USD from FATEN to buy some extra goods for his shop to increase his income.

Hani is still single and lives with his family. He hopes to save some money to build his own house and start his own family.

loans.use: To purchase new goods and products for his grocery store

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La señora Martha R. R., de 48 años de edad vive en el Barrio Pilas Orientales, es casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura  y al comercio, ellos tiene 7 hijos de los cuales los tres mayores viven de manera independiente, los otros dos trabajan en los quehaceres del hogar y tiene bajo la tutela a los otros dos, toda la familia trabaja en la agricultura desde hace 12 años, el principal problema que acoge a los trabajadores de este sector es el poco apoyo de las Entidades Gubernamentales para el sector agrícola dificultando en gran manera la buena asistencia a los cultivos, fue gracias al apoyo de su esposo que la señora logro sacar adelante la cosecha, pero ahora necesita de un capital más fuerte, para poder brindarle un buen mantenimiento al cultivo de piña, con este apoyo, la cosecha sería de calidad pudiendo venderla a un  alto precio, garantizándole a la familia la recuperación del dinero invertido y las utilidades para nuevos proyectos.
texts.en:
Sra. Martha R. R. is 48 years old, married, and lives in the neighborhood of Pilas Orientales. Her husband is a farmer and trader. They have seven children, three of whom live independently. The next two children work by performing household duties. The youngest two children pay attention to their older siblings. The entire family has been involved in agriculture for twelve years. The main problem they have encountered is the lack of support from government agencies. It is difficult to find a great deal of assistance with their crops. Thanks to the support of her husband, Martha was able to move forward with her harvest.

She is now in need of additional capital in order to maintain her pineapple crop. With this assistance, she will be able to harvest a quality product that commands a high selling price. This will guarantee that her family can recoup the money they have invested and use it for new projects.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials & supplies needed to maintain her pineapple crop

loans.name: Alibala

texts.en:
Alibala N. is a 56-year-old man who runs his own barber shop in Agsu city. He is married and has two children who are independent adults now.

Barbering is the only source of income for Alibala and his wife. He thinks that now that his children are grown up and his income allows, he can improve his workplace and make small repairs. For this purpose he applied for 1,600 AZN.

loans.use: To make repairs to his barber shop

loans.name: Eng

texts.en:
Eng S. is a Cambodian rice farmer who has been working in this sector in a village located in Battambang province for more than nine years. Her husband helps her be responsible for their family by working in the construction field. She is aged 46 years and has given birth to three children. Two of them are employed and the other one attends school. 

Eng S. will use this loan to add to her savings and buy a new motorcycle which will enable her to travel anywhere; then she will buy a sewing machine to begin a sewing service for extra income.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Guadalupe Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Guadalupe de edad de 36 años, vive junto a su familia, su esposo y tres hijos que procreo, su esposo se dedica al comercio a la venta de repuestos de vehiculo. El negocio de la señora Guadalupe es la venta de ropa y variedades, pues lleva varios años en las ventas, el cual inicio con venta de zapatos, con ayuda de su compañero y ahorros que tenia. Con los financiamiento de la institución ha venido ah incrementar el negocio pero esta vez lo quiere para comprar materiales de construcción para hacer un cuarto en la parte de atrás del terreno, el cual comprara piedra, arena, cemento, hierro y zinc. Y lograr con esta mejora una mejor comodidad, sus planes es poder aumentar sus ventas y seguir ayudando a sus pequeños para un porvenir mejor.
texts.en:
Guadalupe, 36, lives with her husband and three children. Her husband is a merchant; he sells vehicle spare parts. Guadalupe sells clothing and general merchandise. She has been in this line of work for several years; she started out selling shoes using some of her savings and help from her husband. With the institution's loans she has been able to enlarge her business but, what she needs on this occasion, is to buy building materials to build a room in the rear of her property. She will buy stone, sand, cement, iron and zinc metal sheeting, hoping to increase her comfort level with this addition. Her plans are to continue expanding her sales and continue to help her little ones attain a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn F. is from the village of Curvada, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 40 years old. Jocelyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as vinegar, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jocelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Jocelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by KIVA. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, KIVA created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
El banco Tierra Fértil está ubicado en la comunidad Cochapamba aquí su población en especial la mayor se dedica a la agricultura sembrando principalmente maíz y papas,  también crían  aves de corral y además gozan de  atractivos turísticos como el Río  Maluay cuyo entorno ofrece la posibilidad de disfrutar momentos de recreación para toda la familia bajo el  hermoso paisaje andino.

La señora  Rosa Vásquez es otra de las socias de éste banco, con 37 años de edad se encuentra casada y madre de dos niños de 13 y 14 años, sus hijos estudian en un colegio de la localidad, su esposo era conserje de una clínica pero al momento no se encuentra trabajando, se siente muy orgullosa de poseer su casa propia gracias al esfuerzo conjunto con su esposo


AL momento Rosa se encuentra trabajando como conserje de una clínica actividad que hace un mes comenzó a desempeñar, tiene turnos  de 24 horas y  en sus días libres trabaja lavando ropa ajena  de sus conocidas en ésta labor lleva ya  varios años, mientras que los fines de semana vende comida rápida como  carnes asadas y salchipapas, como es una mujer muy trabajadora siempre está en busca de maneras para ganarse la vida y sacar adelante a su familia.

Es socia activa del banco comunal hace tres  ciclos y le gusta  mucho ya que está conformado  un grupo de amigas y amigos que siempre están en busca de mejores días con el apoyo muto de cada uno de los socios del mismo,  con su nuevo crédito va a comprar pollos, papas, carnes, y otros productos  para la elaboración de sus comidas. Su meta es llegar a tener un mejor espacio físico para aumentar su negocio y adaptarlo para dar un mejor servicio y atraer más clientes.
texts.en:
The bank, Tierra Fértil, is located in the community of Cochapamba. In this area the people work in agriculture. They grow mainly potatoes and corn. They also raise poultry and they enjoy tourist attractions such as the Maluay River. The river, in the beautiful Andean countryside, offers recreational activities for all members of the family Mrs. Rosa is one of the members of the bank. She is 37 years old, married and the mother of two children ages 13 and 14. Her children study at the local high school. Her husband was a doorman at a clinic but now he is unemployed. She is very proud to own her own house, thanks to the efforts of her and her husband. At this moment Rosa works as a doorman at the clinic. She began this job a month ago. She works 24 hour shifts. On her days off she washes clothes for various people that she knows. She has been washing clothes for many years. On the weekends she sells fast food such as roasted meat and pork with potatoes. She is a hard worker and is always looking for ways to earn money and help her family progress. This is her third cycle of activity with the community bank. She likes belonging to a group of women who are always looking towards better days and are always supportive of each other. With this loan she is going to buy chicken, potatoes, meat and other products to use to make her food. Her goal is to have a better physical space to use to grow her business. This space will allow her to provide better service and will attract more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens, potatoes, meats, brochette sticks, and other products that she needs to prepare food

loans.name: Sous

texts.en:
Sous N. H. is 24 years-old and lives with her parents in Takeo province. She is unmarried and works as a garment factory worker. She has been working for about three years and is able to make US $2 each day.

Sous N. H. is asking for a loan of US $600 to fix her leaking roof that poses a problem during the rainy season.

loans.use: To fix a roof leak.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Mr. Ly K. and his wife, Mrs. Phanny Un (pictured), have been married for five years. They have eight children: five sons and three daughters. Five of them attend school, while the other three are still very young. The family lives in a small village off of National Road number Two, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Ly has been driving a Tuk Tuk in Phnom Penh for more than four years. His wife used to sell Phak Lov (a meal cooked with pork) in front of a garment factory, but she left that business, and now runs a new business selling fish. 

Ly’s Tuk Tuk has broken down; it’s upset his business and made it difficult for him to continue earning money. Hence he is applying for a loan of US $200 to make the necessary repairs.

loans.use: To repair his Tuk Tuk

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna V. is from the village of Sampagar, Damulog Bukidnon. She is 46 years old. Lorna is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Lorna owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Lorna has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lorna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lorna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Lorna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nidjat

texts.en:
Nidjat is 29 years old and is an internally displaced person from Karabakh. He currently lives in the Fuzuli region with his wife and two children, aged 5 and 7.

For the past six years, Nidjat has been raising cows and making cheese from their milk, which he sells in the city markets. He says that demand for his cheese is high because it's delicious and all natural.

Nidjat is seeking a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy a cow because he'd like to expand his cheese-making business. He currently has five grown cows and two calves and hopes that with more cows he'll be able to make and sell more cheese.

loans.use: To buy another dairy cow

loans.name: Zahid

texts.ru:
Zahid A. rodilsya v 1986 qodu.On ne jenat .Jivet  v Absheron Region. On jivet so svoyey semyoy. V etom biznese on uje 5 let. Nauchilsya on etomu biznesu u svoyeqo dedushki kotoriy bil ochen xoroshim specialistom svoyeqo dela i mnoqiye predpochitali xodit k nemu v etom qorode. Seychas Zahid toje xochet chtobi on toje   shitalsya takim xoroshim no dlya etoqo ne dostatochna znat svoyu rabotu xorosho no eshe nado chto bi pomesheniye qde on rabotayet bilo akuratnim chistim , chtobi ludam bilo priyatno strichsya tam. 

Seychas Zahidu nujno 2000 AZN chtobi remontirovat pomesheniye dlya uluchsheniye eqo biznesa.
texts.en:
Zahid A. was born in 1986. He is single. He lives in the Absheron Region. He lives with his relatives. He has been in this business for five years already. He learned the trade from his grandfather, who was a real master of his trade and had many loyal customers in his town. Now Zahid would like to also be considered such a master. Yet for this it is not enough for him to simply do his work well; his shop also has to be neat and clean so that people would enjoy getting a haircut there. Now Zahid needs 2000 Azerbaijani Manats in order to renovate his shop so as to bolster his business.

Translated from Russian by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renovations of the facility

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: Yen P., 37, is married and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She weaves Cambodian traditional silk for an income of USD 2.50 per day. Her husband is employed by a company to break stone, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Yen P. is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase more raw silk to produce more silk products. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more raw silk.

loans.name: John Opiyo

texts.en:
John Opiyo is an industrious and enterprising man, aged sixty three. He is married to Rael, a housewife. They have two children: Daniel, 24, who is a welder and Veril, 22, a teacher. 

John has been in the tailoring and dressmaking business for the last twenty-eight years and has vast experience in this art. He can design any kind of clothing and he feels that the speed of his business' growth would have been higher had he gotten access to micro-finance earlier, at the start up of his business. 

He is taking his third loan from Kadet after successfully completing two previous loans without default. He plans to use the loan to buy more clothing materials. He anticipates making profits this month of August because parents will be buying school uniforms for their children in preparation for the next semester. 

He also plans to use part of the loan to buy agricultural products to sell, like fruits and vegetables which are in high demand. He wants to do this to generate more income and also as a part of diversifying his business.

Apart from operating his current business, he dreams of becoming a leading supplier of fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring materials.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose J. is currently in the business of selling charcoal at home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal and some bags of maize to sell. Rose is 38 years old and is married, with a husband who is a businessman. She has two children who both go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a charcoal store.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal and some bags of maize to sell

loans.name: Arilyn

texts.en:
Arilyn T. is from the village of Dicoyong. She is 33 years old. Arilyn is married and has 6 children; 4 are still studying and 2 are already married. To make a living, Arilyn owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling baked goods in the local community. Arilyn has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Arilyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Arilyn is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Arilyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

location.town: Sindangan - Dicoyong, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Nor

loans.name: Yiyo Group

texts.es:
El grupo Yiyo está con formado por tres mujeres trabajadoras y esforzadas  una de ellas es Olga Marina L. vende leña desde hace 6 años. Ella tiene la meta de invertir en otros negocios como una pequeña venta. 
 
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Iveth L. comercializa ropa hace 5 años y Maritza O. L. vende pan desde hace 4 años.
texts.en:
The Yiyo Group is made up of three hard-working and spirited women. One of them is Olga Marina L., who has been selling firewood for six years. She has a goal of investing in other businesses, such as a small store. The other members of the Yiyo Group are Iveth L., who has been selling clothing for 5 years, and Maritza O. L., who has been selling bread for four years.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy firewood to resell

loans.name: Minor

texts.es: Minor tiene la edad de 32 años, es soltero, y vive con sus padres. El crédito lo quiere para comprar las insumas para el buen mantenimiento de la siembra de tiquisque, una comida tipica de America Latina que proviene de la familia de papa. Además, desea obtener mejores cosechas y aumentar la cantidad de producción. Él cuenta con 1 hectárea el cuál ya esta sembrada y la tiene que asistir con las insumas para buena cosecha. Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron.. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Minor is 32 years old, single, and lives with his parents. He wants the loan to purchase supplies to care for his tiquisque crop, a typical Latin American food that comes from the potato family. In addition, he wants to have better harvests and increase his production. He has one hectare which is already planted and he has needs the supplies for a good harvest.

This is the first loan that Minor has received from FUDECOSUR and he is very pleased with the services that they have provided him. In the future, he hopes to provide his family with a better quality of life and greater financial stability, as well as to continue growing as a person and as a farmer.

loans.use: To tend to his tiquisque crop

loans.name: Mak

texts.en:
Mak S., age 40, is a farmer who has run a farming business for many years. She and her husband, Mr. Khoeun, age 48, have five children, two of whom are grown and employed in an industrial factory, where they earn their own salaries. Mak S. and her husband, who is presently employed in a construction project, normally earn an average of $7.50 per day to help cover their family’s daily living expenses. 

In addition to her farming endeavors, Mak S. is currently working as an ice-cream vendor in and around her community in order to earn extra income. She exerts herself a great deal by pushing her cart such distances every day, and she dreams of having a vehicle with which to pick up and sell her product, but she has no financial means to do so at present. Therefore, Mak S. would like to take out a loan to buy a secondhand motorcycle, which she plans to attach to her existig ice-cream vending cart.

loans.use: To buy a secondhand motorcycle to connect to her ice-cream vending cart

loans.name: Hosiyat

texts.ru: Азизова Хосият жительница Яванского района. Возраст, 35 лет. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Муж находится на заработках в России. Сама Хосият не имеет высшего образования. Работает на рынке. Продает одежду и обувь. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 10 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения ассортимента товара. Она намерена привести сезонные товары.
texts.en: Hosiyat A. lives in the Yavan region. She is 35 years old. She is married and has three children. Her husband is now working in Russia. Hosiyat does not have higher education. She works on the market and sells clothing and shoes. She has been in this business for more than ten years. She is asking for a loan to increase variety of her merchandise. She plans to bring in seasonal goods.

loans.use: To increase variety of merchandise

loans.name: Kang

texts.en:
Kang C., 30, lives in the rural area of Phnom Penh city. She is a local farmer who spends at least eight hours each day working in the field. Her husband is a domestic rice trader who buys rice in bulk from people in the village to store in his stock supply and then sell it for profit. The couple has two children who are unmarried and in school. 

Kang C. knows that her husband is having difficulty traveling to buy rice in and around her community because his motorbike is very often broken. She is therefore requesting a loan to buy a used motorcycle as a replacement.

loans.use: To buy a used motorcycle

loans.name: Dishoni

texts.en:
Dishoni is a married man with one child who is still too young to attend school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are for food for his family and rent. 

He has operated a video library shop for the past two years; his potential customers are neighbors and passersby. Dishoni faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He hopes to open a wholesale shop to sell videos. With the KES 20,000 he plans to purchase a bundle of the latest movies for his video shop. He joined Yehu because of the availability of sustainable financial services.

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of the latest movies for his video shop.

loans.name: Piyinento

texts.en: Piyinento is a sixty-six-year-old married man with three children.  He lives in a permanent house in the district of Kyenjojo, Uganda, and has a dream of educating his children.  He wants to be a large wholesale supplier of beer and soft drink. Piyinento wants a loan to purchase beer and soft drinks.

loans.use: To purchase beer and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet A. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala west region of Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children.  Four of her children are currently in school.  Annet has a business of a retail shop, which she has had for 3 years.  She owns a hotel as her second business.  

To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase sugar and stock food.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Annet hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.  In the future, Annet hopes to own a plot.        Annet is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving on business.

loans.use: To purchase sugar and food stock

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia tiene 39 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en uno de los caseríos que conforman el distrito agrícola de Mórrope, una zona poblada por gente humilde y bastante trabajadora que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar confeccionando diversas prendas de vestir en base a pedidos. Ella cuenta con un pequeño taller de costura instalado en su domicilio, allí ella confecciona camisas, blusas y pantalones en base a los pedidos que le realizan sus vecinos y eventualmente un acopiador que le hace pedidos de confección al por mayor. Ella complementa su trabajo ofreciendo el servicio de reparación de prendas de vestir dañadas. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le sirven para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Eugenia desea adquirir materiales como telas e hilos para poder ampliar su negocio y aumentar sus ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los cuales espera lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Eugenia is 39 years old and married.  She lives with her husband and her children in one of the settlements that make up the Mórrope agricultural district.  It is a zone populated by humble and very hard-working people.  It is in the Lambayeque province, which is over an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

She works making different articles of clothing by order.  She has a small seamstress shop set up in her home.  She makes shirts, blouses, and pants by orders from her neighbors.  Sometimes retailers place wholesale orders with her.  She compliments her work by offering repair service for damaged garments.

The income that she gets from this business activity helps her to assist her husband keep up with the family finances.

Eugenia wishes to get materials like fabric and thread to be able to expand her business and increase her sales.  Therefore, she believes it is advisable to request a loan from Edpyme Alternative for 1,000.  With the loan she hopes to achieve her objective.

loans.use: To get materials like fabric and thread to be able to expand her business

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CENTRAL PATAQUEHUAR”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Quiquijana, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Andrea; ella tiene 32 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de frutas, ella vende distintas variedad de frutas como manzana, naranjas, uvas, plátanos entre otras frutas, al socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de frutas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar frutas al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of communal bank named "Central Pataquehuar". It is located in the district of Quiquijana, belonging to the province of Quispicanchis and in the department of Cusco.

Her name is Andrea. She is 32 years old, married, and the mother of 4 children. She alternates her daily activities with her produce business. She sells a variety of fruits such as apples, grapes, bananas, and other fruits. She works from 8am to 5pm. She wishes to expand and improve her produce business. She requests a loan to purchase fruit in wholesale. 

She is happy to receive a loan and she is committed to making the payments of that loan.

loans.use: To purchase fruits in wholesale.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a married man with four children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

He has been operating a boda boda (motorcycle transport) business for the past two years.  His neighbours are his potential customers. Stephen faces a major challenge in the seasonality of demand in his business.  The rainy seasons makes motorcycle transportation difficult. He hopes to own a matatu (public van) to provide transport services in the future. 

With the 20,000 Kshs, he wants to purchase another motorcycle. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase another motorcycle

loans.name: Muthoki

texts.en:
Muthoki N. is a hardworking woman who sells charcoal in Kangundo along Machakos Road. She has been in this business for seven years and earns a monthly profit of KES 10,000. She is 42 years old and a single mother with three children. 

Muthoki has never borrowed from any other MFI and she is applying for her first loan after being introduced to KADET LTD by a Credit Officer. She intends to use the entire loan amount to buy more sacks of charcoal for sale. Muthoki intends to use the additional income from the proceeds of this loan to buy food and to pay her children's school fees. She hopes to develop her business and to own a lorry to transport charcoal to other town centers in the future.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Dan

texts.en: Dan is a sixty-seven-year-old enterprising married man.  He has four children and lives in his own permanent house in Kyenjojo, Uganda.  He has been engaged in agriculture for four years.  He started with two acres of land but now farms on six acres.  His ambition is owning about fifty acres. Dan needs a loan to prepare land for farming.

loans.use: To prepare land for farming

loans.name: Virginia Monserrate

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Juan  se reúne cada 15 días en el Barrio San Juan de la ciudad de  Manta, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Virginia, ella tiene 21 años de edad, está casada  y de esta relación tienen un hijo de dos años de edad. Su esposo trabaja de reciclador. Este es su segundo ciclo  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le sirven de mucha ayuda.

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que además de esto también se dedica al comercio, vende joyas de fantasía. Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja todos  días por las mañanas ya que como nos cuenta es más fresco para realizar su trabajo, ella  a veces tiene que llevarle a su pequeño hijo cuando sale a vender y otras veces lo deja con su mama pero eso no es todos los días, esto a veces le resulta muy duro pero ella sabe que lo hace por su bien de su familia. Sus productos los compra en una distribuidora en Manta.

Este crédito es para comprar joyas de fantasía como cadenas, pulseras, anillos, aretes, etc.

Su sueño es que a su familia no le falte nada en especial a su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
The San Juan Communal Bank meets every fifteen days in the neighborhood of San Juan in the city of Manta. This place is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited throughout the year by foreign and domestic tourists. Most of the residents engage in fishing or work at other jobs that are tied to the sea.

In this place one can find Sra. Virginia. She is 21 years old, married, and has a two year old son. Her husband works as a recycler. This is her second loan with the Communal Bank and she enjoys the fact that the loans have been a great help.

Virginia is an excellent homemaker who also has a retail business selling costume jewelry. She sells door-to-door and works every day during the morning hours because the weather is cooler. Usually she takes her young son with her when she goes out to sell and on other occasions she will leave him with her mother. During those times it is difficult for her to be separated from her son, but she knows that she has to do it for the good of the family. Her products are acquired from a distributor in Manta.

This loan will be used to purchase costume jewelry pieces such as necklaces, bracelets, rings, earrings, and other items. Her dream is for her family to not lack anything, especially for her young son.

loans.use: To purchase necklaces, bracelets, rings, earrings, and other items.

loans.name: Dib

texts.ar: ديب اعزب وعمره 33 سنة يعمل في بيع وتربية المواشي له في عمله هذا 20 سنة يحب عمله ويريد ان يطوره يحلم في بناء عائل كبيرة يكون اساسها جيد ومتين وقائم على مدخول جيد يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء اغنام جديدة وشراء اعلاف للغنم فهو يربي الماشية بحب فهو مزارع اصيل يعمل بكد ونشاط له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة وقد ساهم القرض السابق من تطوير العمل شراء عدد اكبر من المواشي يحلم بأن يصبح صاحب مزرعة كبيرة تضم عدد اكبر من المواشي والدواجن وغيره من الحيوانات
texts.en: Dib is 33 years old and single. He works raising and selling livestock. He has 20 years of experience in this line of work. He likes his work and is looking for ways to develop his business. He dreams of starting a big family on a solid financiA. foundation. With a loan from A.-Majmoua, he would like to increase the number of sheep on his farm, as well as buy feed for his sheep. He takes good care of his livestock as he is an authentic farmer with a strong work ethic. He has a good history with A.-Majmoua, and he used his last loan to effectively develop his business by increasing the number of animals on his farm. He dreams of one day owning a big farm on which he will raise a large number of livestock in addition to other animals.

loans.use: to buy feed for the sheep on his farm and to increase the number of sheep he raises on his farm.

loans.name: Cristina Ana

texts.es:
Doña Cristina Ana T. B., es casada, tiene 48 años de edad, estudio los estudios primarios, tiene 3 hijos, 2 de los cuales estan estudiando, se dedica al comercio, a la venta de ropa tipica y ropa casual para hombres mujeres y niños, lleva 13 años de experiencia en este oficio, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien le ayuda a mejorar su negocio.

Decide solicitar un crédito a ASDIR para incrementar su capital de trabajo, para la compra de mercaderias para la reventa, blusas, cortes, fajas, pañuelos, sueteres, playeras, etc.  Espera ver su negocio en un futuro mas grande y con mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Doña Cristina Ana T. B. is 48 years old, married and completed elementary school.  She has 3 children, 2 of which are still in school.  She has a business selling traditional and casual clothing for men, women and children.  She has been doing this for 13 years and has the support of her husband who helps her to improve her business.  

She is requesting a loan with ASDIR to increase her working capital and purchase clothing such as blouses, shorts, belts, scarves, sweaters, shirts, etc.  She hopes that her business will be much bigger in the future and that her income increases.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to resell.

loans.name: Akouvi Viviane

texts.fr: Elle est en couple avec un chauffeur et mère d’un enfant. Revendeuse  de maïs  et de charbon de bois, elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays, puis revend après  à son domicile. Elle a 32 ans et  cherche à apporter de l’aide à son mari dans l’éducation de leur enfant.
texts.en: This lady has a partner who is a driver, and she is mother to one child. She is retailer of corn and charcoal, and she gets her supplies inland, reselling them afterwards from home. She is 32 years old and is looking to help her husband out with their child's education.

loans.use: to buy charcoal and corn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy accessories and to have maintenance work carried out on his motorcycle

loans.name: Angel Eugenio

texts.es:
En la ciudadela nueva california de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Jerusalén.
 
Aquí conocimos a Ángel él tiene 25  años, mantiene una relación de unión libre y fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 7 y 11 años, los mismos que estudian la mayor en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su mujer es comerciante.

El se dedica a la venta de periódicos y revistas, tiene un puesto en la ciudad de Portoviejo, trabaja todos los días desde 06h00 hasta las 12h00. En las tardes también se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, lo cual lo hace puerta a puerta, nos cuenta que lleva poco tiempo con la venta de ropa pero que le ha dejado muy buenos ingresos y ha hecho muchos clientes en poco tiempo. Lleva varios años que se dedica a la venta de periódicos y solo tres meses a la venta de ropa. La ropa la va a comprar a Guayaquil cuando lo necesita.

Este crédito lo va a invertir para ir a Guayaquil a comprar pantalones, camisas, camisetas, ropa de niños y blusas. Lleva en el Banco Comunal cuatro ciclos y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy amables y divertidas.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que donde vive es arrendado.
texts.en:
The “Nueva Jerusalén” (New Jerusalem) communal bank meets every fifteen days in the Nueva California neighborhood of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.

We met Ángel, 25, here.  He is in a relationship and they have two children who are 7 and 11 years of age.  Both go to school; the oldest is in secondary school and the youngest is in elementary school.  His wife is a merchant.

He sells newspapers and magazines.  He has a stand in the city of Portoviejo.  He works every day from 6am until noon.  In the afternoon he also sells all sorts of clothes door to door.  He tells us that he’s only been selling clothes for a short time but is doing very well and has acquired many customers in a short time.  He’s been selling periodicals for many years but only three months selling clothes.  He goes to Guayaquil to buy clothes whenever he needs to.

This loan will be used for a buying trip to Guayaquil to buy pants, shirts, t-shirts, children’s clothing and blouses.  He’s been in the communal bank for four cycles and likes it because his fellow members are very kind and lots of fun.  His dream is to have a house of his own since he currently lives in a rented house.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Raaouf

texts.en:
Raaouf is a 33 year old married man, father of two children. He has worked as a car mechanic for the past three years, when he opened his own car maintenance garage.

Raaouf is a man with a good reputation, recommended by most of his customers. To improve his business, Raaouf has requested a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary hardware and spare parts for cars.

Raaouf works hard to provide the best living for his family, in addition to expanding his business more and more.

loans.use: to buy necessary hardware and spare parts for car maintenance.

loans.name: Marixza Lorena

texts.es: Marixza Lorena tiene 36 años de edad, es casada, tiene un hijo de 5 años de edad y reside en el Municipio de Patuca. Para subsistir ella inició vendiendo nacatamales y luego de un tiempo y de algunos ahorr, decidió darle un giro nuevo a su forma de ganarse la vida y actualmente se dedica a la siembra, cosecha y venta de Yuca. Tiene dos manzanas de Yuca sembradas y en estas fechas el clima es lluvioso por lo que trabaja diariamente de 6:00 am a 4:00 pm. Con el prestamo solicitado comprará formula 18-46-0, urea, abono y pagará mano de obra.
texts.en: Marixza Lorena is 36 years old, married and has a five-year-old son; she lives in the town of Patuca.  To subsist she started out selling Nacatamales (Nicaraguan style tamales) and after a time and with some savings she decided to change her way of earning a living and now farms manioc to sell.  She has two manzanas (Central American land measure) planted with manioc and because this is the rainy season she works every day from 6am until 4pm.  She will use the requested loan to buy Formula 18-36-0, urea and manure and to pay labor costs.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Kazem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 33 years old, married and has two children.
K. has owned a sound recording studio since 1999. He has deep expertise in this field, a good reputation and is well known in his area. He is requesting a $2400 loan to pay the annual rent for his studio. He is optimistic about his business' development and hopes that the coming years will continue to bring positive growth.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his studio.

loans.name: George Mwangi

texts.en:
George is 35 years old, married, and has two children aged seven years old and three years old.  He operates a printing and stationery supply business in Mombasa. He has been in this business for the past three years.  He says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge he has is financial constraints.

He is using his loan of KES 50,000 to buy stationery to sell and use in the business. He hopes to grow his business and in the future, put up a business premise where he will avoid renting a place, which is costly. He describes himself as a leader.

loans.use: to purchase stationery to sell and use in his business

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es: La Sra. Gabriela ha estado ampliando poco  a poco  su  domicilio  a  base  de  mucho  esfuerzo  para que  su vivienda  brinde  una  mejor  imagen y  que  su  familia  se   sienta  mas   cómoda  en   su  hogar, es  por  ello  que  en esta  ocasión desea ponerle techo a la construcción que tiene al frente del domicilio ya  que   le  permitirá  protegerse  del  sol  y  de la  lluvia y cuando  sus  familiares  y  amigos  la  visiten  pueda   darle  una  mejor   estancia, agradece  el apoyo para  la  realización de su  proyecto.
texts.en: Mrs. Gabriela is building her home little by little. With much effort she is providing her family with a better place to live. Her family feels very comfortable in their home. She would like to use this loan to put a roof on the front of her home. It will protect her family from the sun and rain. When her friends and family visit she will be able to have a better place for them to be. Because of this support, she is able to finish this project.

loans.use: to put a roof on the front of her home.

loans.name: Chinara's Group

texts.en:
Chinara is a member of this group. She is 34 and married to a builder. Together with her husband, she brings up a son and three daughters. The son and two older daughters study at school and the youngest daughter is preschool age (under seven). Five years ago with an initial investment of 35,000 soms, Chinara started to sell fruits and vegetables in the market. Her business runs well and at the moment, she earns about 13,000 soms per month. With the profits gained from the business, she purchased household appliances and improved the living conditions. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase more fruits and vegetables too sell. In the near future, Chinara plans to save some more money and purchase a vehicle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es: La Señora Nilda es madre soltera con 02 hijos que viven al cuidado de ella, la señora se dedica a la venta de ropa cómo por ejemplo buzos, polos, pantalones, ropa interior,  entre otros productos exclusivamente para mujeres, este negocio lo viene realizando hace 02 años, el crédito solicitado es para invertirlo en la compra de más mercadería que será utilizado para la temporada que se viene primavera, verano. Su gran sueño de la Señora Nilda es el de tener la casa propia ya que vive en un lote alquilado, además está muy agradecida por la oportunidad brindada, ya que le permitirá incrementar su negocio y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Señora Nilda is a single mother of two children whom she looks after.  The Señora works selling clothes, such as sportswear, polo-shirts, trousers, underwear, and other products exclusively for women.  She has been working in this business for two years.

She will invest the requested loan in the purchase of more merchandise, which will be used for the coming spring and summer seasons.

Señora Nilda's big dream is to have her own home, as she lives in a rental.  She is also very grateful for the opportunity being provided, as it will allow her to grow her business and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to grow her business by buying more merchandise for the coming spring and summer seasons.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is married with 2 children. Joel is 40 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez Misamis Occidental.

Joel operates his own motorcycle to earn a living and has had this business for 7 years. Monthly he earns PHP  2000 doing this type of business. To improve his service in transportation he has requested a loan of PHP 5000 to buy spare parts for his motorcycle.
 
Joel has been a member of GDMPC for about 1 year.  In the future, Joel hopes to have another motorcycle for more earnings for his family's needs and for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy  spare parts for his motorcycle.

loans.name: John Group

texts.en:
Esther is the leader of a trust bank group made up of six women and a man. She sees to it that the group accesses the loan amount, organizes them for group meetings and ensures that all repayment schedules are met accordingly.

Esther is a mother of six children between 1 and 15.  According to her, all but the last born are currently in school.
She works very hard to support her husband in providing for the family. She is a food vendor. Esther has run a chop (food) bar for four years.

She desires to establish a modern restaurant and educate her children to the university level.

Since trading is a source of livelihood to many in most communities in Ghana, others members of the group are into all kinds of trading activities.
The group requests the loan to enable them procure goods and raw materials in bulk to revamp their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients

loans.name: Maria Nela

texts.es: María Nela tiene su negocio que es una pulpería, desde hace más de 3 años que tiene esta actividad. Inicio el negocio con un dinero que ahorro con esfuerzo propio ella ha logrado ampliar su actividad y al mismo tiempo proporcionarle a sus clientes los que ellos le solicitan. El motivo del crédito es para la compra huevos, fideos, granos básicos, leche, refrescos, galletas entre otros productos.
texts.en:
María Nela has a general store business. She has had the business for more than three years.  She began it with some money that she saved. 

Through her own efforts, she has managed to expand her business, providing her customers with the products that they ask for. The purpose of the loan is to buy eggs, noodles, basic staples, milk, soft drinks, cookies and other products.

loans.use: To buy eggs, noodles, basic staples, milk, soft drinks, cookies, and other products.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
This is Marissa, 61, a resident of Manila, Philippines. Her husband is Rolando, and she is the mother to her three children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Marissa maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealers' prices are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 4,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 26,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Marissa hopes to be more successful with her business and dreams to be able to give her children a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Jose Fernando

texts.es:
José, vive con su familia, su esposa y dos hijos, él se dedica a la venta de medicinas y a la albañilería, el negocio surgió  por iniciativa propia, debido a la necesidad de proveer para su familia lo necesario.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de medicamentos como: antibióticos, laxantes, reanimantes, la compra le ayudara para aumentar la disponibilidad de productos, permitiéndole mejorar la atención a la clientela.
Su aspiración es tener un negocio más grande, con un número mayor de clientes y a la vez proveer para su familia todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
José lives with his family which consists of his wife and two children. He sells medicines and works as a bricklayer. José started this business through his own initiative because he wanted to provide for his family’s needs.

He is requesting a loan to buy medicines such as antibiotics, laxatives, and energy supplements so that he can increase his product availability. This will allow him to better serve his customers. His aspirations include having a larger business with more customers so that he can provide everything that his family needs.

loans.use: to buy antibiotics, laxatives, and energy supplements.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es: Candelaria de 39 años de edad, casado con Juan de 59 años, y fruto de esta relación tienen 2 hijos. Juntos habitan en la comunidad de Otari donde tienen su casa propia. Candelaria, de una mentalidad ganadora, asegura “que su padre le inculcó a luchar por lo que quería". En el presente tiene dos productos que compiten fácilmente con otros productores, vale decir en la producción y comercialización de cacao, por consiguiente sus ventas fueron creciendo paulatinamente, además ya tiene posesion su producto en su comunidad. Siente que ha logrado el primer paso, ahora debe mantenerse en el negocio. Usualmente su producto los vende en los centros de acopio de su comunidad a un buen precio. En un futuro esea incrementar sus plantaciones de cacao con el único fin de producir más para obtener mejores ganancias. Este será su primer credito con MFP, por el que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará plantas de cacao para plantarlas en su parcela agrícola.
texts.en: Candelaria is 39 years old, married to Juan who is 59 years old and has 2 children from the marriage. Together they live in Otari where they have their own house. Candelaria with her winner's mentality assures us that her "father taught me to fight for what I wanted." At the moment she has 2 products that compete easily with other producers, namely the production and marketing of cocoa and as a consequence her sales increased gradually. In addition her product already has a great foothold in the community. She feels that she has achieved the first step; now she must stay in business. She usually sells her product at a good price at the collection centres in her community. In the future she wants to expand her cocoa plantations for the sole purpose of producing more for better returns. This will be her 1st loan with MFP and she agrees to make her repayments on time. Wth the 1,000 nuevos soles (PEN) she will buy cocoa plants to plant on her plot of farmland.

loans.use: to buy cocoa plants.

loans.name: Dominador

texts.en:
Dominador is 60 years old and dreams of improving his family's life. He is married and has five children. Four of his children are married and live with their spouses. The other child is single and lives with them. 

Dominador has been involved in farming since 1975. He is thankful because the family's main source of income comes from his farming business. He devotes all his time to improving his rice field because he would like to earn a bigger income. His wife also contributes to the family's finances through her hog-raising business. Dominador got his previous farm inputs from traders who charge high interest rates, so he had to use the income from the last crop to pay his debts. 

Due to lack of capital, Dominador is has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 which he can use this coming planting season. He will use the loan to purchase farm supplies to improve his rice fields. He hopes to have a good yield, for the business to become profitable, and for them to be able to save regularly for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies to improve his rice fields.

loans.name: Duo Pasajoc Group

texts.es: Duo Pasajoc. Este Grupo esta conformado por dos personas las cuales estan convencidas de que para salir adelante hay que luchar y trasarse metas, para cada dia tener mejores oportunidades.Doña Lesvia inicio su negocio con la venta de huvos de maner ambulante hace 9 años  donde se dio a conocer a los alrededores de su comunidad donde vive,actual mente cuenta con una pequeña libreria en su domicilio ahora por la sercania de la epoca navideña tiene el deseo de inverti en su libreria comprando papel para regalos,regalos,y ropa para la ocacion,al igual que la siguiente socia esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mercaderia para surtir mas sus negocio.ellas esperan que kiva les pueda ayudar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Duo Pasajoc is comprised of two people who are convinced that to come out ahead you have to fight and set goals so that each day you will have better opportunities. 

Lesvia started her business as a traveling vendor selling eggs nine years ago. She became known in the areas surrounding the community where she lives that way.  Currently she has a small bookstore in her home.  Now that Christmas season is approaching she wants to invest in her bookstore by purchasing wrapping paper, gifts, and clothes for the occasion. 

Similarly the other member is requesting this loan to buy merchandise to stock her business.  They hope that Kiva will be able to help them with their business.

loans.use: to buy wrapping paper, presents, and clothes for the Christmas occasion.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Ángela de 23 años, convive junto a Teodosio de 30 años y fruto de esa relación tienen un pequeño hijo; Henry de 02 años, a quien le brinda amor y desea un buen futuro. Ángela, trabaja arduamente desde hace 07 años, en aquellos años ella se dedicaba a la agricultura, en una pequeña parcela, donde solo le servía para que sostener a su unidad familiar. Hoy tiene una tienda de abarrotes, en donde le va generando buenas ganancias económicas, desde luego, que ya tiene dos rubros diferentes, en las cuales pueda generar otros ingresos extras con respecto a su fuente principal que es su tienda de abarrotes. Ella para llegar a su idea de negocio, así misma que lo lograría siempre y cuando, le tome con mucha firmeza a su trabajo, es por ello que su negocio trata de estar lleno de productos con la finalidad de que sus clientes se sientan satisfechos con el producto que se le otorga. Por lo general trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su pareja y su punto de venta está localizado en su misma casa. Sus planes a futuro es incrementar sus productos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y el de sus clientes potenciales. Este será su crédito número 03 con MFP, por lo que se compromete en seguir cumpliendo con sus respectivos, como en anteriores oportunidades. Además se siente agradecido con su banco comunal por el buen clima organizacional que existe. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles; piensa invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería, para que así pueda abastecer a su tienda de abarrotes con la seguridad de captar mayor clientela y aumentar su margen de ventas.
texts.en:
Ángela, 23, lives with Teodosio, 30; they have a two-year-old son, Henry, who she loves and wants a good future for.

Ángela has worked hard for seven years.  During that time she worked in farming on a small parcel that only sufficed to feed her family.  Today, she has a grocery store where she’s earning good economic profits.  Of course, since she now has two lines of work that can generate extra income aside from her main source of income which is the grocery store.

She came to the idea of her business and knew that she’d attain it as long as she took on the work firmly and this is why she always strives to have the store full of products so that her customers will feel satisfied with the products she provides.  In general, she works on her own but sometimes her spouse helps her out and her sales point is located at home.  Her plan for the future is to increase her products to improve her family’s and her potential customers’ quality of life.

This will be MFP loan #3 and she commits to continue making her respective payments like she’s done in past opportunities.  She feels grateful toward her communal bank for the good organizational climate it has.

She will use the 2000 new soles to buy larger amounts of merchandise to stock her grocery store sure of capturing a wider clientele and increasing her sales margin.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Davlatyor

texts.ru: Давлатбек женат и ответственный отец семерых детей. Более 21 года он занимается выращиванием сельхозпродуктов. После сборки урожая он ездит на рынок и оптом продает  розничным торговцам. В бизнесе помогает ему его жена и брат. Они вместе сеют семена, а также собирают урожай. Давлатбек хотел бы получить займ в размере 2000$ США для покупки ГСМ, минеральных удобрений, семян и прополку. Он надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарен вам за вашу доброту и помощь.
texts.en: Davlatyor is married and is a responsible father of seven children.  He has been involved in growing agricultural crops for over 21 years.  After gathering the harvest, he goes to a market and sells his harvest to retailers.  His wife and brother help him with this business.  Together, they sow seeds and also gather the harvest.  Davlatyor wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $2000 for the purchase of fuel, mineral fertilizers, seeds and weeds treatment.  He relies on your help and thanks you in advance for your kindness and help.

loans.use: to buy fuel, fertilizers, seeds and weeds treatment

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.en:
Jacinto is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 3 children. 
Jacinto has a shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages .
Jacinto has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Jacinto hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is married with 8 children.  Merlyn is 43 years old and lives in Compra,Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.
Merlyn sells food for snacks to earn a living and has been in this business for 10 years. 

She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.
Merlyn has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.  In the future, Merlyn hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Hamdah

texts.en:
Hamdah is a 34 year old married woman who has 3 family members from Al Khaledieh Al Mafraq Jordan. She is requesting a loan 400 JD to pay for her home improvements.In the future she wants to buy a new home to improve her family living standard.
Hamdah is a conservative woman,she is unwilling to upload her photo in the internet the photo is for her brother

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Alfredo Javier

texts.es: ALFREDO JAVIER: Es un señor cordial de 33 años de edad, casado con un pequeño hijo de un año de edad. Con el propósito de brindarle a su familia una vivienda digna y segura solicita financiamiento, para construir poco a poco su vivienda de concreto. Con el préstamo comprara materiales de construcción: bloques, cemento. Él y su esposa sueñan en concluir la construcción de su vivienda.

loans.use: para construir poco a poco su vivienda de concreto

loans.name: Erika Rocio

texts.en:
Mrs. T. has a small business of food located in a market. She has 8 years dedicating to this business. \"I love to cook and I prepare Mexican food. My clients said that my food is delicius and they frequent my business many times. Nevertheless my work equipment has broken down because the hard work they had been exposed to and that causes delays in the elaboration of the food. I Also need some furniture in order to give a better service to my clients. I´m asking for a loan of 1.500 dollars to cover these needs and to improve my business. I consider myself as a hard working person with high expectations, with your support I´m sure i will make it.\"

Español

La Sra. T. tiene un pequeño negocio de comida ubicado en un mercado muy concurrido. Tiene 8 años dedicándose a este negocio. “Me gusta cocinar y preparo comida Mexicana con mucho esmero. Mis clientes dicen que la comida es muy sabrosa y frecuentan mi negocio repetidas veces. Sin embargo mi equipo de trabajo se ha acabado porque lo uso a diario, y eso me ocasiona que tarde más en la elaboración. También me hacen falta algunas mesas y sillas para acomodar a mis clientes y darles un mejor servicio. Quisiera un apoyo de un crédito de 1,500 dólares para cubrir estas necesidades y mejorar mi negocio. Me considero una persona con ganas de superarme y creo que con este apoyo lo lograré.”

loans.use: buy chairs,tables and supplies

loans.name: Wilbad

texts.en: I am a single man. I am head of a 6 family household. I am a petty trader. I am the main bread earner. I dropped out of school to take care of my siblings after the death of our parents due too HIV/AIDs in 2005.

loans.use: I intend to expand and diversify business to include fruit vending.

loans.name: Adler

texts.en:
Alex is a native of Salitre, Ecuador, where he has been farming rice his entire life. On his lands, he has rice, cattle and some other fruits such as mangoes. He will use the loan to invest in rice production and to buy a few new steers. He hopes he can continue to improve his lands and increase his property. He has three children. One is still in school. The other two help him out with his cattle ranching and farming.

Alex is the latest addition to one of the new Communal Banks in the Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the 10 de enero Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in Salitre named 10 de enero. They will use the microloans to prepare the lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others' guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the 10 de enero Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many microfinance programs, but is imperative for the communities Mifex works with to have capital reserves for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Loan Use and Repayment

The loans in this sector will be used to create water basins that will prevent flooding in the case of heavy rains or store water in case of droughts. The loans will also be used to treat the land prior to farming, to plant the seeds and purchase fertilizer. The loan repayment schedule is also different from the typical microentrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 5 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the sixth and final month.

Below is more information about Salitre compiled by the staff at Mifex when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program.

Economy of Salitre

Salitre is a rural sector in the Province of Guayas known as the capital of Montuvios (montuvio is a cowboy) with approximately 30,000 inhabitants. The main economic activities are herding and agriculture which make up about 80% of the economy. The infrastructure and basic services are poor, especially the roads and water services.

Salitre is highly dedicated to farming rice and cattle ranching. Rice is a crop that yields about every four months. In order to farm rice, the environment must be very humid and there must be a high volume of water. The lack of a structured water system makes it difficult for the small farmers to be highly productive. The best months for cultivating rice are early in the year when it is the rainy season in the coast of Ecuador.

Salitre is a national tourist attraction as many Ecuadorians visit the freshwater Salitre River. There are cottages, small restaurants and water attractions that people come to enjoy.

Access to Credit

There are not many financial institutions that provide services to the productive sector of the local economy. The primary access to credit comes from loan sharks who charge extremely high interest rates averaging around 20% a month. The locals are also exploited by the intermediaries that buy their products in order to sell them in the city and to export abroad.
