These intermediaries buy crops in advance at very low prices, finance soil at extremely high prices and often provide emergency loans for even higher interest rates than the loan sharks.

Risks

Salitre is a dangerous sector considering it is in a rural area. There is a high incidence of robbery of cattle that results in many of the ranch owners owning weapons to protect their property. Because the police are not present in these areas, farmers and ranchers must apply their own laws and provide their own security. In some instances they have formed their own cooperatives and associations to have a community crime prevention effort.

Salitre is in the lowlands of Ecuador and is vulnerable to flooding in the rainy season. In the event of a heavy rainy season, often at its worse when El Niño occurs, the farmers of rice lose many of their crops. All this is due to a lack of infrastructure in the area.

loans.use: Buy new steers and invest in rice

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is married with three children and lives in the Kigamboni area of Dar es Salaam, where she runs a food-vending business along the shores of Indian Ocean. Most of her customers are fishermen.

Fatma would like to thank all the lenders who participated in her first loan with Kiva, now fully repaid, which allowed her to purchase foodstuffs such as rice, cornflower, cooking oil, sugar and beans to sell to her customers. The loan also allowed her to buy a small refrigerator which she uses to sell cold drinks to thirsty fishermen who come to her shop for to eat after spending their mornings fishing in the Indian Ocean.

Fatma is requesting a new loan from Kiva so that she can improve her business by buying a larger stock of cold drinks, along with dishes, chairs, tables and food-wrapping materials for customers who would like to take their food away to eat later. She would also like to buy uniforms for the three assistants who help in her shop. The $750 loan she is asking for will make her business more attractive to customers, and take her one step closer to realizing her dream of becoming a professional caterer who also owns a guest house.

loans.use: Add to stock of food items and cold drinks and  buy serving dishes, tables, chairs and food-wrapping material

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Maria Teresa is married. She has two small children. Her husband works in a local firm, but his salary is very small. To contribute to the family income, Maria Teresa decided to start her own business selling shrimp coktails and ceviche. Her love of cooking and her desire to give her family everything they need have helped Maria increase her business, and demand for her products grows daily.

Maria wants to establish her business on a firmer footing. She wants to buy a food stand, and she is asking for a loan of $250, which she agrees to repay in three months. Be an important factor in helping this business grow, and please decide to support Maria. She and her family will always be grateful.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio and Sarah Padial, Kiva Volunteers

Maria Teresa es casada y tiene dos pequeños hijos, su esposo trabaja en una empresa de la localidad pero recibe un salario muy bajo, para obtener un ingreso extra Maria decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de cócteles de camarón y ceviche hace dos años, su gusto por la cocina y el deseo de darle todo lo necesario a su familia le ha permitido a Maria a crecer con su negocio y la demanda por sus productos mejora día con día.

Maria quiere establecer bien su negocio y para comprar un puesto está solicitando un préstamo de $ 250 dólares, mismos que se compromete a regresar en 3 meses. Forma parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio y decídete a apoyar a Maria, ella y su familia te lo agradecerán siempre.

loans.use: To buy a food stand

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace N. is 40 years old and lives in Asaba in Delta State. She is married and has one child. Grace started her business in 2005 and now would like a loan of $1175 to enable her buy more inventory for her store.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for resale

loans.name: Savriniso

texts.ru:
Savriniso D. has three children. She works as a seamstress in the local sewing factory. She was not able to make modern, trendy clothing with her old sewing machine, so she started seasonal work like dying of leather goods. Then she got an advice to turn for help to MicroInvest. She took out a loan and purchased a new sewing machine and was also continuing to repair leather goods.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Джураева имеет троих детей, она работает портнихой в городском швейном цеху. Раньше ее старая швейная машинка не позволяла шить современную одежду, тогда она занялась сезонной работой, т. е. Покраска кожаных изделий. Ей посоветовали обратиться в Микроинвест. Получив кредит, она обновила свою швейную машинку и параллельно занималась реставрировать кожаные изделия.

loans.use: Clothes making

loans.name: Jenifa

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam! This is 26-year-old Jenifa M.. She is married with two children, ages 1 and 12. In 2006 Jenifa established a clothing business and now requests a loan of $275 in order to purchase additional clothing in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is an organization that is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania. Through leasing and leaseback, SELFINA provides a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. As they lack tangible collateral assets, they are termed not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from that client, extends a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment. The process is called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothing in bulk.

loans.name: I Made Wenten

texts.id:
I Made Wenten, 50 tahun, tinggal di desa Manistutu, sebuah desa di Bali Barat yang mana hampir 90 % penduduknya bermata pencaharian sebagai petani. Khusus untuk lingkungan I Made Wenten, sebagian besar petani bercocok tanam dengan menanam padi. Hal ini disebabkan karena pengairan diwilayah tersebut mencukupi untuk menanam padi. Sebagai seorang petani, I Made Wenten paham akan kebutuhan para petani pada saat masa tanam.
Petani di desa I Made Wenten sangat membutuhkan pupuk untuk meningkatkan produktifitas sawahnya. Namun yang menjadi kendala adalah sulitnya mencari pupuk karena selain jarak pedagang pupuk yang cukup jauh, ketersediaan pupuk pun sangat minim. Melihat hal ini, I Made Wenten menganggap sebagi peluang bisnis yang bisa diandalkan. Selain tetap mengerjakan sawahnya sendiri, I Made Wenten melayani penjualan beraneka jenis pupuk yang diperlukan oleh petani. Dengan pinjaman dari Dinari, I Made Wenten membeli pupuk di pedagang besar dan memasarkannya kembali. Para petani merasa sangat terbantu dengan usaha I Made Wenten, karena mereka dapat dengan mudah memperoleh pupuk. Satu hal yang sangat dihargai oleh para petani adalah layanan antar oleh I Made Wenten kepada para pembeli. Dengan usaha ini, I Made Wenten merasa sangat terbantu dari segi perekonomiannya dan ia sangat berterima kasih atas pinjaman yang didapatnya.

loans.use: Membeli Pupuk

loans.name: La Fuerza, Group 5

texts.en:
Elina is a lovely 36-year-old woman who lives with her 5 children and 2 grandchildren in a community called Los Guaricanos on the outskirts of Santo Domingo. She runs a small clothing business where she offers her community members new and used clothing, and everything ranging from pants to shirts to undergarments—as she said “a little bit of everything.” She is asking for this loan so that she can buy a larger quantity of clothing. The extra capital will enable her to expand her merchandise and thus improve her business and increase her profits.

Her dreams are to have her own large clothing store one day—but most importantly, enable her children to have a better future, one where they can continue to study at the university, become professionals, and lead healthy and comfortable lives.

On behalf of Elina and everyone here at Esperanza International, thank you for your support!

loans.use: Purchase new & used clothing

loans.name: Assadullo

texts.ru:
Assadullo Toshkuvatovich D. lives in the Khuroson region in the Pahtaobod village. He is 51 years old, married and has six children. He has secondary education and has an animal husbandry business. He has a small cow house where he breeds calves. Because he does not have a specialized education, animal husbandry is the only source of income for his family. Assadullo buys calves on the market at a low price, feeds them and then resells on the same market at a more profitable price. He provides the markets with meat and his family with the necessary food. Assadullo wants to buy a calf and needs money so he decided to apply for a loan. He plans to pay off the loan within 9 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

Дустмуродов Ассадулло Тошкуватович проживает в районе Хуросон в поселке Пахтаобод .Возраст 51 год. Женат , имеет 6 детей. Образование среднее .Клиент занимается животноводством. Имеет небольшой коровник, где разводит бычков. Так как у клиента нет специального образования, животноводство является основным источником дохода его семьи.Ассадулло покупает на рынке бычков по низкой цене, откармливает их и перепродает на том же рынке или жителям по выгодной ему цене.Тем самым обеспечивает рынки мясом,а семью необходимыми продуктами питания . Клиент хочет купить бычка , для чего ему нужны деньги .Поэтому Ассадулло решил взять кредит. Планирует погасить кредит в течении 9 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys G. (51) is married to Ricardo Jiménez (53). The couple has two daughters. The oldest one is studying medicine in Cuba, and the youngest one goes to high school in Luque. Gladys' biggest dream is to see her oldest daughter with a doctor's degree and the youngest one going to college.

The family lived for a long time in Argentina where they owned a grocery store. Since they missed Paraguay and their relatives, they decided to come back to their home country.

After their arrival, Ricardo started working in a government entity. Meanwhile, Gladys is in the tourism business. She has a license for a bus company called “crucero del norte”. Gladys has a store where she sells bus tickets to different cities in Argentina, Brazil and Paraguay. Taking advantage of the opportunity, Gladys established a grocery store in the same place where she sells the bus tickets. The grocery store offers candies, drinks, bread and chocolates.

The credit provided by KIVA will be used for the purchase of products for the grocery store such as: candies, drinks, bread and chocolates.

loans.use: Purchase of products for the grocery store such as: candies, drinks, bread and chocolates.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George A. is a 30-year-old father of three children. He lives with his family in Nyalenda. He is a member of West Kolwa Community Based Service Providers group, a K-MET initiative. He was trained by K-MET in home-based care services for people living with HIV/AIDS. He is the proprietor of a community pharmacy located in Nyalenda, where he sells a wide range of drugs such as painkillers, malaria medications, family planning, and children's syrups. He has received and fully paid three previous microfinance loans. He appreciates K-MET/ KIVA for the financial assistance. He requires an additional US $800 to purchase an additional stock of drugs in bulk.

loans.use: Purchase additional stock of drugs in bulk.

loans.name: Eze

texts.en:
Eze C. is 25-years-old, married and has four children. She lives in Alaba, Lagos State, Nigeria.

Eze sells electronics at the Alaba Int’l market. She studied this field for three months and has been actively selling electronics since 2003. She is requesting a loan to buy more electronics products to sell in her shop. She says thank you to all.

loans.use: To buy more electronics

loans.name: Caro

texts.en: Caro I. is 40 years old and she is a widow with 4 children. She lives in Benin City with her children. She goes out to the villages to buy soup ingredients which she later sells to people in the city. She learned this business for 3 months from a friend. She started her own business in 1996. Caro is a LAPO client. Caro needs the loan amount of US$ 1, 025 to buy more soup ingredients for sale. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more soup ingredients for sale

loans.name: Mohammad Rahim

texts.en:
Mohammad Rahim is married. He lives with his wife. His children are married, and his wife is a homemaker, so he is supporting her. He works as a tinsmith, a business that he has been involved in for more than 14 years in Kabul. He has a good number of workers; some of his students are good workers. They have shops in Kabul. But he has 3 workers now, so he needs a loan to further his business. In the last 5 months, he is looking weak in his business.

He bought a house in Kabul and he spent all his money on his house, but now he can't work well. Therefore he needs a loan. He wants to take out an individual loan to complete his stock and ship more boxes to the bazaar.

He is happy with this loan process in his country. He suggests other workers should use these loans and he wants to thank lenders.

loans.use: To complete his stock and ship more boxes to the bazaar

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo. Reyna es casada, tiene 30 años y 3 hijos, Reyna tiene una tienda en su casa ubicada el distrito de San Juan Bautista, en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, carnes, cereales, leña, actividad que realiza de lunes a viernes, mientras que los días sábados y domingos viaja a la feria del distrito de Tambo en donde vende ropa y mercería.

Reyna necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche, jabón. Reyna sueña con tener una imprenta, establecerse en un solo lugar y ya no viajar, sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Reyna is a member of the Triunfo Village Bank. She is 30 years old and is married with three children. Reyna has a shop in her home, which is located in the San Juan Bautista district. There, she sells groceries, vegetables, meats, cereals, and firewood from Monday to Friday. On Saturdays and Sundays, she travels to the fair in the Tambo district where she sells clothing and hardware.

Reyna needs a loan of 2,000 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, milk, and soap. Reyna dreams of having a printing press, of settling in one place and no longer needing to travel, and of her children growing up to become working professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Larissa Kravanja, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Reyna needs a loan of 2,000 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, milk, and soap.

loans.name: Sheang

texts.en:
Mrs. Sheang Y. was born in 1969. She lives in Chambok Village in the Takeo Province. She is a grocer and she owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice. Her husband Mr. Nou Sovanra is a farmer.

Even though, they have different careers they do not make enough money to earn a good living. Also, they face difficulty because their field does not have a productive crop.

Therefore, Mrs. Sheang Y. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer for the plantation. She hopes this loan will increase her income and improve their living conditions.

She is the mother of a child who attends the local school.

Her husband is on the right of photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for the plantation

loans.name: Sovann

texts.en:
Mrs. Sovann S. is 28 years old and married. Her business is in making cement jars to sell for income to sustain her family. She can make 3 jars a day, earning approximately $3 per day. She now lives with her old mother and seven siblings, all who are farmers who grow rice and vegetables. They all live in Thnoatchrum Commune in Pursat Province.

Sovann is applying for $1,000 to buy more raw materials to use for making jars and hopes the loan will help her to increase her revenue.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials

loans.name: Félicienne Dédé

texts.fr:
Célibataire avec trois (03) enfants, Madame H. Dédé Félicienne vit seule avec ses enfants dont l’avenir lui tient tant à cœur. Aussi se débrouille-t-elle chaque jour pour subvenir à leurs besoins les plus élémentaires. Pour ce faire, elle va de marché en marché pour acheter de la farine de manioc ou "gari" qu’elle revend à la frontière Togo-Bénin. 
Très reconnu de par son dynamisme et la qualité de ses produits, elle est de plus en plus sollicitée. Mais ses moyens sont très limités actuellement. C’est pourquoi Madame H. forte de son expérience antérieure de petit crédit, sollicite aujourd’hui un financement pour acheter en quantité considérable les produits afin de couvrir toutes les demandes qui s’adressent à elle.
Le financement de ce micro entrepreneur contribuera à n’en point douter à assurer son autonomie financière et accroître son chiffre d’affaire.
texts.en:
Unmarried and having three children, Ms. Dédé Félicienne H. lives alone with her children whose future she takes to heart. Also, she manages to get by each day providing for their most basic needs. To do so, she goes from marketplace to marketplace to buy cassava flour or "gari" that she resells along the Togo-Benin border. Renowned for her dynamism and the quality of her merchandise, she is in demand more and more. But her means are currently very limited. This is why Ms. H., having a wealth of experience from previous micro-loans, is today requesting financing to buy goods in considerable quantities to cover all the orders sent to her. The financing of this micro-entrepreneur will, without any doubt at all, help ensure her financial autonomy and to grow her sales figures.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in cassava flour

loans.name: Le Thi Hong

texts.vi: Chị Lê Thị Hồng D.  năm nay  27 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1999.Trước khi tham gia Quỹ hai vợ chồng chị chủ yếu chăn nuôi và buôn bán nhỏ, sau khi được vay thêm vốn chị đã đầu tư mua máy cày ruộng để chồng chị đi cày ruộng thuê cho bà con trong xã. Hiện nay  đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị với thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng.Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để  đầu tư sửa máy và mua thêm dầu máy phục vụ cho  công việc cày ruộng thuê của chồng.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lê Thị Hồng D. is 27 years old. She has been participating in TYM Fund since 1999. Before TYM, she and her husband only raised livestock and a small retail setup. After being able to borrow some capital, she purchased a rice paddy plough so that her husband could render his services ploughing rice paddies for people in their community. Today, the ploughing business is the main source of income for her family with an income of 3,000,000 VND per month. This loan cycle, she hopes to borrow 15,000,000 VND to fix the plough and purchase more machinery oil to help with her husband's rice paddy ploughing business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business - Plough Rice Paddies

loans.name: Bacilia

texts.es:
A sus sesenta y tres años de edad a Bacilia se le hace difícil dejar de trabajar puesto que toda su vida se ha dedicado a tener un negocio y también a contar con un ingreso extra para los gastos del hogar y educación de sus hijos, ya que el trabajo de su esposo no cubría todas las necesidades por no tener un trabajo estable.

Durante treinta y ocho años ha vendido comida en un mercado lejos de su casa, primero con un puesto alquilado y luego como ambulante. No obstante una vez que construyeron un mercado en su localidad deicidio mudarse y ahora desde hace seis años tiene un puesto donde vende menús los fines de semana y feriados.

Actualmente, ella se encarga de mantener a su hija menor de diecisiete años y afirma que no descansará hasta que ella pueda terminar una carrera.
texts.en:
In her seventy-three years of age, Bacilia finds it difficult to stop working given that all her life she has dedicated herself to maintaining her business. She also counts on the extra income for expenses associated with her home and her children’s education, given that her husband’s work didn’t cover all the necessities because he did not have a stable job. For thirty-eight years she sold food in a market far from her home, first in a rented location and later as a street vendor. Nevertheless once a market was built in her neighborhood she decided to move, and now for the past 6 years she has a location where she sells meals on weekends and holidays. Currently, she is in charge of supporting her youngest daughter who is seventeen years old, and she asserts that she will not rest until her daughter can finish her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic supplies for her business and to purchase her medications.

loans.name: Uchumi Group

texts.en:
Vumilia has owned a mini-shop (kiosk) in the Sakina neighborhood of Arusha for 4 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 90. Every day she works at her business from 9:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Vumilia is 25 years old, married, and has two children: ages 5 and 1. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Aisha, who has her own small business in Arusha.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Sorohon

texts.ru: Даминова Сорохон проживает в городе Турсун-Заде. Возраст 40 лет, замужем и имеет троих детей. Образование среднее. Занимается сельским хозяйством уже 20 лет. Наступил сезон весеннего посева, для которого она решила получить кредит. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 8  месяцев.
texts.en:
Sorohon D. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 40 years old, married and has three children. She has a secondary education. Sorohon has been involved in agriculture for 20 years. With the coming of the current spring seeding season, she decided to obtain a loan. She will be able to repay this loan within 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba T. is sixty-five years old. She is a married mother of two children. Both of them are currently out of school and working. She lives with her children and husband in a family house in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Aba is a food vendor. She sells a local dish called ‘banku’ in her community. She prepares the food in her house of residence and sells by the roadside in the evenings. Banku is prepared from corn dough and served hot with soup. She says she procures the raw materials such as maize, fish, and other vegetables from the local market. Aba has been in this business for five years. She wants a loan to procure raw materials in bulk. Aba is hopeful to improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To procure bags of maize

loans.name: Dilovar

texts.ru: Гозиев Диловар проживает в районе Рудаки. Возраст 24 года. Женат, детей не имеет. Женился совсем недавно. Работает на рынке. Торгует овощами и фруктами. Товар скупает у дехкан по низким ценам , а затем продает на рынке по выгодной ему цене.Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погашать  кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Dilovar G. lives in the Rudaki district. He is 24 years old, married and does not have children. He got married very recently. Dilovar works at a market, selling vegetables and fruits. He buys his products from dehkan farmers at low prices and then sells them at the market at more profitable prices. Dilovar plans to obtain this loan in order to increase his product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase product turnover

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To secure a regular supply of palm nuts

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en: "I started running a business in 2006. I can still remember how we started. We used our small savings of Php 2,000 to buy preprocessed Tuba wine to display in our store. My husband and I are Tuba vendors. Tuba is a type of wine that originates from the coconut tree," says Leonida G., the 36-year-old mother of six children. Leonida would like to ask for a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI. She heard about Kiva and she wanted to obtain a loan to support her business. She thinks that by doing so, she could add more wine in her store to sell. This in turn will give her a bigger income for the family. CEVI helps people’s business to grow. It provides not just loans but includes training and insurance coverage to all of its clients as part of its services.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her Tuba wine business

loans.name: Liala

texts.en:
This is Liala, daughter of A. S.. She lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. She is 37, married, and has 5 children. She lives in a house that needs to be repaired. In last year’s winter, she and her family members had lots of problems living there. When she found AFS (Ariana Financial Services), she has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani to repair her house and to buy the needed constructive materials to live comfortably. 
She admires this effective process.

loans.use: For buying construction materials.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en: M. Rashid is 36 years old and married with three children who are studying. He is a hardworking business man who owns a bakery shop near the Kalerwe stage. He will use his loan to purchase baking ingredients for making bread, donuts, etc. Rashid supplies bread to a number of different places, such as retail shops and so forth. His future hope is to work hard to meet customer demand, and so obtain more profits.

loans.use: To purchase baking ingredients for making bread, donuts, etc.

loans.name: Omo

texts.en: Omo operates a phone booth business making calls for people in her community. She is 26 years old and single. She has been in the business for a long time. She is asking for a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase additional rechargeable phone cards to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase rechargeable phone cards

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 30 year old Ruth M. from Mbozi. She is married with four children between the ages of 2 and 10. Ruth has been running a Mama Lishe business since 2006. Café/Mama Lishe - A mama lishe (local restaurant or café) in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches. The food is all local: rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough made from maize flour), plantains (a cooked savory banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of sauces.

She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by three employees. Ruth currently earns about 120 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to pay rent for several months. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity of her business. Ruth thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To pay rent for several months

loans.name: Fabiola Del Rosario

texts.es: Fabiola del Rosario Hernández Bárcenas tiene 25 años. Ella es una joven con un gran espíritu emprendedor. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este humilde negocio. Ella tiene 2 hijos a su cargo y cada día lucha por salir adelante. Fabiola tuvo ciertos problemas porque no tenía  la experiencia necesaria para ofrecerle a sus clientes sus productos pero esto lo ha conseguido con el tiempo y así obtuvo mucho más clientes. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de calzado, ropa, perfumes entre otras cosas. Su deseo es proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda para que el día de mañana sus hijos tengan un donde vivir.
texts.en:
Fabiola del Rosario Hernández Bárcenas is a 25 year old woman who possesses a tremendous entrepreneurial spirit. For more than 6 years, she has been dedicated to her modest business selling general merchandise. She has 2 dependent children and struggles each day to get ahead.

Fabiola had faced difficulties because she didn’t have the necessary experience to offer her customers the products they wanted, but she was able to overcome that with time and attract many more customers. Her loan will be used as operating capital to buy shoes, clothing, perfumes, and other items. She hopes to make improvements to her home so that her children will have a decent place to live.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Jabbor

texts.en:
B. Jabbor is 59 years old. He is married and has 4 children. Jabbor's goals are to grow in his personal life and in his business. His wish is to offer better service to his customers. His dream is that God continues to provide him with more life to get ahead and to fulfill his goals. 

Jabbor is a taxi driver who travels through the streets of Kanibadam, Tajikistan in search of customers. He has owned his business for 3 years. Currently Jabbor’s car needs some repairs, so he wants to borrow 4500 Somoni. He will use the loan to buy spare parts for his car. Jabbor thanks Kiva and all lenders who make this help possible.     
       

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy spare parts to fix his taxi

loans.name: Hemed

texts.en: Hemed S. is a married Tanzanian businessman.  He runs a business making bricks and selling to customers at Kitunda Ward in Dar es Salaam. He makes the bricks by mixing sand and cement using special machines. Business materials are purchased from wholesale shops. He has been in the business for four years. He is requesting a loan of Tshs 600,000 to buy more business materials. 10503

loans.use: To buy more construction materials

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver is 60 years old and is married with seven children aged 28 to 40 years. None of her children goes to school; it’s only the grand children who are schooling. Oliver resides in and owns a seven-roomed house where she lives with six people. She also takes care of additional family members.

Oliver is a food vendor, selling all types of foodstuffs at her home in Mengo Kaswa Zone in the outskirts of Kampala. On average she receives twenty customers a day. She has been in this business for one year and with MCDT for three years and is servicing her sixth loan. She doesn’t pay rent for her business premises because she works from her home.

Oliver sells to all categories of people, both in retail and wholesale. She buys her foodstuffs from Owino Market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda, and so she incurs transport costs to and from shopping. Her challenges include transportation and the rainy season as she works in an open space.

Oliver wants to use this loan to buy more bags of sweet potatoes, cassava and bunches of bananas. She is aspiring to seeing her business grow stronger and to start buying directly from farmers.

loans.use: To buy sacks of sweet potatoes, cassava and bunches of bananas

loans.name: Vumirya

texts.en:
Vumiriya is 35 years old, married and has four children between the ages of 6 and 12. All of them are currently in school. She owns a three-room house where she lives with 10 other people because she is caring for several family members. The house has access to electricity and piped-in water. 

Vumiriya makes a living selling beverages in both wholesale and retail markets, and works hard to keep her costs low and operate as efficiently as possible. She has been a member of MCDT for five years and is applying for her 10th loan. She will use the money from this loan to pay rent for her shop, buy more supplies and cover the cost of her children's education. Her goal is to expand her business to the point where she is able to sell wholesale only.

loans.use: To pay various bills and buy more items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en: Virgie sells fruits, vegetables and fish. She is 30 years old and presently living with her husband and three children in the village of Magdalena, Cabatuan, Isabela. Her three children are currently enrolled in high school. Her net daily income is 200 Philippine pesos (PHP) and she requested a loan of 5,000 PHP from lenders for additional working capital for her business. She works hard to improve the general living conditions of her family. She's hoping earnestly that Kiva lenders will fund her requested loan so she may have a fruitful life.

loans.use: Additional capital for her food business

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en: Mrs. Mary Joy E. is a resident of Sta. Josefa, Agusan del Sur. She is 34 years old, married, and has four children. Her oldest child is only 16 years old. She invested in rice farming. She plants rice because it is a necessity among Filipinos. She currently needs additional capital for her farm. She applied to CEVI and asked to borrow 15,000 PHP. With this loan, Mary Joy will be able to finance her farm and, in turn, sustain her family’s needs.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Danaya sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne  d’âge de 39 ans et 4 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et  résident dans le village de Fantombougou, sous préfecture de Fana, Région de KOULIKORO, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage, de commerce.   
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci d’avoir constamment un appui financier pour leurs activités. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Quant à l’utilisation du nouveau prêt, elles achèteront une grande quantité de condiments alimentaires et des habillements. Les produits sont achetés en gros à Bamako et le tout  est revendu sur place au marché et au bord du goudron à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.  
Elles estiment réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 35.000FCFA  par mois. Les bénéfices sont partagés entre la nourriture, la santé et les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Danaya group are married women who average 39-years-old and have 4 children. With their husband and children, they live in large, traditional families in Fantombougou village, in the Fana region of Mali. They know each other through neighbor and work connections. They collaborate with the microfincance institution Soro Yiriwaso, taking care to always have financial support for their activities. They are on their third loan together and have repaid all of their previous loans in full. With this new loan, they will buy a large amount of food condiments and clothing apparel. The products are purchased wholesale in Bamako and all resold on location at the market and on the street to both male and female customers. They estimate making a monthly profit of 35,000 FCFA. The profits are shared and go toward food, health, and social activities.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of condiments and clothing

loans.name: Vero

texts.en:
Vero is 55 years of age and married with three children. Vero sells shoes, clothing and sarongs, and has been in this line of business for the past fifteen years. She has been a good client of the Kiva field partner, LAPO, for over two years.

Vero is requesting a loan of 140,000 NGN. With the loan, she plans to expand her shoes and cloths (sarongs) business, which is now booming. With this kind of business she hopes to increase her earnings over time, and be able to provide better for her children's education.

She says thank you to Kiva and a big thank you to all who made the loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes and cloths (sarongs) to sell.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El  señor Juan Carlos tiene 40 años de edad, junto con su esposa se han esforzado para darle  mejorares oportunidades a sus dos hijos, su esposa emigro a los Estados Unidos de América para poder trabajar y mejorar su vivienda ya que el trabajo aquí en Nicaragua esta escaso. Don 
Juan tiene varios negocios, docente de ingles, tiene un taxi y una pequeña librería en su casa de habitación. Las clases las imparte por la mañana medio tiempo, luego por la tarde da su servicio de taxi y en su casa tiene una persona que le administra la librería todo con el objetivo de obtener mejores ganancias para poder hacer las  mejoras a su casa como pagar los gastos de agua, luz, teléfono todo esto lo ha logrado con su esfuerzo y las remesas que su esposa ha mandado. Con el crédito que esta solicitando es para comprar materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, hierro y cemento y otros para poder hacer el porche en frente de su casa y tener mas espacio ya que la librería la tiene en la sala y como es pequeña  se le hace difícil y desea invertir mas y poder ubicarla en el porche su librería. Para más seguridad de los antisociales ya que estaría en el porche con mejor seguridad. A futuro es poder incrementar la venta, comprar otras vitrinas para poder ofertar más los productos. Todo esto espera lograr con su trabajo y el apoyo de la institución.
texts.en:
Señor Juan Carlos is 40 years of age. Along with his wife he has endeavored to give better opportunities to their two children. His wife emigrated to the United States of America to be able to work and improve their dwelling, since the work here in Nicaragua is scarce. Señor Juan has various businesses; he teaches English, has a taxi and a small bookstore in his home. He gives classes part time in the morning, then in the afternoon provides his taxi service. In his house he has a person that administers the bookstore. He does all this with the objective of obtaining profits to be able to make improvements to his house, such as to pay for water, lights, and telephone. He has achieved all this with his efforts and the remittances that his wife has sent. With the loan that he is requesting he will buy building materials such as: stone, sand, iron and cement and other things to be able to make the porch across his house and to have more space, since he has the bookstore in the living room and it is small and makes things difficult. He wants to invest more and relocate the bookstore on the porch. For more security from outsiders, since it would be on the porch it needs better security. In the future he would like to be able to increase sales, to buy other showcases and to be able to offer more products. All this he expects to achieve with his work and the support of the institution.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials to add a porch to his house where he can relocate his bookstore.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en: Marlyn B. is from the village of Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 30 years old. Marlyn is single and has an infant. To make a living, Marlyn runs a bakery. The main source of income for the business comes from baking and selling bread in the local community. Marlyn has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 25,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2008, Marlyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase baking equipment. Marlyn is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional cooking ingredients. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Marlyn from GDMPC, a Kiva parnter. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional cooking ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bike parts and bikes

loans.name: Tobias

texts.en: Tobias is a 38-year-old businessman. He is married with six children who go to school. He provides welding and fabrication services to the residents of Bahati in Nairobi. He employs five people and describes his business environment as competitive. He has been running this business for the last eight years. Before this, he ran a small hardware shop. He has requested a loan of Kes. 50,000 to add stock of winding wires, metal plates and iron sheets. He describes himself as ambitious and enterprising and hopes to open a workshop.

loans.use: To add to his stock

loans.name: Laulaau Lea

texts.en:
Laulaau  Lea L. is 55 and married with 6 children.  She owns a business venture, selling a variety of different products in the local community.  Laulaau  has 3 years of experience in this business.  Laulaau  needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Laulaau  joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Laulaau 's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Laulaau  Lea L. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.7 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.5 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Aguas Cristalinas Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Aguas Cristalinas, inicia su primer ciclo con 10 socias, las socias son del Distrito de Vinchos, Comunidad de Paccha.
Las socias realizan diferentes actividades como la venta de animales menores, cereales, agricultura.
Como es el caso de la Señora Segundina que es casada, Segundina se dedicara a la compra y venta de animales menores, hasta ahora no realizaba ninguna actividad económica, se dedicaba a su hogar porque no tenia capital, su préstamo será invertido en la compra de cerdos y ovejas. Los sueños de Segundina son ampliar su negocio y educar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales. 
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos de préstamo como 300 soles, 500 soles, 600 soles, 1000 soles haciendo un total de 8,000 soles en prestamos en el Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
The Aguas Cristalinas (Crystalline Waters) communal bank is starting its first loan cycle with 10 members, who are from Vinchos district, Paccha community. The members are involved in a variety of commercial activities such as: animal sales, cereals, farming. Such is the case of Segundina. Segundina is married and is a small farm animal merchant. Up to now, she wasn’t involved in any commercial activity. She was a housewife only because she had no capital. She will use her loan to buy pigs and sheep. Segundina’s dream is to expand her business and educate her children so that they may become professionals. The members each need different loan amounts: 300 soles, 500 soles, 600 soles, 1000 soles, adding up to an 8000 sol group loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs and sheep.

loans.name: Nem

texts.en:
Mrs. Nem K. and her husband, Mr. Pann Mean (pictured together), live in a small village located approximately 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1971 and have six children: three sons and three daughters. Three of their children are married and live in separate homes; one son is a fisherman, one drives a horse cart and one attends school. 

Nem has been selling fish for more than ten years.  Her husband has been driving a horse cart for more than five years. She is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase fishing nets for her son who is a fisherman.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets for her son’s fishing business

loans.name: Kurmanalieva's Group

texts.en:
Kurmanalieva A. is 55 years old; she's the leader of her group. A. is  a resident of Kochkorka. She is divorced and she raised 2 sons by herself. Her older son is 23 and he works a taxi driver in Bishkek. The other one is 18; he helps at home with housework.  A. has been working as a laboratory assistant for 36 years. She wants to get a loan for purchasing fuel, which is needed for sowing wheat. In autumn A. is planning to marry off her son.

Orozbaktieva S. is 32, and she's married. Her husband is engaged in cattle reselling. They have 5 sheep, which can be sold if necessary. S. has a daughter and a son, both of them are preschool age. Now S. needs a loan for purchasing fuel, which is needed for farming. In future S. wishes to expand their business and to find a job for her husband.

Orozbaktieva A. is the treasurer of the group. She's 35, and has 3 daughters. The younger daughter is preschool age; others study at school.  A.'s husband has his private mill, where he works and A. is engaged in wholesale and retail selling of bread. The money received from this loan will be spent for purchasing fuel, which is needed for farming. In future they are planning to buy a house in Bishkek for their children.

Abdyralieva T. is 49; she's married and has raised 4 children: 3 sons and a daughter. The daughter and the older son are married and they live separately with their families. The second son works in Bishkek and the younger one is a pupil. T.'s husband works as a private tractor-driver. They need a loan to purchase fuel for farming. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase fuel needed for farming

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en: To make a living, Annabelle T. owns and operates a sari-sari (variety retail shop) selling both food and daily use products in her community. She is 39 years old, married and has two school-aged children. They are from the village of Baluarte, Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City. Annabelle has been in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Annabelle joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase products to sell. Annabelle is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Baluarte, Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Phom

texts.en:
Mrs. S. is a young woman and the mother of a lovely baby who is not yet school-aged. To be responsible for her family, S. works sewing clothes in a garment factory.

S.'s husband also contributes to the family. He is skilled in crafting furniture by hand, including wooden beds, and he has been using his knowledge to earn money. Recently, S.’s husband complained that he doesn’t have enough money to purchase essential materials to produce beds to fulfill the requirements of his customers. Therefore, S. has decided to look a loan for her husband to use to buy the required articles.

loans.use: To purchase materials for making furniture

loans.name: We Go Try Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “We Go Try” group. They are small-scale-business women based in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Aminata K.. Aminata is age 45; she was born in Makeni, where she is currently residing together with her husband and their seven children. Her husband is a businessman and four of her children are in secondary school.

For many years now, Aminata has been selling fried cakes. With her share of the loan, she will buy flour, frying oil, yeast, a bowl, etc., in order to produce a large quantity of cakes to sell.

loans.use: To buy flour, frying oil, yeast, a bowl, etc., in order to produce a large quantity of cakes to sell

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina J. is from the village of Amoyong, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 38 years old. Christina is widowed and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Christina owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Christina has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Christina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Christina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Christina is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Christina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rose Adhiambo

texts.en:
Rose Adhiambo N. is 33 years old and married with two children. She lives with her family in Nyamasaria Estate, a low income area in Kisumu City, and her spouse runs a motorcycle transport business. 

To supplement her husband’s income, Rose runs a fish selling business in the estate. Her main customers are women within Nyamasaria Estate. Fish is a popular dish in the area, which attributes to her generating a monthly income of 16,000 KES ($200). She joined Kadet Ltd. to access financial services and she hopes to use her first loan to buy more fish for sale. Apart from this, she plans to maintain a good repayment record so that she can qualify for more loans from Kadet Ltd.

Rose is a visionary who feels the sky is the limit. She plans to expand her market base and become a fish supplier to nearby towns. This she believes will increase her income and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more fish for sale.

loans.name: Susana Amalia

texts.es:
Susana de 25 años, ella vive en una zona periurbana en la Primavera de Duran,  ella tiene una papelería en el Ecuador se les llama “bazar”.

Con la motivación de mantener a su hijo de 4 años tuvo que invertir sus ahorros para comprar papelería y comenzar a venderla a sus conocidos. Ahora trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 20h00pm en su propio negocio. Una de las dificultades es la falta de tiempo y la delincuencia que ahora hay en el sector, por eso tuvo que poner rejas en su negocio (como aparece en la foto). 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, plumas y papelería para su negocio, en el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
25-year old Susana lives in a suburban area called Primavera de Duran. She runs a stationery store which in Ecuador is called a ‘bazaar’. Motivated by the need to provide for her 4-year old son, Susana had to invest all her savings in buying merchandise and sell it to acquaintances. She works from 8am to 8pm. One of the problems she faces is a lack of time and also the petty crime in the area. Because of this, she has had bars put on her business (as shown in the photo). With the loan Susana will buy notebooks, pens, and stationery for her store. Her future goal is to finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pens and stationery

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Mrs. Naomi S. is from the barangay of P5 Carangan, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old, married, and blessed with 3 children all of whom are adults now. To make a living, she is presently engaged in a scrap buying business, particularly bottles, cartons and plastics. She’s been engaged in this kind business for 1 year & 6 months already and earns approximately Php2,500 a month from this business activity. 

Just this year, Naomi joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Naomi, as a newly recognized member of Paglaum MPC under the Regular Loan Program, is now requesting a loan of Php20,000 as her 1st loan, which will be used to add capital to her existing scrap buying business, particularly bottles, cartons and plastics. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, especially in meeting their basic needs, savings for future use, loan repayments and possible business expansion.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for scrap buying business.

location.town: Ozamis-P5 Carangan, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Rosa De Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
El grupo Rosa de Guadalupe está con formado por tres mujeres trabajadoras y esforzadas  una de ellas es Martha C. quien vende ropa desde hace 5 años. Negocio en el que invertirá el crédito y el cual desea mejorar especialmente tener su propia tienda.

Los otros integrantes del grupo son Liseth R. de 36 años vende desde helados, refrescos y helados y José Angel C. quien vende ropa.
texts.en:
The Rosa de Guadalupe Group is made up of three hardworking and dedicated individuals. One of them is Martha C. who has been selling clothing for the past five years. She will invest the loan into her business which she hopes to improve by having her own store. The other group members are Liseth R., 36, who sells ice cream and soft drinks, and José Angel C., who sells clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: merchandise such as clothing

loans.name: Los Sauces Group

texts.es:
Julia S., con  34 años D. edad es la Presidenta D. la alcancía comunal “Los Sauces” conformado por 9 socias los cuales radican en la zona D. los sauces distrito D. Ate Vitarte D. ahí el nombre del grupo, ya que todas viven en la misma zona; vienen trabajando con Edaprospo desD. hace 10 años.
Nuestras socias hacen un gran sacrificio entre los quehaceres del hogar y sus negocios, en el caso D. Julia S. ella lleva adelante un restaurant con su madre, ya que fue así como comenzó en el negocio y hoy en día lo administra, a su vez estudia Ingles por las tardes, el presente préstamo lo invertirá en mejoras del negocio y en continuar sus estudios. Cabe mencionar el entusiasmo y el deseo D. seguir saliendo adelante con esfuerzo y dedicación hacia un bienestar y mejora D. cada una D. las integrantes D. la alcancía comunal.
texts.en:
Julia S., 34, is the president of the communal bank "Los Sauces."  The bank is maD. up of 9 members who are from the Los Sauces district of Ate Vitarte, which their group is named after, since all of the members live in the same area.  They have been working with EDAPROSPO for 10 years.

The members of this group sacrifice a lot, between the household chores and their businesses.  In the case of Julia S., she and her mother have a restaurant.  She started out in the business this way, and now she runs it herself and at the same time studies English in the evenings.  This loan will be invested in improvements to her business and in her studies.  It is worth mentioning that each member of this group has enthusiasm and a strong desire to get ahead through hard work and dedication.

loans.use: to make improvements to her business

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Mrs. Meas S., 44, is married to Mr. Keur, age 54. They live together in Kompong Tohm province with their one child. Mr. Keur shares responsibility for his family by driving a motor taxi.

Meas sells various kinds of vegetables in Trang Kork market and earns approximately $3 a day. Mr. Keur runs his business very well because he has communication skills which are useful with his customers.

Unfortunately, Meas’ husband’s motorbike often breaks down during use. Because of that, Meas has decided to seek a loan of $300 from HKL, a Kiva partner, which she will use to purchase a used motorcycle to replace the old one.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorcycle

loans.name: Philip Nganatha

texts.en:
Philip has been selling flasks, 'sufurias', basins and buckets in Naivasha town for the last four years.  He is 33 years old, married to Rahab Njeri, and they have two children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his third loan. He repaid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more 'sufurias' and flasks for sell.

In future, Philip hopes to grow his shop to a wholesale one and supply his products on a large scale.

loans.use: To buy more 'sufurias' (pots) and flasks for resale

loans.name: Grace Ngami

texts.en:
Grace is a 43 years old single mother of two children who are all married. She has a retail shop where she sells sugar, salt, flour, tea leaves, soaps and detergents. She has been in the business for 10 years and gets a profit of KSH 20,000 per month.

This is her second loan with KADET and she intends to use it to add more stock of sugar, tea leaves and flour. She hopes to educate her grandchildren and be of help to other people by also educating their children.

loans.use: To add more stock of sugar, tea leaves and flour.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites S. is from the village of Agay-ayan, Gingoog City. She is 42 years old and married, with 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Marites  buys and sells coconuts. Marites has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

Marites joined HSPFI earlier this year to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional coconuts to buy and sell. Marites is requesting a new loan, her second, for 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Erdenechimeg

texts.en:
Erdenechimeg B. is 43 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Han-Uul province in UlaanB., the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent in a rented fence. Her youngest daughter attends a local secondary school. 

Erdenechimeg and her husband manage a clothing trade business. She sells a variety of clothing items out of a stall in the trade center of their province. She started her clothing business in September 2010 with capital of 900,000 MNT. Since then, they have managed to stabilize their business operation and today, their working capital exceeds 1,300,000 MNT. Since operating this business, they have earned a monthly income of 450,000 MNT and have used their earnings to provide for their family.

For the future, Erdenechimeg hopes to continue to grow her business and expand by selling a wide variety of clothes to her customers. She is a helpful and hardworking person and says, "We work very hard to create a nice and decent future for our children." She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more winter clothes in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase winter clothes for resale

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Seng C., 33, produces hammocks to sell and grows sugarcane, earning an income of USD 2.5 per day. C. is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 3 per day. The family has to spend USD 35 on food, USD 3 on electricity supply, and USD 48 on other necessary expenses every month. C. is requesting a loan of USD 400 to purchase more fabrics to produce hammocks to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy fabrics to produce hammocks to sell.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es: Mariela, de 23 años, es una joven madre de familia, muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Nilson (24)  y su pequeña hija , a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro.Los arduos trabajos que realiza en su chacra, han logrado  que sus cultivos estén muy bien cuidados y que los días de venta, sus productos sean rápidamente comprados. Su principal fuente de ingresos, es la venta de plátanos y café, en cantidad ya que son de  muy buena calidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que siente que su trabajo esta dando sus frutos, lleva tres  años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden afectarlas. Con el tiempo, desea adquirir nuevas tierras, para ampliar sus cultivos.Este es el segundo préstamo de Mariela con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y nunca a tenido problema con los integrantes de su banco comunal, en donde es la encargada de poner la cuota de alegría que mantiene a las demás socias muy felices.Con los mil doscientos soles solicitados, tiene planeado comprar cantidad de abono e insecticidas para mejorar sus plantaciones, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Mariela is a very modest and hard-working young mother aged 23.  She lives in her own home together with her husband Nilson (24) and her young daughter for whom she would like to provide a better future.

The hard work that Mariela does on her farm has meant that her crops are very well cared for and, on sales days, her products sell quickly.  Her main source of income is selling bananas and coffee in quantity.  They are very good quality.  What Mariela most likes about her work is harvesting her crops since she feels that her work is bearing fruit.  She has been in this business for three years and she considers that the most difficult part of her work is protecting her crops from the pests that can affect them.  Over time, she would like to acquire new land so that she can expand her crops.

This is Mariela's second loan from MFP.  She has been very punctual with her payments and has never had any problems with the other members of her community bank where she is in charge of injecting the happiness quota that keeps the other members very happy.  Mariela plans to use the 1,200 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy a quantity of manure and insecticides to improve her plantations.  In this way, she hopes to improve her profits.

loans.use: To buy manure and insecticides for her crops

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis lives in Kiambu where he does farming.  He has been a farmer for nine years.  Through farming, he is able to provide for his family.  He is also educating his two children who are in school. He dreams of being a prosperous businessman in the future.  With the loan of 40,000 Kes, he will buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Bora Group

texts.fr: Eliza K.  est entrepreneur, membre du groupe d’affaire bora, âgée de 55 ans, veuve, mère de 4 enfants parmi les quels 3 étudient et l’autre n’étudie pas faute de moyens. Eliza K.  est  vendeuse des habits pagnes pour dames. Elle s’installe au marché central de Virunga. Elle démarra son activité avec un fonds propre reçu de sa fille ainée. Il ya 10 ans qu’elle est en activité. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  des nouvelles marchandises (4 doubles des pagnes).  En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise, passer le reste de sa V. en paix selon L. volonté de Dieu. L. cliente Eliza K. remercie Hekima pour  ses actions dédiées aux pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Le groupe bora est constitué de 29 membres.
texts.en: Eliza K. is an entrepreneur. She is a member of the Bora business group, aged 55 years, widowed, and the mother of four children, three of whom are students.  The fourth is not able to study due to lack of money.  Eliza K. sells pagnes (lengths of colored cloth used for clothing) for women.  She sets up at the central market in Virunga. She was able to start her business with money received from her oldest daughter.  She has been in business for ten years. This new loan will allow her to stock up on new merchandise (four bundles of pagnes).  In addition, she aspires to grow her business and spend the rest of her life in peace according to the will of God.  Eliza K. thanks Hekima for their work dedicated to poor women who are excluded from the traditional banking system.  The Bora group is made up of 29 members.

loans.use: 4 bundles of pagnes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to boost her capital by purchasing ladies' pagnes (wax cloth robes), and also to diversify her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying cement, boards... to renovate her house

loans.name: Prom

texts.en: Pom T., 54, resides in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. T. is a worker at the railway station, earning an income of about $4 per day. His wife sells handmade brooms, earning an income of around $2 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $35 on food and $40 on the other necessary expenses. T. is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. In the future, he would like to use any additional income to repair his house. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to commute to work

loans.name: Samaher

texts.en:
Samaher Shafie is a wife and a mother of four children. Samaher's husband is a farmer working in a nursery. Samaher and her family live in a house of two bedrooms and a sitting room.

Samaher took out a loan from FATEN to build on a room as there's land surrounding the house, to make the house bigger for the family.

Samaher's husband appears in the picture here as she is a conservative woman.

loans.use: to build a room on to the house.

loans.name: Luis Angel

texts.es: Luis Ángel se dedica a la venta de comida. Tiene más de 3 años en este negocio, pues siempre ha demostrado ser una persona responsable. Inicio este medio de vida por la necesidad de sufragar los ingresos de su hogar, ya que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y ganarse la vida de una forma humilde. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de granos básicos, verduras,   utensilios de cocina, leña entre otras cosas.
texts.en: Luis Ángel sells food.  He’s been in this business for more than three years and has always shown to be a responsible person.  He started this way of earning a living because he needed an income to pay the household expenses.  He’s always enjoyed working and earning a humble living.  He will use the money from this loan to buy basic grains, vegetables, kitchen utensils, firewood, and other things.

loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
El Banco comunal se denomina “SUMAC TIKA-VALLE SAGRADO”; Este Banco se encuentra situado en el Poblado de Qotohuycho, perteneciente a la Provincia de Urubamba, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Concepción, la socia tiene 29 años de edad;  la socia es casada, la socia tiene 4 hijos de 12, 11, 9, 10 meses de edad; la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la crianza de animales menores, la socia cría pollos para la venta, la socia se encarga de comprar pollos al por mayor los cría alimenta, y luego los vende al por mayor, ella también tiene gallinas y las crías de estas también son incluidas apara la venta. La socia en esta ocasión comprara una docena de pollos para incrementar sus ganancias, ella tiene pensado vender en solo este mes 40 pollos y seguir comprando varias docenas gradualmente. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de pollos.

La socia agradece el prestamo que le otorgaran y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The communal bank is called “SUMAC TIKA-VALLE SAGRADO” and is located in Qotohuycho which belongs to Urubamba Province, Cusco Department.

Concepción, 29, is the member.  She’s married and has four children who are 12, 11, 9 and 10 months of age.  She alternates her household chores with raising small farm animals.  She raises chickens to sell.  She buys chicks at wholesale, feeds them and then sells them at wholesale.  She also has chickens and she also includes their chicks in the sales.

On this occasion she will buy a dozen chickens to increase her profits.  She plans to sell 40 chickens this month and continue buying dozens more gradually.  She is asking for the loan to buy chickens.

The client is grateful for the loan and is committed to paying her installments in the established timeframe.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Maritza Del Socorro

texts.es: Maritza se dedica a la venta de comida. Tiene más de 10 años en este negocio, pues siempre ha demostrado ser una persona responsable. Inicio este medio de vida por la necesidad de sufragar los ingresos de su hogar, ya que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y ganarse la vida de una forma humilde. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de granos básicos, verduras, utensilios de cocina, leña entre otras cosas. a pesar de los desafíos que enfrenta como son de salud ya que tiene dolores fuertes de rodillas y esto la deja muy enferma, pero Martiza sabe que tiene que levantarse para poder obtener algo de ganancia para comer y pagar su deuda.
texts.en: Maritza operates a food catering business.  She's owned the business for more than 10 years and it's proof of just how responsible a businesswoman she is.  She started the business because she needed an income to pay her bills.  She likes working and she can pay her own way because she's always lived modestly.  Maritza is applying for a loan so that she can buy supplies--vegetables, cooking utensils, firewood, etc.--for her business.  Although she faces challenges--terrible pain in her knees, for example, that make her sick--she knows that she has to get up every day to work and make the money she needs to live.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food catering business.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia es una madre trabajadora que con su esfuerzo y la ayuda de su pareja logro poner su  negocio de cabinas de internet, viendo que el negocio era rentable en su zona, ella nos comenta que comenzó con 4 computadoras, y que actualmente todos sus ingresos cubre  sus gastos de su familia es por tal motivo que no solo se dedica a ese rubro sino que también  trabaja eventualmente en una  municipalidad,  en el puesto de limpieza y pintura. El anhelo de lucia implementar su negocio comprando una impresora y una fotocopiadora para así poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y obtener más ganancias. Gracia al crédito solicitado ella piensa  invertir en su negocio comprando una impresora.
texts.en: Lucia is a working mother who with her own effort and help from her spouse managed to set up an Internet access business when she noted that this business was profitable in her zone.  She comments that she started out with four computers and currently her income covers her family’s expenses.  Because of this she doesn’t just do this type of work but she also works occasionally at a municipality as a cleaning person and painter.  Lucia’s dream is to equip her business buying a printer and a photocopier to provide better customer service and earn higher profits.  Thanks to the requested loan she plans to invest in her business buying a printer.

loans.use: to buy a printer.

loans.name: Fadwa

texts.en:
