Fadwa is a 56 year old single woman, working in tailoring since 1978. This is  her one and only source of income.

Fadwa is a hard worker. She is specialized in sewing and tailoring curtains, in addition to bed shields and blankets. She's very talented and creative. That's why her customers work hard on recommending her to others. Most of Fadwa's customers are restaurants and schools, in addition to small hotels and individuals. 

Fadwa has been an Al Majmoua borrower for four cycles, her previous loans helped a lot in increasing and improving her business. She is requesting a loan, this time, in order to buy new textiles, fabrics, needles and necessary threads. She needs these items to improve her quality and quantity of work.
Fadwa hopes to open a big factory of her own in the future.

loans.use: to buy new textiles, fabrics, needles and necessary threads.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is a 46-year-old, married woman with 5 children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Milagros has a fishing/fish-vending business in the Philippines. Milagros has been in this business for 30 years. Milagros is requesting a loan in the amount of 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fishing materials. In the future, Milagros would like to save money to expand her business and to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase fishing materials

loans.name: Kaiss

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 33 years old, married and has one child.
Since 2003 Kaiss has run a workshop selling spare parts and engine oil for cars. He has more than 12 years of experience in this field, a good reputation and is well known in his area. He is requesting a $2,600 loan to pay the annual rent and to purchase additional inventory. He is aiming to earn more profits to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent and purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: Ricardo  de 49 años vive en el barrio San Roque de la ciudad de Barranquilla con su esposa y tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 27 y 33 años. Allí en su barrio tiene un negocio mediante el cual elabora productos alimenticios, como chuzos de carne, pollo, chorizo o butifarra acompañado de verduras, que venden él y su esposa por volumen a negocios que comercializan comidas rápidas y también directamente ellos, a través de 2   carritos especiales que él mismo diseñó, de 1,10 metros por 60 centímetros,  compuestos por 3 llantas, un espacio delantero donde ubica su asador y parrillas, una vitrina y un deposito ubicado en la parte trasera, donde guardan los insumos. La idea de emprendimiento surgió desde el año 1978 en la ciudad de Barranquilla,  porque Ricardo antes de iniciarlo en esta ciudad,  se dedicaba a viajar de feria en feria por todo el país, y cuando llegó a vender sus productos durante la época del Carnaval, pensó como dice la canción del fallecido maestro Joe Arroyo “En Barranquilla me quedo” y desde entonces se estableció en esta capital, previendo su potencial comercial. Su mayor desafío es su capital de trabajo, pues muchas veces es insuficiente para proveer a los vendedores ambulantes que le solicitan, esta es la razón de su credikiva, con el cual comprará materiales para la preparación de sus productos y también herramientas como asadores, trinches y tenazas, así como recipientes plásticos donde guardar las salsas. Su mayor sueño es tener una casa propia y con ello una distribuidora de comidas rápidas.
texts.en: Ricardo is 49 years old and he lives in the community of San Roque in the city of Barranquilla. He lives with his wife and he has 2 children, aged 27 and 33. He has a business in his community through which he produces foods, such as meat skewers, chicken, spicy sausages or traditional Peruvian sausages with sides of vegetables. He and his wife sells these products in quantities to businesses that sell fast foods but they also sell directly to the clients. They have 2 special carts which he designed, measuring 1.1 meters by 60 centimeters and bearing three tires. The front section consists of a roaster and grills, a display, and a storage container in the back where they keep their ingredients. The business idea started out in 1978 in the city of Barranquilla. Prior to this business Ricardo used to travel from fair to fair throughout the entire country. But when he came to sell his products during the Carnaval season, he was inspired by the song of the late Joe Arroyo, named "En Barranquilla me quedo", meaning "I will stay in Barranquilla". Since then he has established himself in the capital, having seen the potential for commerce. His greatest challenge is his working capital and often it is insufficient to meet the vendors' demand. And this is the reason why he requests a Kiva loan. He will purchase ingredients with which he will prepare his products and he will also purchase tools such as spits, forks, and tongs. He will also purchase plastic containers where to store the condiments. His greatest dream is to have a house of his own and to set up a fast food supply company.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to prepare his products and to purchase tools such as spits, forks, and tongs.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa sells beans and rice at Abura. She is divorced and has 4 children.  She has been in her business for 10 years. She uses the income she makes from her sales to educate, feed, clothe and shelter her children. Her loan will be used to get more bags of rice and beans to cook for the business. She hopes to reinvest the new profit.

loans.use: buy rice and beans

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
Guadalupe is 52 years old and married. The family manufactures lampakanay products to earn a living. (Lampakanay is a semi-aquatic herb with durable fibers extracted to make various products.) Her husband also is working as a carpenter, but that job is irregular in nature so they focus much attention on developing the business. From this plant, Guadalupe, along with the whole family, creates various ropes, mats, braided furniture and many other products. The business has existed for over 5 years of time, and a total of PHP 5,000 is normally generated in a month.

A month ago, Guadalupe joined GDMPC. She is currently applying for a loan of PHP 7,000 from the cooperative to purchase additional raw materials to cope with orders that are to be completed soon. She aims to increase sales on succeeding operations and lay aside exact funds to elevate productivity as well as quality.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita D. 40 años D. edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito D. TambogranD. que pertenece al departamento D. Piura.   Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Margarita desD. hace muchos años se dedica a la crianza y venta D. animales D. corral (aves, ovejas y cerdos), sus corrales se encuentra en la parte posterior D. su casa, los cuales son apropiados, los alimenta con comida balanceada, pastos y granos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un óptimo crecimiento para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados D. la zona y así obtenga buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos D. su hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 2500 nuevos soles para la compra D. más animales y su respectiva comida, con las ganancias que obtenga con la venta D. sus animales podrá cubrir su crédito como tener una mejor calidad D. vida.  Margarita es una persona que con esfuerzo y mucho empeño a sabido sacar adelante a su familia para que logren su objetivo propuesto.
texts.en:
40-year-old Margarita lives with her family in her own home which receives basic services.  It is located in the rural part of TambogranD. district, in Piura department.  The people in this area farm, raise livestock and make handicrafts.

Margarita has been raising and selling farmyard animals (birds, sheep and pigs) for many years.  Her pens are located behind her home and they are suitable for her animals.  She feeds her animals balanced feed, fodder and natural grains so that they reach an optimal level of development and she is able to sell them in the different markets in her area, making good profits with which to cover her household expenses.

Margarita has requested a loan for 2,500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more animals and their respective feed.  She will use the profits that she makes from selling her animals to repay her loan and enjoy a better quality of life.  Margarita is a person who, through her own effort and a lot of determination, has known how to get her family ahead in life so that they achieve their goals.

loans.use: to buy animals and their respective feed

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is aged 37 and a resident of Litein, South Rift, Kenya. He is married with three children aged between 7 and 3 years, and has been in farming for 6 years. He currently employs one farmhand and produces milk which he sells to the local market.

Erick has requested a loan of 70,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. He had previously acquired a loan of 45,000 KES which he repaid promptly. He does not have any other source of income and says the loan will help improve his family's living standards and educate his children. He also wants to rear only pure breeds in future.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Marlene tiene 32 años, es soltera. Viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el distrito de Sivia. Para ella la clave del éxito esta en la responsabilidad, puntualidad y el de valorar a sus clientes. A pesar de no tener una educación completa, decidió emprender un negocio que es la venta de ropa, para ello monto una pequeña tienda, ya que son muchos los clientes que la visitan a su establecimiento.  Ahora puede cubrir los gastos familiares, entre ello ayudar a sus hermanos con su educación. Por tanto procura abastecerse de ropa, y además estar a la vanguardia de la moda, para así no dejar de captar clientes.  Generalmente trabaja por cuenta propia, pero hay ocasiones que sus hermanos la apoyan en el negocio. Mas adelante desea ampliar su tienda, introdociendo nuevos productos. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 3,000 soles que solicita, comprará más prendas de vestir.
texts.en: Marlene is 32 years old and single.  She lives in her own house located in the district of Sivia.  In her opinion, the key to success is responsibility, punctuality and customer service.  Despite the fact that she was not able to finish her education she decided to start a business selling clothing.  She set up a small shop and has many customers who visit her establishment.  Now she can cover family expenses and help her siblings with their education.  She tries to stock fashionable garmets to attract customers.  Generally she works independently but sometimes her siblings help out.  In the future she would like to expand her shop and introduce new products.  This is her first loan through MFP and she is committed to paying it back on time. The loan, in the amount of 3,000 PEN, will be used to buy mO. clothing.

loans.use: To buy more clothing.

loans.name: Rosalia Ramona

texts.es: La Señora Rosalía tiene 36 años es casada y tiene 1 hijo de 19 años que todavía está bajo su cargo. Ella solicita este crédito para la compra 1 manzana de tierra que tiene cosecha de caña. Pues ella se dedica a sembrar caña, yuca entre otros productos. Este negocio lo inicio por la necesidad de sufragar los gastos de su hogar, pues sus padres se dedicaban a esta actividad su madre falleció y fue así que ella logro obtener este medio de vida.
texts.en: Señora Rosalia is 36 years old. She is married and has one son, who is 19 and whom she still supports. She is applying for this loan to purchase 1 mz. of land (about 1.7 acres) which has a crop of sugar cane. Then she will plant cane and yucca, among other crops. She began this business because of the need to pay household expenses, since her parents did this kind of work. Her mother has died, but this was how Rosalia learned this way of making a living.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is married to Esther. He is a carpenter and has been in the business for the past two years. His monthly income from the business is about KES 10,000. This is his first loan term from KADET LTD. He will use the loan amount to purchase wood to make furniture. The anticipated profits will be used to open another outlet. His dream is to have a stable income to care for his family.

loans.use: to purchase wood.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 41 años es una mujer hermosa. Vive junto a Fredy, su esposo desde hace 21 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, todos ellos menores y a los que cuidan en su casa propia, ubicada en la ciudad de Huancayo. Cuando terminó sus estudios superiores, comenzó a ejercer la profesión de docencia; con el paso de los años conformó su familia, es ahí que le propusieron administrar una escuela de conductores, donde percibe un sueldo mensual. Pero su sueño siempre fue tener su propia empresa y con ayuda de su esposo, que es catedrático en la universidad del estado. Abrieron una constructora llamada “CONSAP”, desde ahí realizan trabajos con gobiernos municipales del estado peruano, como: construcción de carreteras, electrificaciones rurales y demás labores de infraestructura. Hace poco comenzaron y le falta mucho para consolidarse, pero no se desanima, pues está segura que tendrá mucho éxito. Ella pertenece un grupo solidario y este es el  séptimo crédito con MFP, donde está contenta, porque tendrá apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. María de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en los gastos representativos para los trámites de su empresa.
texts.en:
41-year-old María is a fine woman.  She lives with Fredy, her husband of 21 years.  The couple have four children who are all dependent upon them.  They care for their children in their own home which is located in the city of Huancayo.  María finished her higher education and started working as a teacher.  Over the years she formed her family.  It was suggested that she start managing a driving school, from which she earns a monthly wage.  However, her dream was always to own her own business and, with the help of her husband who is a professor at a state university, they started a construction company called 'Consap' which carries out work with municipal governments from the State of Peru, building roads, carrying out rural electrification work and other infrastructure jobs.  They started this work a short while ago and they have a long way to go to consolidate their position.  However, they are not discouraged and María is certain that they will be successful.

María belongs to a community bank and this is her seventh loan from MFP.  She is happy to be a member of her bank because she will have financial support.  In this way, she will feel safe in making progress in her work.  For her part, she pledges to make her loan repayments on time.  María is happy to be a member of her community bank because all the members are responsible and very supportive people.  With your support, María will invest the money she has requested in covering legal expenses related to her business.

loans.use: to pay administrative costs for her building company

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es: El señor José Ángel construyo su vivienda con ahorros para brindar a su familia un techo digno de vivir y un mejor patrimonio. La casa tiene como techo de lámina y madera porque es más económica y en ese momento solo su economía le permitía colocar ese tipo de material. En este momento la madera ya se está deteriorando por las lluvias y ya el agua se comienza a trasminar por tal motivo quiere poner el techo de concreto para que este mejor reforzado y no sufrir las inclemencias del tiempo de esta manera ninguno de su familia enfermaría. Para colocar el techo necesita comprar cemento, arena, cascajo y pagar al albañil que hará el trabajo.
texts.en: Mr José Ángel used his savings to build a home for his family in order to give them a roof over their heads. The home's roof is made of wood and laminate because it is cheaper and this is all he can afford at the moment. The wood is already deteriorating from the rains and the water is starting to seep through, so Jose wants to install a concrete roof so that the roof will be stronger. This way, they won't have to suffer during inclement weather, and no one in the family will get sick. In order to instal the roof, he needs to buy cement, sand, and gravel, and pay the builder to do the work.

loans.use: to buy construction material.

loans.name: Minda

texts.en: Minda is 54 years old, married and lives with her husband and five children in Guingona City. For the last 10 years, she has earned about PHP 5,000 a month by growing vegetables that she also sells in a local market. She joined GDMPC earlier this year as a way to improve her life, and is applying for her first loan, for PHP 5,000, to buy fertilizer. She plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to expand a vegetable-selling business.

loans.name: Pastora

texts.es: Pastora tiene 29 años, está casada con Gregorio de 34 años, fruto de esta relación tienen 3 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Pastora es una madre joven dedicada al trabajo en el campo, que junto a su esposo cultivan y producen granos de cacao, productos que vende de manera ambulante y más cuando hay temporada de fiestas en su ciudad, por la visita continua de turistas. Su único fin es ganra dinero para ofrecer una estabilidad económica a su familia. Ahora ella y su querido esposo decidieron mejorar su vivienda ya que solamente estaba hecha de madera y techo de calamina, y por tanto desea mejorar su vivienda, ya que en ocasiones las bajas temperaturas humedecía su casa. Este será su segundo credito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de material de construcción para su vivienda.
texts.en: Pastora is 29. She is married to Gregorio, age 34, and they have three children. They live together in their own home located in the Pichari district. Pastora is a young mother who works in the fields. She and her husband cultivate cocoa, which they sell in street markets. They sell more during their town's festivals, because of the continual stream of tourists. Pastora's only goal is to generate an income in order to provide her family with economic stability. She and her beloved husband have now decided to improve their home, since it is only made of wood with a corrugated iron roof. For this reason, she wants to improve her home; when the temperatures are low, her house gets damp. This will be her second loan with MFP, and she promises to repay her quotas punctually. She will invest these 1500 nuevos soles in the purchase of construction materials for her home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more inventory and paint and to fix lighting in the store

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
This is Manuel, 32, a resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. He is married to Hazel who is a housewife and mother to their two children. Together they manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for his everyday expenses.

Manuel operates a tricycle transportation business. He owns one unit of tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar attached into it) that carries up to four or five passengers to their destination within the community. He earns through the boundary (daily quota) that their driver remits each day. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 300 every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan for additional spare parts and the maintenance of his tricycle unit. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Manuel hopes to be able to expand soon and to sustain their daily needs. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their Tricycle unit

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a furniture-making business in the Philippines.

Vilma requested a loan for 15000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy lumber and equipment for her furniture-making business.

She has been in this business for seven years.

Vilma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy lumber and equipment for her furniture-making business.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is 46 years old and lives in Tangub City. She is married with four children. 

Cynthia has a general store. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase more stock for her general store.

Cynthia has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Kefaya

texts.en: Kefaya is a 39 year old married woman who supports 6 family members from Al-Russeifeh Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 300 JD to pay for her home improvements, she wants to repaint her home and to buy a new furniture. In the past she was buying clothes, blankets and housewares to sell. Now she would like to benefit from another loan to provide for her family a good environment to live in.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 34 years old, married, and supports a family of five members. He has been operating a motorcycle service for the last two years, earning KES 8,000 per month.

William has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk with his motorcycle for more income gain.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children. His future hopes and plans are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk with his motorcycle for more income gain.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es: FLORA: Es una señora alegre de 48 años de edad, pertenece a la etnia miskita de la Ciudad de Bilwi, Municipio de Puerto Cabezas, está casada, tiene 5 hijos: 2 son mayores de edad y tres en edad escolar. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca artesanal. Ella, desde hace 15 años se dedica a la comercialización de mariscos, generando sus propios ingresos contribuyendo a los gastos del hogar y educación de sus hijos. Solicita financiamiento para comprar más pescados y marisco y así poder incrementar sus ingresos y de esa manera poder mejorar su vivienda que necesita reparación. Su sueño es llegar a ser una negociante exitosa, tener una vivienda más digna con mejores condiciones.

loans.use: para comprar más pescados y marisco

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Mrs. Josephine A. is 44 years old and a trained patient medicine dealer in a suburb of Edo State, Nigeria. She request for the above amount to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more drugs for sales

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: I am a 29-year-old widower with two children. I am a vehicle mechanic.  I am HIV positive. I intend to use the loan to build skill and increase my income.

loans.use: I will use the loan to purchase vehicle repair tools.

loans.name: Fazila

texts.en: Fazila is 47 years old. She lives in district 1 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is an uneducated woman and her husband died during the war in Kabul. She took her 4th group loan cycle and opened a gas shop for her son. He makes a good income for his family and his mother is very happy. She wants to take anther loan to buy extra gas canisters  and expand her son's business. She would like to thank AFSG.

loans.use: To buy extra canisters of gas

loans.name: Lut

texts.en: Mrs. Lut E. is a 50 year old widow living with her four children in Siem Reap, Cambodia.  One of her daughters (pictured here) works at a garment factory, one works at a restaurant and two are students.  Mrs. Lut E. must pay for motor taxis each day to take her children to work and school.  This has become very expensive for the family and they are seeking this loan in order to purchase their own motobike.  In the long run, this will help the family to save money on transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her children to get to work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more pumpkins to sell in her shop

loans.name: Koffi

texts.en:
Mr. K. Koffi was born December 12, 1975 in Vogan. He is married and father of 2 children, with 5 other people under his care. After leaving his internship early, today he has turned himself into Master furniture maker with 8 years of experience in Gbadago. He has en entrepreneurial spirit and a good sense for administration matters. His wife has a small business selling traditional style skirts (pagnes). However, all the earnings from their work is not always enough to support their family. Mr. Koffi lacks the funds to purchase the wood required to create his various kinds of furniture. And so, he would like to request a loan of $1,200 dollars which will help him to see this dream become a reality and satisfy the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mr K. Koffi est né le 12 décembre 1975 à Vogan. Il est marié et père de deux (02) enfants et cinq (05) autres personnes à sa charge. Sorti très tôt de son apprentissage, il est aujourd’hui maître menuisier depuis 08 ans à Gbadago. Il a un bon talent d’entreprenariat et de gestion. Sa femme exerçant un petit commerce de pagne, les revenus ne suffisent toujours pas pour le foyer. Il a des problèmes financiers pour acheter du bois pour la fabrication des meubles de toutes sortes. Sur ce, il voulait un crédit de 1200 dollars qui l’aidera à réaliser ce rêve et satisfaire les besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To purchase planks and wood for furniture.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella S. is 29 years old, married with 2 children, and hails from Lagos, Nigeria.  She is a stylist and also sells weavers and attachments and has been in business for 9 years. She is requesting a loan of $400 to  buy more weavons and attachments.

loans.use: To buy more weavons and attachments

loans.name: Leutogi

texts.en:
Leutogi is a 27-year-old single mother with one child from the village of Papaigalagala. This is her second loan from SPBD in the amount of USD$475. She is a hard-working lady. She sells her ice cakes (homemade popsicles) from her home to village people seven days a week.

Leutogi earns around US$ 60 a day from her business. She is now applying for a loan of USD$475 for expanding of her ice cake business and also for renovating her home.

loans.use: To buy plastic bags, Koolaid, sugar, and also cement, sand, lumber, etc

loans.name: Zulfiniso

texts.en:
U. Zulfiniso is a 38 year-old loving mother of three children. Her husband is an entrepreneur. 

For more than 16 years Zulfiniso has been selling mens clothing in the local market. Thanks to the support and advice of her husband and her own good taste, Zulfiniso has the goods that meet the demands of the most hard-to-please customers. All the clothing is delivered from Bishkek, which is located in the neighboring country of Kyrgyzstan. Currently  Zulfiniso's working capital is about 5,500.00 US dollars.  The business is stable and generates considerable income to the family. 

Zulfiniso is planning the next trip to Bishkek for purchasing the clothing for men. With this purpose she requests 1000.00 US Dollars for the term of 9 months. This is Zulfinio second loan from IMON. The previous loan was paid timely and accurately.

loans.use: Purchasing of the clothing for men for enlarging the range of goods.

loans.name: Salelologa E Centre - Group 1

texts.en: Salelologa is the capital village of Savaii Island.  The central market, the wharf, and bus station are located in Salelologa.  The hub of retail business are also in this village.  Therefore, a large number of households are engaged in retail businesses which targets neighboring villages.  The women in this group are engaged in retail businesses.  Most of the commodities sold in Saleloga are purchased from the capital town, Apia, which is located across the island of Upolu. The members of this group have already undergone the required 4 session training from SPBD and are ready to avail their loans to expand and improve their retail businesses.  Some of them engage in other income-generating activities such as: elei printing (a traditional Samoan way of fabric printing), sewing, making pancakes and selling furniture.

loans.use: to purchase additional commodities to sell at the retail shop; to make improvements in the store (shelving, painting, roofing); to purchase additional materials for elei printing

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa A. is an unmarried mother of three children living in Offinsu, Ghana. For the past eight years, Adwoa has earned a living by selling clothes, bags, shoes, and T shirts. She typically "hawks," or carries the products on top of her head, in the neighboring towns and communities.

She has applied for a loan of $1,025 U.S. dollars so she can buy more inventory from the neighboring country of Togo, where it's cheaper. Adwoa is a member of the group called “Yonko Do," which means Oneness. Members of the group guarantee for each other to re-pay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more jeans, bags, and clothes to sell

loans.name: Patricio

texts.es:
I need to build a room in my house for my children because my home is very small but I don't have the resources to build the room or hire help. I am asking for a loan of $1,000 to build a room and to pay for the labor. This way I will have more room in my house.
Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.
Me esta haciendo falta un cuarto para los niños ya que la casa esta algo reducida. Pero ya no tengo material y para pagar la mano de obra. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para la construcción de un cuarto y pago de la mano obra. Y así tener mas espacio en mi casa.

loans.use: To build a room

loans.name: Alhassan

texts.en:
Alhassan B. sells porrigde. She is married, but her husband's income from the University of Cape Coast Sanitation Office does not cover the expenses for her family. Demand for her soup is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase the profits she brings back to her family.


She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: As additional capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Martina Rosario

texts.es:
Martina is very dedicated to her work. Her biggest concern always has been improving her financial condition. For this reason she opened a small shop in her own home. The shop provides the income she needs to support her 3 small, school-age children. They are the reason she works every day so that they can finish their studies. Martina’s wish is to increase the merchandise offered in her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

Martina es una mujer muy dedicada al trabajo, su anhelo ha sido siempre el de mejorar su situación económica, así que ella instaló en su propia casa una pequeña tienda la cual emplea para poder tener los ingresos que necesita para el sostén de sus hijos. Ella es madre de 3 pequeños que aún están en edad escolar, por ello se esfuerza cada día para que ellos culminen sus estudios. Su deseo es incrementar la mercadería de su tienda.

loans.use: Increase store merchandise

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth A. is 25 years old and married with 2 children. He lives in Benin City with his family. He sells handsets and recharge cards. He has been in this business since 2006. He learned this business for 2 months from a friend.

Kenneth is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 1, 200 to buy more handsets and recharge cards for sale. Kenneth is a LAPO client. He expresses his gratitude to all who make this possible.

loans.use: To buy more mobile phones and recharge cards for re-sale

loans.name: Eng

texts.en: Mr. Eng C., 64, is a farmer who grows rice as well as being a construction worker. He can earn up to about US $3.00 per day. He lives in Compong Kdei Commune, Siem Reap Province. His wife, Mrs. Hem Lab is 58 years old and a Khmer cake and desert seller and earns about US $2.50 per day. They both have three children, all of whom are married. One lives in the family home with her husband, whilst the other lives away. Currently, it is the rice growing season and Eng is now requesting a loan of $500 to spend on their farming business (to buy things such as fertilizer). The remainder of the loan he will use for his wife business making Khmer cake and deserts. The loan will support their investments to increase their income. Eng's wife is in picture because Eng is unavailable.

loans.use: to expand the farming business

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
Albertina Es socia del Banco Comunal Empecemos.
Albertina es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 2 hijos, Albertina junto a su esposo tienen un laboratorio fotográfico, en un local alquilado ubicado en el centro de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actualmente cuentan con el apoyo de su cuñado porque ella esta mas dedica a la atención de sus hijos pequeños, Albertina brinda servicios de revelados de fotos, toma de fotos para documentos, venta de cámaras, rollos y diferentes accesorios, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima y también a través de pedidos que le traen a su negocio.
Albertina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de químicos fotográficos.
texts.en:
Ablertina is a member of the Banco Comunal Empecemos community bank.

Albertina lives with her common law husband, is 27 years old and has 2 children. Albertina along with her husband have a photo lab in a rented shop in the downtown area of the city of Ayacucho. Currently she depends on the support of their father-in-law because she has been busy taking care of her small children. Albertina provides photo printing services, scanning services for documents, and she also sells camera, film and different accessories. She acquires her products in the city of Lima and she also places orders that are delivered to her business.

Albertina requires a loan of 1000 soles, funds that will be invested ni the purchase of photographic developing solution.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Albertina requires a loan in the amount of 1000 soles, funds that will be invested in the purchase of photographic developing solution.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok C. is a villager in Tashoue village in Takeo Province. She is a grocer and she has a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. El Sopheak, is a farmer and works in security at the market. Although they have different businesses, they still do not enough money to earn a good living. Thus, Mrs. Sok C. has decided to ask for a loan to buy goods for her business. She hopes this loan will increase and improve her living conditions. She is 25 years old and the mother of one child, who is three years old. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy goods for her business.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en: Mr. Thy N. is a farmer who lives in the village of Samboo in the Kampong Speu Province. He owns a piece of land on which he cultivates rice and earns his living. His wife, Mrs. Phorn Nak, is a pig breeder. Even though they have different businesses, they do not have enough money to support their family and improve living conditions. Thus, Mr. Thy N. decided to request a loan to add to his savings. He would use the capital to build a house for family to live in better conditions. He is 34 years old and the father of three children who are too young to work or study. His wife is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To build a house for family to live in better conditions.

loans.name: Annjane

texts.en:
Annjane is a member of the Alianza Village Bank; she has been working with the bank for five years now. 

Annjane is 42 years old and is the single mother of two children. Annjane runs a store selling “caña” (firewater), a type of alcoholic drink. Locals mix pure alcohol with water to drink, and drink caña by itself or mixed with a little water. She rents her store, which is located on a busy street in the city of Ayacucho, and works seven days a week. She sells her products in large drums and sometimes by the liter. 

Annjane has had her business for seven years; before then she worked in Chiclaya, her hometown. She moved to Ayacucho because business opportunities are better in the city. The caña she sells is purchased from old friends in Chiclaya. 

Annjane is requesting a loan of 3500 soles to buy more caña from Chiclaya. Her goal for the future is to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: Buy caña (firewater) from Chiclaya

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.vi: Chị Dương Thị Huyền năm nay 29 tuổi, chị tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2004. Trước đây thu nhập của gia đình chị chủ yếu dựa vào chăn nuôi và lương làm công nhân của chồng. Sau khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương, được vay vốn chị Huyền đã đầu tư  để kinh doanh các thiết bị điện nước. Hiện tại ngoài thời gian đi làm công nhân chồng chị Huyền còn nhận lắp đặt điện nước cho các hộ gia đình tại địa phương  nên thu nhập của gia đình khá ổn định( 3.500.000đ/ tháng). Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay  15.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn cho công việc kinh doanh thiết bị điện nước
texts.en:
Mrs. Duong Thi H. is 29 years old. She joined TYM Fund in 2004. Before joining the fund, her family's main income came from livestock raising and her husband's salary as a blue collar worker. After joining the fund, she Mrs. Duong borrowed money to invest in selling plumping and electrical equipments. Currently, in addition to working as a blue collar worker, her husband also sets up water and electrical works for the locals' homes so her family's income is very stable (3,500,000 VND/ month.) She would like to borrow 15,000,000 VND to invest in plumping and electrical supplies.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes 7 Group

texts.en:
"Mujeres Valientes" is an Esperanza Bank of Hope based in Puerto Plata. The newest members of this bank have joined "Mujeres Valientes" as the 7th group. Group coordinator Vonice J. is a mother of 3 (children ages 8, 5, and 3), who will invest her loan in clothing sales. She has been selling clothes for ten years now, ever since she arrived in the Dominican Republic from Haiti.

Vonice purchases her inventory in nearby Santiago and sells locally. She will receive 5,000 pesos (about 140 USD) during this first loan rotation and expects to make about a 2,000 (almost $60) peso net profit from her merchandise investment. With her profits, Vonice looks to better her children's lives and pay school fees.

Other members of Vonice's group will also be investing in clothing and accessories for re-sale. This entire group is comprised of Haitian immigrants, a demographic that faces many extra day-to-day challenges in the Dominican Republic.

loans.use: Purchase more varied clothes to sell

loans.name: Fikiria Group

texts.en:
Anna has been a food and clothes seller in the Sakina neighborhood of Arusha for 4 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 70. Every day she works at her business from noon to 6:00 p.m. She is requesting a loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items and clothes for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Anna is 34 years old, married, and has four children, aged between 15 and 1. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Faustina and Esther. Each woman has her own small business in Arusha.

loans.use: To buy more food items and clothes for her business

loans.name: Yaya

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Yaya D.  a 40 ans, marié et père de deux  enfants il vit avec sa femme et leurs enfants  à Banconi, un des quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après une formation en thérapeute, il s’est initié  aux activités d’achat et de vente des produits pharmaceutiques de la pharmacopée chinoise. Avec ses vingt  ans expériences dans ce domaine, il jouit d’une forte réputation à Sikasso et environs.
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son  premier prêt individuel  qui lui permettra d’acheter 3 cartons d’Aloé, 5 cartons de Manames, 5 bidons d’inzam indien, etc. 
Il  s’approvisionne auprès d’un fournisseur à Koutiala et effectue sa vente  à Sikasso dans sa pharmacie (de médecine traditionnelle) située à la gare routière de Sikasso à une clientèle composée des voyageurs et surtout des routiers. Certains de ses clients payent au comptant, d’autre à crédit. 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 400 000 FCFA. Avec ces bénéfices réalisés, il compte résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, celles de sa famille, rembourser les intérêts du prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr.Yaya D. is 40 years old, married and the father of two children. He lives with his with his wife and children in Banconi, a suburb on the outskirts of the city of Sikasso ( third administrative region in the Republic of Mali). After receiving training as a clinician, he started a business buying and selling Chinese made pharmaceutical products. With 20 years experience in this business he enjoys a strong reputation in the Sikasso area. In order to satisfy a growing clientele, he has joined Soro Yiriaso and has made his first individual loan. This will be used to purchase 3 cartons of d'Aloe, 5 cartons of Manames, 5 cans of Indian inzam, etc He buys his supplies from a supplier in Koutiala for resale in his traditional medicine pharmacy in Sikasso. He is located on the station roadway and his clients are composed of travelers and people using the road. Some clients use cash. other buy with credit. With this loan, he expects to realize a monthly income of 400,000 Francs CFA. With the income he expects to meet his expenses and those of his family, meet his loan payments and invest the remainder into his business.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy medications for resale( aloe, maname, etc.)

loans.name: Ayishetu

texts.en:
Ayishetu H. is 38 years old. She is married and has given birth to two children who are both currently in school. Ayishetu lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

She works to make some income to support her husband. She trades in cereals such as maize and beans. She procures bags of maize and beans from farmers in nearby communities. Ayishetu also trades in other food items such as eggs, palm oil, yam, etc. She distributes the food items to retailers in her community and to food vendors.

Ayishetu has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to procure the cereals in bulk to increase her stock. She desires to give her children the best of education she can afford.

loans.use: Procure bags of maize and beans.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  femmes du groupe Sabougnouma (toutes mariées) ont une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent majoritairement dans des  familles monogames à Noumousso un des quartiers de la ville de Kadiolo une préfecture de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur troisième  prêt solidaire. Tous les prêts précédents ont été remboursés sans difficulté.
 Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de condiments alimentaires,  d’habits, de  bouillie,  de chaussures, et de beurre de karité.
 Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter 3 paquets de condiments alimentaires, 2 sacs de 100 kg de sorgho(pour en faire la bouillie), 2 sacs de noix de karité,   5 douzaines d’habits  pour enfants et 3 douzaines de paires de chaussures en plastique. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Kadiolo ville et dans les localités avoisinantes. 
Les marchandises sont vendues, en détail au marché de Kadiolo ville et souvent en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et  de femmes et la plupart au comptant.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 13.750FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins quotidiens et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group Sabougnouma are all married and average 28 years of age and 2 children each. They live mainly in monogamous families in Noumousso, a district in the city of Kadiolo (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

The group members are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their customers and are on their third solidarity loan. All the preceding ones have been repaid without difficulty.

The group members do a diversity of work, including selling condiments, clothing, porridge, shoes, and shea nut butter. With this new loan, they intend to buy three packets of condiments, two 100-kg sacks of sorghum (for making porridge), two sacks of shea nuts, five dozen pieces of children's clothing, and three dozen pairs of plastic shoes. Supplies are gotten at the grand marketplace of Kadiolo City and in neighboring towns. The merchandise is sold retail in mostly cash transactions to customers composed of men and women, at the marketplace of Kadiolo City and often within the family.

The group members each envision realizing an average monthly profit of 13,750 francs CFA. A portion of the profits will be used for day-to-day needs, and the other portion will be invested in business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To raise and sell agoutis

loans.name: Celeste

texts.en: Celeste B. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 28 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. Celeste owns and operates a farm, primarily planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Celeste joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Celeste is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase construction materials for her house. This loan will be her 7th from PMPC. She plans to have a comfortable shelter for the family to live in. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for her house

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: Mabel L., a 46-year-old married mother of three children, sells sarongs of various colors. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy K. is a 38-year-old married father of two. He has been offering computer services in his shop in Shanzu for the last five years. He does printing, typesetting and CD-writing, and also acts as a computer consultant. Kennedy also sells and lends out entertainment videos and books in the same shop. He has many customers from the small but populated beach town of Shanzu who enjoy the various services he offers. Kennedy has previously borrowed from another source to finance his business, but this will be his first loan from Kiva partner, KADET.

With his 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan, Kennedy plans to upgrade his computer and also purchase some new parts and accessories for it. In the future, he hopes to own a computer training school, to be able to serve and empower the residents of Shanzu.

About KADET
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To upgrade his computer and purchase new computer parts

loans.name: Festus

texts.en:
Festus is from Edo State, Nigeria. He is 31 years old and unmarried. He sells pharmaceutical medicines and rechargeable phone cards in his small store and also makes calls.

He hopes for the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more rechargeable phone cards to offer for sale.

He thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell

loans.name: Paulina F.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 70-year old Paulina M. from Mbozi. Paulina is a widow with six children, between the ages of 20 and 40. She is also responsible for supporting two dependants because their parents died of HIV.

Since 2001, Paulina has been running a crop selling business. She works 12 hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by one employee. Paulina currently earns about 100USD a month. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase crops in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity of her business. Paulina thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more crops

loans.name: Domingo Benjamín

texts.es: Don Domingo P. tiene 34 años de edad, es Casado de oficios Albañil,  “Maestro de Obras” cuenta,  cuentan con dos empleados para la misma, lleva 8 años, su residencia se encuentra en el Paraje Chiyax, del  Cantón Pasajoc del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materiales para construcción de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.

loans.use: Servicios (Maestro de obras)

loans.name: Muritalu

texts.en: Muritalu is 34 years old and married with 2 children. He sells medicine and he has been in business for the past 2 years. He hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more medicine to sell. He say thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda P. is from the village of Sepac. She is 53 years old, is married, and has three adult-aged children.

Erlinda owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

In 2004, Erlinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC.

Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Sweetie Pie

texts.en:
Sweetie Pie sells many commodities in her little variety store, which is located in her village. She also sells frozen foods. She makes an income that is sufficient for her children’s daily allowances. She hopes to pursue her store to provide more for her family. 

Sweetie Pie would a loan of PHP 11,000 to continue to develop her store. She plans to use the loan to buy more items to sell. She hopes that, with her loan, she can expand her business further.

Sweetie Pie is 42 years old. She lives with her husband who is a tricycle operator in their village. The couple has three children who are currently in school. The family lives in the village of Magsaysay in Naguilian, Isabela.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: Pauline is 29 years old and the single mother of an eleven-year-old daughter called Margaret. For the past four years, Pauline has sold clothes to neighbours, friends, colleagues, and newcomers. She previously worked for a domestic service. She is requesting her second loan for Kes 30,000 to increase her stock. Pauline says that, since she became a member of Faulu, she has managed to pay her child’s school fees and improve her standard of living. In the future, she also hopes to further her own education and own a home. Pauline also provides counseling in her community and describes herself as having a passion for empowering the underprivileged in society. About Faulu Kenya: Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To add to her stock of clothes

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie has two children with her husband Marlou. Her oldest child is only eight years old. She is 30 years old and farms for a living. She cultivates her field for rice crops. She shared that her rice crops are starting to grow now and need extra care and additional farm inputs. She aims for a quality harvest and to help herself.

She applied for a loan of Php 11, 000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. With this loan, Rosalie will be able to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies so she could achieve quality harvest.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her rice farm.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia is a 47-year-old married woman. She has four children with the oldest 28 years-old. She resides in a town in Agusan Del Sur. She farms rice for a living. She currently owns a two hectare rice field. According to her, the farm needs additional capital. She joined Kiva partner CEVI and applied for a loan of Php 14,000 which she will use to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. This loan will be helpful to Lilia as she aims to grow her farm considerably.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Ezinabala Group, Lugazi

texts.en: N. Jesca is 40 years old and married with nine children, of which five are still in school. She is a business lady selling food stuffs from Nansagazi trading center. Her biggest business challenges are customers who pay poorly, competition and sometimes a surplus. Amidst all this, Jesca is able to make 50,000/= as profits a week and these help to pay for her children’s school fees and general welfare. She is also able to save and in the future, she will use her savings to buy a boat and start fishing plus build a house for her children. At the moment, Jesca needs a loan to buy more food stuffs for sale in her stall so as to increase production.

loans.use: Buying more food stuffs for resale

loans.name: Bola

texts.en:
Bola is 32 years old, married with two children and in primary school. Her husband is a roadside motor mechanic. She bakes and sells snacks and groceries. She has been in this business of snack sales for some time. With the profit from her business, she helps to support her husband financially.

Bola wants to add more to her business activities that will help generate more income. She hopes for a loan of N100,000 to purchase a grinding machine for grinding tomatoes, corn, pepper etc. This she can work with when she is less busy in her snacks business.

She is a committed LAPO client. She thanks all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more baking items and a grinding machine.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es: Leonor vive en la casa de su hermana, es soltera y no tiene dependientes. Leonor se dedica a la venta ambulante de cosméticos y perfumes por catalogo y sus principales clientes están en oficinas publicas, Bancos y empresas privadas. La competencia es alta en el rubro al cual se dedica, pero cuenta con clientela  que demanda sus productos, principalmente por los precios y plazos que otorga. Con el crédito incrementara su capital de operaciones,  puesto que tiene variados pedidos y para retirar los productos de la casa matriz, debe cancelar previamente. Este es el primer crédito al que accede la cliente y viene recomendada por la hermana quien es excelente cliente de nuestra Institución, la cual da muy buenas referencias personales y M..
texts.en:
Leonor lives in her sister's house, is single and has no children. She makes a living selling cosmetics and perfumes via catalog, and her main customers are public office workers, bankers and private business people. The competition is high in her trade, but she has a clientele that demands her products, mainly because of the prices and the payment plans. With the loan, she plans to increase her working capital to fulfill her various orders and to take products back to the company headquarters, which she should have done previously. This is the first loan granted to Leonor, and she comes recommended by her sister, who is an excellent client of this lending institution.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Avelinda's Group

texts.en:
Avelinda A. is from the town of Villa Cruz, San Mateo. She is 48 years old. Avelinda is the group leader of an eleven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Avelinda is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Avelinda owns and operates a business of raising pigs to sell. Avelinda has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $87 a month from this activity.

Avelinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and by engaging in business activities. Avelinda is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 4th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Lawal

texts.en: Lawal is 40 years old, married, and has a child. Her 9 years old child attends school. Her husband works to support the home. She sells medicines at retail prices to her customers. She hopes to own a maternity home in the future. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo state. She is requesting for a loan in the amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell.

loans.name: Mara Yadira

texts.es: Esta joven tiene 36 años de edad, es madre soltera y con dos hijos a su cargo, una mujercita y un varón, la mujercita ya es mayor de edad y va a comenzar sus estudios universitarios, el varón es menor todavía y está en escuela primaria, ella trabaja en un hospital como responsable de extracción de sangre, los créditos obtenidos en nuestra institución en su momento fueron para un pequeño negocio que ella tenía, hoy le hemos estado financiando para gastos personales.
texts.en:
This young woman is 36 years old, and a single mother with 2 children in her charge, a young woman and a boy. The young woman is becoming an adult and is about to commence university studies. The boy is still a minor and is in primary school. Mara works in a hospital as a phlebotomist, drawing blood. Her past loans with our institution were for a small business which she had. Today, we are financing some of her personal expenses (paying her daughter's university tuition).

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PAYING UNIVERSITY MATRICULATION FOR HER DAUGHTER

loans.name: Faalilo

texts.en:
Faalilo S. is 63 and married with 5 children (ages 15 - 36).  She owns a business venture, selling food products in the local community.  Faalilo has 2 years of experience in this business.  Faalilo needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 550 talas or US $229 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Faalilo joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Faalilo's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Erdenetungalag

texts.en: Erdenetungalag is 42 years and lives with her family in Arhangai province, Mongolia. She has a son and three daughters, ages 16 to 22. They all live together in a traditional Mongolian housing tent, called a ger. Her oldest son, Purevdaavuu studies at a religious institution in India and her three younger daughters all attend a local secondary school. During the day, Erdentungalag operates a carpentry business with the help of her husband. She started her business in 2005 with working capital of 100,000 tugrugs, and has successfully expanded her business over the years. Today her working capital exceeds 1,000,000 tugrugs. In addition to her carpentry business, Erdenetungalag also operated a sausage manufacturing business between 2008 and early 2010. However, with the growing success of their carpentry business she and her husband have decided to focus on one business. Erdenbileg has used her earnings to support her family's expenses and children's tuition fees. She says that being reliable has helped her most to expand her business. She is requesting a 500,000 tugrug loan to purchase paint for her carpentry business.

loans.use: To purchase paint.

loans.name: Mamaeva Zebi Group

texts.ru:
Все эти замечательные и трудолюбивые женщины работают и живут в Узгенском районе. Группа в этом составе подучает уже третий кредит в Мол Булак Финанс. Все предыдущие кредиты они отработали очень хорошо. Каждая из них преследует свою цель при получении кредита в МБФ, однако у всех имеется единственное стремление - улучшить свое благосостояние и обеспечить своих детей наилучшим образом. Начнем презентацию группы с лидера.

Зеби, 61, замужем. Ее супруг работает ветеринаром в селе. От него зависит не только здоровье скота, но и благосостояние населения села. Так как урон скоту, означает урон доходам семьям, которые проживают здесь. Клиент сама также занимается животноводством. Этот кредит она планирует потратить на приобретение барана  и одного теленка. 

Гулнара, 55, замужем. Ее супруг работает охранником в местной щколе. У нее 8 детей: 6 дочерей и 2 сына. Большинство участников занимаются разведением и откормом домашнего скота, Гулнара тоже не исключение. Этим бизнесом она занимается с 1976 года. Сейчас она хочет купить корову с теленком, чтобы получать и продавать молоко и молочные изделия. 

Эркин 56 лет. До этого она занималась земледелием, выращивала табак. Сейчас она занята животноводством. В бизнесе ей помогают дети и супруг. Цель кредит - приобретение КРС. 

Савирахон - вдова с 4 детьми: 3 сына и дочь. Она планирует купит барана. 

Кадича, 55, вдова. У нее двое детей, оба учится в сельской школе. Она запрашивает уже свой третий кредит для покупки барана для дальнейшего откорма. 

Бурмайым и Сайрагул, 54 и 53 соответственно. Они также хотят купить МРС, которые будут отправлены на пастбище.  

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
All of these remarkable and hardworking women work and live in the Uzgen district. This same group is obtaining their third credit with Mol Bulak Finance. They worked off all of the previous loans very well. Every one of the women achieve their goal by obtaining a loan with MBF, however, they all have one goal to strive for, which is to improve their welfare and provide the best for their children. Let’s begin the presentation of the group with its leader. Zebi is 61 years old. Her husband works as a veterinarian in the village. Not only does the health of livestock depend on him, but also the welfare of the village population. Losses of livestock mean losses of incomes of the families who live here. Zebi is also involved in animal husbandry. She plans to use this loan to buy a sheep and one calf. Gulnara is 55 years old, married. Her husband works as a security guard at a local school. She has 8 children: 6 daughters and 2 sons. The majority of participants are involved in breeding and fattening of domestic livestock. Gulnara is also not an exception. She has been involved in this business since 1976. Now she wants to buy a cow with a calf in order to obtain and sell dairy products. Erkin is 56 years old. She was previously involved in farming and grew tobacco. Now she is involved in animal husbandry. Her children and husband help her with the business. The goal of the loan is to buy cattle. Savirahon is a widow with 4 children. She has 3 sons and a daughter. She plans to purchase a sheep. Kadicha is 55 years old, a widow. She has two children, both of whom attend a village school. She is requesting her third loan for the purchase of a sheep for subsequent fattening. Burmayim and Sayragul are 54 and 53 years old respectively. They also want to buy small livestock that will be sent off to a pasture.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a sheep and a calf

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Supplies of shoes

loans.name: Akossiwa Sitsofe

texts.en: Akossiwa runs an internet café. She is 42 years old, single and is raising one child. To improve her family's income, she opened her internet café in 2007. She has requested a loan from WAGES for 400,000 CFA to purchase four computers for her business. This is her second loan from WAGES.

loans.use: To purchase computers

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
K. Elisa is a hard-working businessman. Twenty-eight years old, he is married and blessed with two children. He lives in Matale Kinawa, Kalisizo sub-county, Rakai District. 

He is a businessman dealing in baby clothes. His shop is located at Kalisizo North, old Masaka road. K. is using the loan to purchase variety of baby clothes, such as baby shawls, towels, dresses, nappies, and so forth, to sell in order to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase baby clothes to sell

loans.name: Jariatu

texts.en:
Jariatu is a serious and very determined businesswoman. Jariatu was able to access initial business capital from her husband and started selling drinks. She has been in this drink business for the past six years. She is married and has three children. She goes to work at 6:30 a.m. and returns back home at 6:30 p.m.

Her challenges are coping with the high cost of transportation and the frequent increases in the wholesale prices of drinks, while trying to make some profit to help her husband support the family. She also intends to use the proceeds from this loan to educate her children.

loans.use: Additional drinks for the pub

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia M. is from the village of San Carlos, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 65 years old. Anastacia is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Anastacia owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motorcycle services in the local community. Anastacia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Anastacia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anastacia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to provide service. Anastacia is requesting a new loan of 2,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Anastacia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided.

loans.name: Rafig

texts.ru:
Rafig Mamedovu 64 qoda. On jenat i imeyet dvux detey (sinovey) kotorim 25 i 27 let. Odin iz eqo sinovey jenat i toje imeyet dvux detey kotorim 2 i 5 let . A eqo mladshiy sin ne jenat  on pomoqayet svoyemu otcu v eqo rabote,toje sobirayetsya jenitsya. Rafig Mamedov i eqo semya jivut v qorode Baku.

Biznesom Rafiga yavlyayetysa maqazin "1001 meloch" v Azebaydjane ,potomu chto on mojet prodovat vse chto mojet priqoditsya v povsednevnoy jizni ot zontika do iqolki( from umbrellas and needles to screwdrivers). Rafig uje 7 let rabotayet v etom biznese. On ochen lyubit svoyu rabotu. Ranshe on bil voditelem taksi no potom on reshil otkrit maqazin. Teper on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi uvelichit pomesheniye v naqazine dlya toqo chtobi pomestit tam bolshe novix tovarov.
texts.en:
Rafig Mamedov is 64 years old. He is married and has two sons, 25 and 27 years of age. One of his sons is already married and has his own children, a 2-year old and a 5-year old. They younger son is not yet married but planning to; he helps his father with the business. Rafig Mamedov and his family live in the city of Baku. Rafig’s business is a household goods store of the type known as “1001 things” in Azerbaijan. He sells all kinds of items needed in everyday life, from umbrellas and needles to screwdrivers. He has been in this business for 7 years. He likes his work. In the past he used to be a taxi driver but later he decided to open his own store. At present Rafiq needs 2000 AZN in order to expand his space and accommodate more new goods.

Translated from Russian by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing store space

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 25 year old Kadiatu. She is married, and has 1 child aged less than one year.

In 2005, Kadiatu established her maggi cube (soup product), salt, and tomato business. She began her business after she gained enough experience from her mother, who also sold the same food items. Working 6 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about 931,200SLL every month from this business.

She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000SLL. Kadiatu requires a loan in order to buy Jino tomato, jumbo maggi, shrimp maggi, and salt in large quantity for resale. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 232,800 SLL. Kadiatu plans to rent a shop and buy lots of goods for sale. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more goods.

loans.name: Heremakono Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe HEREMAKONO sont six femmes mariées  et 1veuve  qui ont en moyenne 38 ans,  4 enfants et vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à MAMASSONI un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur septième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Tous les prêts passés se sont bien dénoués. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que les tissus  avec  ADJARATOU D., qui  compte acheter avec son  prêt, 12 pièces de pagnes wax. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso. Les pagnes sont  vendus au grand marché de Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 25.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Heremakono group, six married women and one widow, are on the average 38 years old, with four children. They live mainly in polygamous families in Mamassoni, a district in the town of Skiasso (the third administrative region of Mali). They are now on their seventh loan from the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which they collaborate in order to better satisfy their customers’ needs. All previous loans have been properly repaid. The women retail various articles, such as fabrics, which is the case of Ajdaratou D.. With her loan, she plans to purchase 12 sets of wax “pagnes” [traditional colorful fabric]. She stocks up at the big market of Sikasso. The pagnes are resold at the big market of Sikasso and out from her home, for cash, to a customer base composed of both men and women. She plans to achieve a monthly income of 25,500 West African Francs, a part of which will serve to help her husband provide for the everyday family expenses, and the rest reinvested in her business. Her vision is to increase her working capital and better meet customer demand.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing traditional "pagnes" fabric

loans.name: Eddy

texts.es:
Eddy G. A.    es un señor  de 41 años de edad el  cual vive con su esposa y sus  hijos en una comunidad llamada Hernández localizada en provincia de Alajuela; desde joven el se ha dedicado a la producción y venta de leche. 

Don Eddy tiene mucha experiencia en la producción de leche, sin embargo actualmente esta pasando por un situación económica un poco difícil es por eso que  el necesita ¢599,000 (quinientos noventa y nueve  mil colones)  para comprar vacas lecheras y aumentar sus ingresos y así reactivar su negocio.

El es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Unidos por un Desarrollo, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será primer préstamo y espera involucrarse más con este tipo de organizaciones.
texts.en:
Eddy G. A. is a forty-one-year-old gentleman who lives with his wife and children in the community of Hernández, located in the province of Alajuela. Since he was young he has been in the production and sale of milk. Eddy has a lot experience in milk production.
