However, he is currently going through a bit of economic hardship because he needs 599,000 colones to buy milk cows so he can increase his income and get his business going again. He is a member of Empresa de Crédito Comunal Unidos por un Desarrollo [United for Development Local Credit Enterprise], one of EDSA's one hundred member organizations in Costa Rica. This will be Eddy's first loan and he hopes to become more involved with this kind of organization.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de 2 vacas lecheras

loans.name: Rolando José

texts.es: El  Sr. Rolando José V. C.  él  es trabajador activo de la Alcaldía Municipal San Rafael del sur desempeñándose como vigilante, tiene un año de laborar para esta institución, es casado actualmente tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales para la siembra de granos como maíz, sorgo, etc.  Los cuales  los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera él ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Rolando José V. C. has been employed as a Watchman for the City of San Rafael del Sur for the last year.  He is married and has two school aged children.

He has had two loans with CEPRODEL that he’s used to buy supplies for corn and sorghum crops, etc.

Ceprodel loans have been of great benefit for him in that they have improved his and his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: For cement, sand and stone.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is a dairy farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley Kenya. He has been farming for 15 years and employs one farmhand. His farm produces milk which he sells locally. He also earns income from his small-scale farming of tea which he sells to the local market. His primary challenge has been low production of milk which affects his income.

Bernard is 52 years old.  He is married with eight school-aged children, all of whom attend school.

He has requested this loan of 50,000KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help him to pay the school fees for his children. In the future, he would like to expand his dairy farming by acquiring more dairy cows.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Allah Kabo Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Allah Kabo sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygames avec en moyenne 41 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent le village de Somonodougouni dans la commune rurale de Konodimini, dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le petit commerce de poissons frais et fumés. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce les membres du groupe ont décidé d’adhérer à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
 Madame Yaya Sogoré compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 8 corbeilles de  poissons frais au bord du fleuve Niger dans le village. Elle les revend en détail, à domicile, dans le village en ambulant et à la foire de Konodimini, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Madame Yaya Sogoré compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour assurer les soins de santé des enfants et les petits besoins du foyer. 
Elle a pour objectif d’entretenir ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’augmenter le volume de son activité génératrice de revenus.
texts.en:
The four women of the Allah Kabo group are married and live mostly in polygamous families, are on average 41 years old, and have three children.  They live in the village of Somonodougouni in the rural community of Konodimini, in the region of Ségou (the fourth administrative region of Mali).  

They know each other through family ties and are involved in the business of selling fresh and smoked fish.  With the goal of increasing their working capital, the members of the group decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and they are on their first joint loan.  

Madame Yaya Sogoré plans to use her loan to buy eight baskets of fresh fish on the shore of the Niger River in the village.  She resells them at retail, door to door in the village, as well as at the market in Konodimini for cash and on credit to a clientele of men and women.

Madame Yaya Sogoré plans to earn with this loan an average monthly profit of 30,000 FCFA which will be used to meet her children’s health needs and the everyday needs of her home.  Her objective is to maintain this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase the volume of her business.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish

loans.name: Maryann

texts.en:
Maryann Mwikali is 36 years old and married with three children between three and 15. Her husband is a cattle seller. Maryann’s business is located at Kakamega town where she sells cereals to local people. Besides this business, she also sells a fish known locally as Omena. Maryann has had her business for 24 years now and is able to employ one person. Her business is profitable and her major challenge is competition, as there are many other similar businesses in the area and her customers have many choices. 

Maryann describes herself as social, outgoing, and optimistic. She works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES to buy more fish and cereals to expand her business. In future, she hopes to become a wholesale supplier.

loans.use: to buy fish and cereals

loans.name: Aimee

texts.en:
Aimee is 31 years old and married with three children between the ages of 8 and 12 years old.  She owns a well-organised clothing boutique in the Musanze Markets.  She has had her business for one year and employs one other person.    She works from 8 a.m. until 5 p.m. during the week.

Aimee has requested this loan from Kiva partner Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more clothing for her store and expand her business.  Aimee currently owns some land and she hopes to build a house using the profits gained from the use of this loan.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Gulomjon

texts.en: S. Gulomjon is 54 years old. For many years, together with his children, he has been engaged in the farming business. As his parents were farmers, his only source of income has always been farming and it will always be farming. Gulomjon grows potatoes, onions, carrots, etc. At around 6 a.m., he's already in his fields. He loves his work, but for him to break even and to have a good quality crop, he needs to fumigate and fertilize at very precise dates. During this season, they are sowing in great quantities, and with the help of this loan, Gulomjon will purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants to help with the tilling. He wants to expand his business, a success that will bring a better quality of life for his family. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 58-year-old married man from Lebanon, living with his wife. Since twenty years ago, he has made his living as an experienced blacksmith. He has obtained a first Kiva loan and he is thankful for the results. Since he joined, he has grown his business. He has been a reliable client and repaid on time for the duration of the loan.

 Today, he is requesting to borrow a larger amount of $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase his inventory of iron in order to increase his business production and thus his income.

loans.use: increase his inventory

loans.name: Rober

texts.es: Rober, de 20 años, es un joven muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa que es propia y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida.Desde muy pequeño Rober aprendió a trabajar en la chacra junto a sus padres, quienes le enseñaron todo lo que se tiene que hacer, para lograr un buen cultivo, ahora tiene sus propias tierras, las cuales cultiva y cuida con mucho amor y paciencia. Él siembra café y plátanos, productos que posteriormente lleva a vender al mercado de la ciudad de Pichanaki. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus cultivos, pues  siente que su arduo trabajo esta dando sus frutos, ya lleva dos  años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden afectarlos. Su mayor deseo es comprarse un carro, con el cual pueda trasladar sus productos hasta el mercado.Este es el primer préstamo de Rober con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y esta dispuesto a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es un socio muy alegre y siempre pone  la cuota de humor en el grupo.Con los mil soles solicitados, comprará más abono e insecticidas para mejorar la calidad de sus cultivos así espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Rober is 20 years old.  He is a very humble and hard-working young man who lives in his own home.  What he most wants is to do well in life.  Rober's parents taught him to be a farmer from a very young age.  They taught him everything that he needed to do in order to achieve good crops.

Now Rober has his own land which he farms and cares for with a lot of love and patience.  He grows coffee and bananas which he then takes to sell in the market in Pichanaki.  What he most likes about his work is harvesting his crops since he feels that his hard work is bearing fruit.  He has been in this business for two years and he considers the most difficult part of his work to be protecting his crops from the pests that can affect them.  His biggest desire is to buy a car which he can use to take his products to market.

This is Rober's first loan with MFP.  He knows that he must make his loan repayments on time and he is ready to do this.  He is a very happy member of his community bank and he always injects a quota of humor into the group.  He will use the 1,000 Peruvian soles he has requested to buy more manure and insecticides to improve the quality of his crops.  In this way, he hopes to improve his profits.

loans.use: To buy manure and insecticides to improve his crops

loans.name: Solange

texts.en:
Solange owns a business that sells clothes for kids. She is 47 years old, a widow, and has three children and one other dependent. Her three children are between sixteen and twenty-five years old. Both her children and the dependent go to school. 

Solange has been selling clothes of kids for fourteen years.  The loan she has requested will be used to add more clothes to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest in her business for the growth of the business. She would like to get more loans in the future.

loans.use: To add more clothes to sell to her inventory

loans.name: Kotognogotala Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe KOTOGNOGOTALA sont toutes mariés avec une moyenne d’âge de 40  ans  et  en moyenne  2 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles monogames à HAMDALLAYE un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de bois de chauffe à travers MARIAM T.. 
MARIAM T. compte acheter avec son  prêt, 1 chargement de camion 20 tonnes en bois de chauffe auprès des organisations paysannes agréées au niveau des marchés de bois des villages voisins .
Le bois est revendu en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant, en détail et souvent à crédit. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 65.000FCFA utilisée  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of the KOTOGNOGOTALA solidarity group are all married women who average 40 years of age and two children each. They live in monogamous families in Hamdallaye, a district of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).

This is their sixth collaboration with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution to meet the needs of their customers. They sell firewood through Mariam T..

With her loan, Mariam T. plans to buy one 20-ton truckload of firewood from accredited rural organizations at the lumber markets in nearby villages. The wood will then be sold to family, to a clientele of both men and women, at retail, for cash and often on credit.

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 65,000 FCFA, which will be used for the family’s daily expenses.

loans.use: To buy firewood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying maize for planting.

loans.name: Batsaikhan

texts.en:
Batsaikhan is 42 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent, in the outer districts of the city. Her daughter attends college.

Batsaikhan supports her family by operating a clothing retail stall at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia, with help from her husband.

When she first began his business, at Narantuul in 2000, she didn’t have a stall and she sold her handmade clothing at her friend's stall. In 2002, she expanded her business by beginning to rent her own stall. Today she has 2,000,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) and sells clothes imported from Ereen, a city bordering on China, as well as her handmade clothes. She bought her land with 2 million MNT of her business profits in 2008. She is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase more clothes for spring.

Her goal is to grow her business with this loan and be able to buy her own house.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for spring.

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Sughran is a very supportive lady. Her husband, S. A., operates a grocery store in the market. At his store, he sells daily use items such as cooking oil, sugar and spices at reasonable rates. He is the only person earning income for the family. Sughran is a housewife, staying at home and doing household work. She is the mother of four children, three of whom are enrolled in a local school to get their education. She is a resident of Mian Channu, a small city in Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. 
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her husband expand his grocery business. With this loan, he will buy groceries in bulk in order to earn better profits by selling larger quantities of groceries. He has been operating this business for the past six years and Sughran is confident that he will be able to improve his business with the help of a loan investment. 

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sughran.

loans.use: to buy groceries for retail.

loans.name: Saul

texts.en:
Saul O. is a 52-year-old from Bungoma.  He is married and has two children who are 30 and 27 years old.

Saul is a carpenter and has been in this business for the past 10 years. He is applying for his third loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy more timber to use in his workshop to make cupboards and household furniture. 

Saul will use the profits generated to cater to his family's needs. He hopes to be able to open up another workshop in the neighbouring town.

loans.use: To buy timber for his carpentry business

loans.name: Nora

texts.es: Nora tiene 42 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en una casa que le heredó su esposo. Hace más de 3 años brinda el servicio de alquiler de cochera, espacio de terreno que posee su  esposo, ahora ella se dedica de su administración, es así que cobra por mantener los vehículos de sus clientes, y cobra de acuerdo al tamaño que ocupa en la cochera. Este trabajo le demanda mucho tiempo, ya que debe de cuidar los carros, su esposo es quien más la apoya en este negocio y de vez en cuando se turnan. Actualmente y gracias al servicio que brindan ha aumentado de nuevos clientes, quienes seguros acuden a su garaje. Adicionalmente a este trabajo, vende también carne de carnero, pues considera que es un negocio muy rentable, de esa manera puede ofrecer un mejor bienestar de vida a su familia. Su mayor deseo es  mejorar las condiciones de su cochera para ofrecer un mejor servicio. Es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, se siente muy contenta de haber accedido a este préstamo y se compromete a ser  puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que recibirá, lo invertirá en mejorar la infraestructura de su cochera y con una parte para el negocio de venta de carne de carnero.
texts.en:
Nora, 42, lives with her husband and four children in a house her husband passed on to her.  For over three years she’s been providing carport leasing services on a piece of property owned by her husband.  She runs the business charging her customers for storing their vehicles; she charges according to the amount of space taken up in the carport.  This work is very time consuming because she has to guard the vehicles.  Her husband is her greatest support in the business and sometimes they take over for each other.  Thanks to the service they provide the number of customers who frequent their carport has increased currently.  In addition to this work they also sell lamb meat because she feels this is a profitable business that makes it possible for her to provide her family with better wellbeing.  Her greatest wish is to improve the conditions of her carport to provide a better service.

This is the first time she’s had a loan with MFP.  She feels very happy to have accessed this loan and promises to be punctual with her payments.  She will use the loan she’ll get to improve her carport’s infrastructure and part of it will be used in the lamb meat business.

loans.use: to improve her carport's infrastructure as well as to invest in meat sales.

loans.name: Karen Valesca

texts.es: Karen Valesca posee un negocio que es una pulpería. Tiene más de 3 años con este negocio. Inicio este medio de vida a los 21 años de edad, es una persona muy honesta y responsable. Tiene 1 hijo menor de edad de 10 años a su cargo, pues tiene que proporcionarle educación, vestimenta y alimento. No ha sido fácil poder manejar el negocio debido a muchas clientes les daba crédito y no le han pagado. Este financiamiento es para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, café, sopas, enlatados, jabón, papel higiénico entre otros.
texts.en: Karen Valesca runs a local store. She began this business 3 years ago when she was 21 years old. She is an honest and responsible person. She has a 10-year-old son, for whom she needs to provide an education, clothes and food. It has not been easy managing the business, since many clients have run up credit and haven't yet paid their bills. She has requested the loan to purchase basic cereals, sweets, coffee, soups, canned food, soap, and toilet paper.

loans.use: To purchase basic cererals, sweets, coffee, soups, canned food, soap and toilet paper.

loans.name: Faith Ii Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Faith II” group from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Messie is the leader of this group. The 31-year-old is married to a businessman and they have 4 children. Messie has been a businesswoman for 8 years now. She sells cassava roots. With her share of this loan, she will buy bags of cassava roots in order to expand her business size and quality.

loans.use: to buy bags of cassava roots in order to expand her business size and quality.

loans.name: Aida Silvia

texts.es: La señora Aida Silvia es una persona ya grande de edad que quedo viuda hace unos años, de la manera que percibe ingresos es por medio de dos pensiones que se le deposita en largos periodos. Por tal motivo ella se ve en la necesidad de solicitar el apoyo a la institución para arreglar su vivienda, por que el techo de su casa que es de madera ya esta muy deteriorado, algunas partes se observa el hueco que se cayo por que el material ya era muy viejo. Comenta Aida que en temporada de lluvia el agua se trasmina y todas sus pertenencias se mojan, preocupada por su patrimonio, desea arreglar su techo antes de que el problema se agrave, para esto necesita comprar material y pagar mano de obra para que sea de concreto.
texts.en: Aída Silvia is a person who is already advanced in age and who was widowed many years ago.  Her income derives from two pensions that she gets deposited over long periods.  Because of this, she needs to ask the institution for a loan to repair her home because the roof is wooden and it is very deteriorated.  In some places, one can observe the opening made when part of it fell in because the material was so old.  Aída comments that during the rainy season water penetrates and all her belongings get wet.  She is worried about her patrimony and wants to repair the roof before the problem worsens.  To do so she needs to buy building materials and supplies and to pay labor costs to make it out of concrete.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Kadambi

texts.en:
Kadambi is a farmer in Kitale area of Western Kenya. Her mixed farm produces maize, beans, millet and groundnuts and she employs the services of one farmhand. She has been in farming for seven years and runs a retail business for additional income. Kadambi is married and has four children, aged between 3 and 16 years, all attending school.

Kadambi has requested for a loan of 31,200 KES  to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She believes the additional cow will enable her to educate and feed her children. She hopes to be a major supplier in the area in the future.

Kadambi is glad that Juhudi provides agricultural loans, but mentions that diseases and poor prices for the products are the major impediments to the farming business.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase and insurance of a dairy cow.

loans.name: Daylin

texts.en:
Daylin is 41 years old and lives in Plaridel. She is married and has two children.

To earn a living, Daylin has a business catching and selling fish. She earns about PHP 4,000 each month doing this type of work. 

Daylin has requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to purchase materials for their fish cage.

Daylin has been a member of PMPC for a year.

loans.use: to purchase materials for their fish cage.

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en:
Elchin is 26 and single. He makes his living as a market vendor, having sold fruit and vegetables as well as running a small clothes shop for seven years.

Over this period of time, Elchin had acquired the knowledge and skills required to succeed in this business. For instance, he knows how to store fruit so that it remains marketable and does not lose its taste. He sells watermelons, apples, pears and pomegranates in his town's central market. 

He is well-known in this market for his attractive prices and friendliness. All of this allows Elchin's business to generate the stable income his family needs. During summertime, demand for Elchin's products is high. That is why he is planning to buy more fruit to sell. He is requesting a loan of 700 Azerbaijanian Manat (AZN) that will allow him to do this and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to sell

loans.name: Sérigne Modou

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune célibataire qui a arrête ses études après un an passé au lycée pour travailler et soutenir sa famille car ses deux parents sont à la retraite.Il s'engage d'abord dans la maçonnerie et réuni un petit fonds qu'il investit ensuite dans le commerce de patte d'arachide, d'huile de palme et de café touba.Il s'approvisionne dans un grand marché sous régional et revend les produits sur le marché local.Aujourd'hui, il arrive à prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires, sanitaires, de scolarité et d'habillement des membres de sa famille. Il sollicite un prêt de 300000f auprès de l'IMCEC pour augmenter son fonds de commerce en achetant notamment 200 litres d'huile de palme, 20 seaux de patte d'arachide,50 kg de café touba et du poisson séché. Les bénéfices tirés de la vente de ces produits l'aideront beaucoup à satisfaire les besoins de sa famille. Son ambition est de construire sa propre maison mais aussi et surtout d'ouvrir un grand magasin de vente de produits agricole dans sa localité.
texts.en: The borrower is a young single man who stopped his studies after the first year of high school in order to work and support his family because both of his parents are retired. He first worked as a mason and gathered a small amount of money which he has invested in selling peanut paste, palm oil and café touba (a spiced coffee beverage very popular in Senegal). He buys his supplies in a large market in his region and resells them at the local market. Today, he is able to support his family's needs for food, sanitation, education and clothing. He is requesting a loan of 300,000 CFA francs from IMCEC in order to increase his working capital to by 200 liters of palm oil, 20 buckets of peanut paste, 50 kg of café touba and dried fish. The profits gained from the sale of these products will help him a lot in satisfying the needs of his family. His ambition is to build his own house, but especially to open a large store to sell agricultural products in his area.

loans.use: To buy 200 liters of palm oil, 20 buckets of peanut paste, 50 kg of coffee and dried fish

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is standing next to the ovens she uses to bake the bread she sells. She has been baking for six years. Comfort  is married and has two children. Her husband is a security man. She has been through junior high school. Esi uses her income to help her husband take care of the family. A loan will help to buy flour, sugar, and other ingredients to bake bread to distribute to her customers. She plans to reinvest the new profit back into the business.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, and other ingredients to bake bread to distribute to her customers.

loans.name: Muqaddash

texts.en: Muqaddash is 48 and married with 2 children. He sells different products like detergents, cookies and other foodstuffs. He has more than 10 years of experience in this field. His monthly profit is about 150 USD. His son helps him to sell the products. He applied for a loan of 1,500 AZN to purchase more products.  He already took a loan from KIVA and because of it, he was able to improve his store and improve his profit. He promises to repay on time.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Prayer Mountain B Group

texts.en:
Juliet is the facilitator for the Prayer Mountain group.  She and her group members began planting maize with One Acre Fund in 2011.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important farming inputs to distribute to Juliet and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Juliet has three children. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seed on credit at affordable rates.  In the recent 2011 season, Juliet harvested 8 bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land, an excellent harvest by her measure.  Before joining One Acre Fund, Juliet was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize on 1/2 acre.

With the profits from her maize harvest, Juliet plans on sending her children to school and buying a cow. 

On the far left of this photo, Juliet and her group members are joined by their One Acre Fund Field Officer, Patrick.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard lives and works as a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya. He is aged 26, single and has been farming for the past 3 years. He produces and sells eggs, vegetables and beans to the local market.

Leonard has made a request for 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This is his second loan request of a similar amount. He says the acquisition of a new dairy cow will provide milk for the family's consumption and generate additional income from sales. He is focusing on owning five dairy cows and buying a motorcycle to make deliveries to the market.

Leonard says their main challenge is animal disease.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Ana  Cecilia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANCHARY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ana Cecilia; ella tiene 55años de edad y es soltera y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de comida, ella prepara diferentes platos como pollo al horno,bisteck,estofado de pollo y sopas, la socia trabaja en forma ambulatoria desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia también se dedica al negocio de venta de productos de belleza, por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de comida y negocio de venta de productos de belleza. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como carne, pollo y verduras al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ana Cecilia is a member of the "Kanchary" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Ana Cecilia is 55 years old, single, and has three children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling food.  She prepares different dishes such as roast chicken, steak, chicken stew and soups.  She works as a street vendor from 8.00am to 7.00pm.  She also sells beauty products.  Through these businesses, she gets her children ahead in life.  Ana Cecilia would like to expand her food business and her business selling beauty products.  She is requesting this loan to buy cooking ingredients such as meat, chicken and vegetables, wholesale.

Ana Cecilia is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients such as meat, chicken and vegetables, wholesale

loans.name: Encarna

texts.es:
La señora Encarna es socia del banco comunal Las Divinas del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 65 años de edad, está casada y tiene seis hijos mayores de edad,  solo un hijo (soltero) vive con ellos.
Viene trabajando siete años con Manuela Ramos, tiene una pequeña bodega que funciona en su misma casa, que cuando ella sale a realizar sus comparas su esposo queda encargado del negocio, y lo reemplaza muy bien, es amable con sus clientes.
Con su nuevo préstamo  de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprara: 3 tiras de champú, 6 tiras de papitas fritas, 2 tiras de chizitos, 2 tiras de boliqueso, 1 caja de galletas soda, 1 docena de ayudin pequeño, 1 caja de leche chica. 
Tiene la suerte de contar con la ayuda de su esposo y de su hijo que son las personas que están ahí cuando lo necesita, agradece a Manuela Ramos por todo los prestamos que le han dado en todo este tiempo para poner su negocio.
texts.en:
Encarna is a member of the 'Las Divinas' community bank which is located in Calleria district, in Ucayali department.  She is 65 years old, married, and has six children who are all grown up.  Only one son (who is single) still lives with her.

Encarna has been working with Manuela Ramos for seven years and has a small grocery store in her own home.  When she goes out to do her shopping, her husband looks after the business and he replaces her very well as he is friendly to her customers.

Encarna will use her new loan for 1,000 soles to buy three strips of shampoo, three strips of potato chips, two strips of Chizitos, two strips of Boliqueso, 1 box of soda crackers, 1 dozen small tubs of Ayudín (cleaning products) and 1 box of small cans of milk.

Encarna is lucky to have the help of her husband and her son, who are the people who are there when she needs them.  She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for the loans that they have given her over all these years so that she can run her business.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, snacks, candies, detergents and milk

loans.name: Hamadallah

texts.en:
Hamadallah is a 19-year-old young man who is able to have a small store in A. Mafraq to sell cell phones and accessories. 

He has been working for three years and, at the same time,  he has been going to one of the Jordanian universities to study chemistry. With the store profits, he pays his school fees.

To make more profit in the store, he learned how to fix mobile phones and added it as a new service, which brought in more customers to the shop.

Now Hamadallah has applied for this loan in order to buy used cell phones to fix and re-sell in addition to the new ones that he already has in his store.

loans.use: to buy used cell phones to repair and sell

loans.name: Marianela

texts.es:
Marianela, se dedica a la venta de frutas, ella vive con su esposo y sus hijos desde hace diez años se dedica a este negocio el cual lo aprendió debido a la necesidad de su familia y todos los días trabaja de lunes a domingo.
El préstamo lo utilizara para para comprar frutas como: uvas, manzana, guineos, piña y aprovechando la época de noviembre comprar materiales para hacer arreglos florales y tener más ingresos.
El objetivo de Marianela es que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales, y ayudar a los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
Marianela sells fruit. She lives with her husband and children and has had this business for the past ten years. She started it due to family necessity and works every day, Monday to Sunday.

She will use the loan to buy fruit such as grapes, apples, bananas and pineapples and, capitalizing on the November season, to buy material to make floral arrangements and earn more income.

Marianela’s goals are for her children to study and become professionals and to help with household expenses.

loans.use: to buy grapes, apples, bananas and pineapples for her business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is from Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 61 years old. Teresita is married with four children. 

To make a living, Teresita owns and operates a "sari-sari" (general store) business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Teresita has been in her business for over one year and earns 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Teresita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Teresita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is from Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old. She is married and has one child. 

To make a living, Alicia runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home-use products in the local community, such as rice, cigarettes, shampoo, soaps, etc. Alicia has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities.

Alicia is requesting a loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. In 2010, Alicia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to save the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offerings.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
MARIA DEL ROSARIO
La señora María Del Rosario, tiene 2 hijos  menores de edad , necesita otro crédito para poder  surtir mas su venta  de Ropa típica Y Joyería de Fantasía   que tiene desde hace  siete años abajo del mercado local  quiere invertir en estos dos últimos dos meses del año que viene la temporada navideña   y así poder vender productos navideños en otros lugares  ella tiene mucha demanda  de la ropa típica  y tiene pedidos para   entregar  a diferentes clientes   y aprovechar en vender su joyería en el mercado Local   donde le ayudan algunas señoras a  vender de ambulantes  sus sueños  es seguir adelante  con la ayuda que fape le brinda  y así poder seguir creciendo  en sus ventas y poder  brindarle  a sus hijos estudio y lo necesario para su crecimiento
texts.en: María Del Rosario has 2 minor children. She needs another loan in order to be able to further stock her business selling typical clothing and costume jewelry. She has had this business for seven years below the local market. She wants to invest in these items in the last two months of the year during the Christmas season and in this way be able to sell Christmas products in other places. She has a lot of demand for the typical clothing, and she has orders to deliver to different clients. She makes the most of selling her jewelry in the local market, where some women help her selling door-to-door.  Her dream is to continue moving forward with the help that FAPE gives her, and thus be able to continue increasing her sales and to give her children an education and what they need to grow.

loans.use: to sell typical clothing and costume jewelry

loans.name: Sreypov

texts.en: Sreypov is 29 years old.  She is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia.  She is a cloth weaver and her husband is taxi driver.  Sreypov is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase silk to weave at home.  In the future, she would like to expand her weaving business, build a new house and support her children until they earn bachelors degrees.

loans.use: to purchase silk to weave at home.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia doesn’t have any children. She spends her time sewing for her neighboring clients. She is very skilful and has learned the art of sewing from her mother. 

Her husband operates 2 businesses. He owns a grocery store and also a tailoring business. He gives the required time to his businesses so he gets no complaints from his customers but can easily satisfy them through his services. Asia has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband. With the loan investment, he will buy groceries for his grocery store, buy a new sewing machine and hire a worker who will assist him in completing the orders on time. 

He is very experienced in his businesses and Asia is hopeful that an investment will be more productive for him.

loans.use: to buy groceries and a new sewing machine for grocery store and tailoring businesses

loans.name: Hue

texts.en: Hue is taking out a loan for her daughter, Lieu, who is studying accountancy at the Finance and Banking Institute. After graduation, she will work for a bank in the Bacninh province. To make her studying effective, Hue's daughter wants a new computer. Therefore, Hue requires a loan of 14,580,000 Vietnamese đồng (VND).

loans.use: to buy a new computer.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.ru:
Владимир брал прошлый кредит для ремонта теплиц, а также на пленку и семена. В этом году доход увеличился до 90 000 гривен. Сейчас Владимиру нужно готовить теплицы к высадке и своих средств не хватает, поэтому он обращается за финансовой помощью в КИВА. Владимир планирует закупить пленку на 10 000 гривен, удобрения на 2 000гривен и семена на 8 000 гривен. Он хочет посадить огурцы и помидоры, доход начнет получать в мае, а прибыль пойдет летом.
Дочь Владимира в этом году заканчивает учебу в ВУЗе. Старшая дочь замужем, есть внуки.
texts.en:
Vladimir took out a loan last year to repair his greenhouses as well as to purchase greenhouse plastic film and seeds.  His income has increased up to 90,000 hryvnia this year.  Vladimir turns to KIVA for financial aid because he needs to prepare his greenhouses for planting and does not have enough money.  Vladimir is planning on purchasing the greenhouse plastic film, fertilizers and seeds for  the amounts of 10,000 hryvnia (UAH), 2,000 hryvnia (UAH) and 8,000 hryvnia (UAH), respectively.  He wants to plant cucumbers and tomatoes.  Vladimir will start getting the income in May and making the profit in summer.
Vladimir's daughter will graduate from the university this year.  His eldest daughter is married. Vladimir has grandchildren.

loans.use: to purchase greenhouse plastic film, fertilizers and seeds for the amounts of 10,000 hryvnia (UAH), 2,000 hryvnia and 8,000 hryvnia, respectively.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Miss. Esther Asis is 23 years old. A hairdresser by profession and an optimistic young girl. She desires to see her business expand tremendously. As a result, she request for the above amount.

loans.use: To buy driers for dressing hair

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Born in 1982 in Benin, Mr. Eric G. is a master upholsterer in the Nukafu quarter in Lomé. His wife is a homemaker and they have two (02) children.

After stopping his studies in primary school, he began an apprenticeship as an upholsterer. He then opened a small workshop which does not run much, rendering his and his family's financial situation very difficult : he is unable to meet the needs of his family.

He thus had the idea to sell foam in his shop to increase his income.

To realize this dream, he is asking for a loan of $600 to buy and sell foam and mattresses. He is a hard-working young man who needs financial support to get his life off the ground.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1982 au Bénin, Monsieur Eric G. est maître tapissier au quartier Nukafu à Lomé. Marié à une femme ménagère et père de deux (02) enfants.

Après avoir arrêté ses études au cours primaire, il entra en apprentissage comme tapissier. Il ouvrit par la suite un petit atelier qui ne marche pas tellement rendant sa situation économique et celle de sa famille très difficile : il n’arrive pas à subvenir aux besoins de la famille.

Il eut donc l’idée de vendre lui-même des mousses dans son atelier pour augmenter son revenu.

Pour réaliser ce rêve, il sollicite un crédit de $600 pour l'achat et vente des mousses et matelas. C’est un garçon travailleur qui nécessite un appui financier pour décoller dans la vie.

loans.use: To buy and sell foam and mattresses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The loan with be used to pay her suppliers and the improvement of her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand the inventory of her cereals  business

loans.name: Nazek

texts.en:
Nazek A. M. works from her home in Sabra. She does crochet and knitting work and sells it to various shops. She also has clients that visit her to make orders. Nazek is a wife and a mother of 3 children, the youngest one being 6 months old. She needs $300 to buy the necessary materiA. for her knitting and crochet work.

Nazek is part of a group with other women. Her group name is 'A. zouhour,' which means flowers. This is a group of self-chosen women, living in vulnerable conditions, mostly in rurA. areas. Group lending is based on an incrementA. increase of loan amount and group solidarity to guarantee repayment. The strength of the group loan is that is encourages the collaborative approach in the borrowing community. The group loan is a very powerful tool towards women's economic empowerment.

loans.use: To buy material for crochet and knitting work

loans.name: Claudia Elizabeth

texts.es:
After her father´s death, Claudia Elizabeth and her mom opened a clothing store so they could support themselves. After his demise they decided to join forces to pull themselves through this terrible loss.

Claudia Elizabeth wishes to expand their business by purchasing a stall in the local market to provide for her and her mother as this is their only source of income. This business gives them the confidence to overcome the daily difficulties they face.

They are requesting a credit of US $475 to be paid back in 6 months. Through your help, Claudia and her mom will make it through and will be able to value the lessons that Mr.B. left behind.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.

Después de que falleció el papá de Claudia Elizabeth ella y su mamá iniciaron con un negocio de venta de ropa para ayudarse en los gastos familiares, puesto que él era el que las mantenía a ellas y al hogar, después de esta terrible pérdida decidieron unirse para salir adelante.

Hoy en día ella desea ampliar el negocio y adquirir un puesto en un mercado de la localidad y seguir saliendo adelante, ya que este negocio es la única fuente de sus ingresos, y la fuerza que les da día a día para superar la dura prueba que recibieron. Claudia está solicitando un crédito de US $475 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses. Con tu ayuda Claudia y su mamá podrán salir adelante y valorar las enseñanzas que el señor B. les dejó.

loans.use: Clothing and store purchase

loans.name: Khusrav

texts.ru:
Khusrav Gadoyboyevich R. has been trading at the market for 7 years and has a lot of business experience. He purchases goods wholesale and sells them at retail prices. Right now, he is the only person in his family who is earning money. His brother could not find a job in Tajikistan and left to work in Russia. Currently, Khusrav's mother and father help him in his business. He set up his trading stall at the central market. This business is the only source of income for the family. In order to increase his working capital, Khusrav needs financial support.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer.

Рачабов Хусрав Гадойбоевич торгует на рынке уже 7 лет и имеет в этом деле большой опыт. Он, закупает товар оптом и продает розницей. На данный момент он единственный в семе кто зарабатывает. Его брат не находя работу уехал на заработки в Россию. Ему в данное время ему в торговле на рынке помогают отец и мать. На данный момент он обустроила свою торговую точку в центральном вещевом рынке. Данный бизнес является основным источником дохода семье. Чтобы увеличит оборотный капитал, он нуждается в финансовой поддержке.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of goods sold and purchase winter products

loans.name: Issa

texts.en: I am Issa K., 32, and I am a resident of Vituka area in Dar Es Salaam City. I run a little corner grocery store in Vituka area, a business I have been engaged in for the past  three years. I am in need of a loan of US$ 525 to help me expand my business.

loans.use: expand my little corner grocery store

loans.name: Upper Kawuga A(2061) B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Sharon S.. She is currently in the business of running a retail shop. She is requesting a loan of UGX 400,000 to increase her stock. Sharon is 25 years old and she is married. She has 2 children who are 2 and 6. Both children go to school. Each week, Sharon makes approximately UGX 30,000 in profits from her business. With the extra profits she earns as a result of her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children

Sharon is joined in her small group by Ruth M., Joyce M., Madina N., and Janet S.. Ruth M. is currently in the business of brick lying and is requesting a loan of UGX 800,000 to re-invest in her brick business. Joyce M. currently runs a retail shop. She is requesting a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to add to her inventory stock. Madina N. is currently in the business of selling spare parts and is requesting a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to add to her business. Janet S. currently runs a commercial motorcyle business. Janet is requesting a loan of UGX 400,000 to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: To re-invest in the businesses

loans.name: Sada's Ushirika Group

texts.en:
Sada is 39 years old and is married with two children, ages 13 and 12 years old. She and her husband also take care of five other people. Sada has sold food since 2000. Every day, she works from 7am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Aisha, who has a business dealing in Salon.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Aminah Diana

texts.en: Diana is a 43 year-old married resident of Sapeman in the Greater Accra region of Ghana.  She has over 8 years of experience in the retail sales of used clothing and other cloth items such as curtains.  She is seeking a loan of $500 (8 months) so as to expand her business to serve the market in adjacent communities.

loans.use: Aminah would use the loan to expand her business to serve the market in the adjacent communities.

loans.name: Crecelia's Group

texts.es:
Crecelia, Catalina and Sonia have belonged to the Llamkasun ("work" in Quecha) Communal Bank for 6 months, 4 years, and 2 years respectively.

Crecelia lives with her partner, she is 28 years old and has three children. She sells meat wholesale to butchers and markets in the city of Ayacucho and travels to different markets where she buys animals and later profits from them. Crecelia also makes dried potatoes which she sells in the Grau Market.

Catalina is divorced, 44 years old and has three children. She has a well-stocked general store where she sells groceries, licorice, vegetables, and gifts. Catalina also sells cosmetics through a catalog and makes cakes for different events.

Sonia is married, 32 years old, and has two children. She has a well-stocked general store in her house. Sonia also sells cosmetics through a catalog and typical regional dishes on Sundays.

Crecelia, Catalina and Sonia need a loan of $900 to purchase goats, pigs, sugar, rice, cooking oil, and milk. Crecelia, Catalina and Sonia dream of having a restaurant, a beauty salon, children who are professionals, and a stable position.

Translated from Spanish by Amani R., Kiva volunteer.

Crecelia, Catalina y Sonia pertenecen al Banco Comunal Llamkasun que significa “Trabajemos” en quechua, hace 6 meses, 4 años, 2 años respectivamente.

Crecelia es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 3 hijos, Crecelia vende carne por mayor a las carnicerías y mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Crecelia viaja a las diferentes ferias donde compra los animales y posteriormente lo beneficia. Además Crecelia hace papa seca que vende en el Mercado Grau.

Por otro lado Catalina es divorciada, tiene 44 años y 3 hijos, Catalina tiene una bodega muy surtida donde vende abarrotes, licores, verduras, regalos. Además Catalina vende cosméticos por catálogo y también prepara tortas para diferentes compromisos.

Mientras que Sonia es casada, tiene 32 años y 2 hijas, Sonia tiene una bodega muy surtida en su casa. Además Sonia vende cosméticos por catálogos y vende comida típica los días domingos.

Crecelia, Catalina y Sonia necesitan préstamos de 1000 soles, 450 soles, 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de ganado caprino, porcino, azúcar, arroz, aceite, leche.

Los sueños de Crecelia, Catalina y Sonia son tener un restaurante, un salón de belleza, que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener un puesto estable.

loans.use: To purchase goats, pigs, sugar, rice, cooking oil, and milk.

loans.name: Saré Sama 2 Group

texts.fr:
Our group just finished reimbursing the first loan Kiva gave us. We waited for a suitable time to ask to renew our loan so we can continue to sell the products we go get in town (rice, sugar, oil, soap and kitchenware). Our village is very isolated and very far from the national road. This is why the population has a hard time getting supplies, especially during the rainy season that will begin shortly. With our first loan, we started to supply the villagers and those who live in the surrounding villages. Our experience taught us that people need our products the most during winter time because it is most difficult to travel towards towns. This is why we are asking Kiva to renew our loan.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Notre groupement vient de boucler le remboursement du premier prêt que kiva nous avait donné. Nous avons attendu le moment propice pour demander le renouvellement du prêt pour continuer à commercialiser les produits ( riz, sucre, huile, savon et ustensile de maison) que nous allons chercher en ville, car notre village est très enclavé et il est très loin de le route nationale. Ce qui fait que les populations éprouvent des difficultés pour se ravitailler surtout lors de la saison des pluies qui va bientôt s'installer . Avec le premier prêt, nous avions commencé à ravitailler les villageois et ce qui habite dans les autres villages environnants. L'expérience nous a fait savoir que c'est pendant l'hivernage que les gens ont plus besoin de nos produits à cause de la difficulté de déplacement des gens vers les villes. C'est pour cela que nous demandons à Kiva de renouveler notre crédit.

loans.use:
Purchase of raw material and domestic products

Achat de matières premières et produits d'utilisation domestique

loans.name: Nancy Rosa

texts.es:
Nancy sells clothing, and her target market is adults and children. She has now expanded to sell sheets and night clothing (e.g., pajamas, lingerie). All her products are sold in popular markets in the city of La Paz. She uses a system that allows her to sell on credit; this makes it easier to do daily and weekly collections.

She was married, but her marriage failed and left her with two children. She supports her children on her own because her former husband is incapable of giving a contribution and also because she wants to. Nancy lives in the area of Villa Harmony (La Paz) in her parents' home.

This is her first credit with Impro, but our analysis and the references from her friends (who are also our customers and would gladly help in the event that she is delinquent) allow us to fully trust her. In addition she is ambitious and will use the money to expand her range of trousers, quilts, linens, games, etc. That way, her children will have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer.

Nancy vende ropa, su mercado son adultos y niños. Actualmente ha expandido sus actividades por lo que también comercializa sábanas y ropa de noche (pijamas, lencería). Todos sus productos son vendidos en los mercados populares de la ciudad de La Paz. Se vale de un sistema que le permite vender a crédito, esto le facilita hacer cobros diarios y semanales.

Estuvo casada pero su matrimonio fracasó y la dejó con dos hijos, los cuales ella mantiene sola por que el marido es incapaz de dar un aporte y tampoco desea hacerlo. Nancy vive en la zona de Villa Armonía (La Paz), en la casa de sus padres.

Este es su primer crédito en Impro pero nuestro análisis y las referencias dadas por sus amigas (que también son clientes nuestras y gustosamente la ayudarán en caso de estar ella en mora) nos permiten confiar plenamente en ella. Además ella es ambiciosa, usará el dinero para ampliar su oferta de pantalones, edredones, juegos de sábanas, etc. De esa manera sus hijos tendrán una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: For the sale of linens and clothing

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras De San Pedro Group

texts.es:
This group in Barrio San Pedro was founded by one of the participants who already knew about the Fundacion and contacted us.

The women in the group participate in various economically productive activities such as the sale of clothes and linens, cosmetics, candy, cleaning supplies; some of them are seamstresses. One member is a dance instructor and will soon open a small dance studio.

Out of the loan requested, each group member will receive 300,000 guaranis (Paraguay's currency, about $77 dollars), which will be used to buy merchandise for the activities in which they are already involved.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva volunteer

Este grupo del Barrio San Pedro surgió por medio de una de las integrantes que ya conocia el programa y que contacto a la Fundación. Todas las señoras realizan actividades productivas venta de ropas y sabanas venta de productos cosmeticos, otras son modistas, una de las integrantes es profesora de danzas y esta iniciando un instituto de danzas, ventas de dulces, venta de productos de limpieza El monto que recibe cada señora es de 300.000, todas las señoras destinan el crédito para comprar mercaderias para las actividades que ya estan realizando actualmente.

loans.use: Purchase of cleaning supplies, purchase of peanuts to make candy, purchase of clothes, linens and fabrics, purchase of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Aziza's K/hudumu Group

texts.en:
Aziza is 48 years old and is married with 2 children ages 11 and 8. Since 2003, she has been a tailor as well as a seller of juice and handbags. Each day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

Aziza now requests a loan to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mkufu.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.es:
Eliza tiene 25 años de edad, estudió secundaria completa, es conviviente y progenitora de dos hijos varones de 07 y 01 año de edad. Vive en el Jr. Santa Cruz s/n Barrio Alianza, distrito de Mazocruz, provincia El Collao, Puno.

Es socia del Banco Comunal “Generación 2000” en Mazocruz desde hace un año y medio. Con su primer crédito de S/.300 Nuevos Soles compró 03 paquetes de gaseosa con S/.30, 02 cajas de atún con S/.30, golosinas a un valor de S/.100 y otros. Eliza quedó huérfana de padre a los 06 años de edad y ayudaba a su madre a vender desayuno en la ciudad de Tacna, a los 15 años de edad hacía su negocio por cuenta propia y vendía empanadas. Cuando cumplió los 19 años tuvo una pareja quien la abandonó, con el segundo compromiso empezó a trabajar en la compra y venta de carne de alpaca, la cual entrega semanalmente de 08 a 10 degollados a los mayoristas de la ciudad de Tacna.

Con este crédito de S/.500 Nuevos Soles, el cual será pagado en 04 cuotas, comprará 05 alpacas a S/.100 cada uno, los cuales serán comercializado en carne a los mayoristas.

Su meta es ampliar el negocio y llevarlo directamente a la ciudad de Tacna, de esa manera obtendría mayor ganancia y apoyaría a sus hijos a que estudien hasta que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Eliza is 25 years old. She studied through secondary school. She is the mother of two children, ages 7 and 1 years old respectively. She lives in Jr. Santa Cruz Barrio Alianza, in the district of Mazocruz, in the province of El Collao, Puno. She has been a member of the Communal Bank "Generation 2000" in Mazocruz for a year and a half. With her first loan of S. 300 she bought 3 packs of soda and 2 boxes of tuna fish and candy, among other things. Eliza's father died when she was 6 years old and she helped her mother sell breakfast in the city of Tacna. At age 15 she made her own business selling empanadas. When she turned 19 she was abandoned by her partner; with her second partner, she started to work on a store selling alpaca meat, which she brings to the citizens of Tacna weekly. With this loan of S. 500, which she will repay in 4 installments, she will buy 5 alpacas, whose meat she will sell. Her goal is to expand the business and take it directly to the city of Tacna, because this way she will obtain more profit and support her children, who are studying, until they become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing five alpacas

loans.name: Latif

texts.en: Latif P. has managed a transportation business with a minibus for many years.  Because he is recognized for being an experienced driver, he has many regular clients and earns a respectable income.  But increasing petrol prices have made it difficult for him to turn a profit.  Therefore, he has decided to convert his minibus to natural gas, which will save him money on fuel and allow him to offer his services for cheaper prices.  Latif is requesting a loan of $300, which will be used to purchase  a gas canister.

loans.use: To purchase gas canister for a minibus.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a new lavatory for the family.

loans.name: Liliana Margot

texts.en:
Margot is a member of the Alondras Village Bank. She is 24 years old and single. Margot sells surgical scrubs, lab coats and medical instruments and equipment to medical school students in Ayacucho. She takes orders from the students, and each month she makes a trip to Lima (nine hours from Ayacucho by bus) to buy the clothing and items they have requested. She sometimes brings non-medical items, too, like blouses and shoes, depending on what her clients request. She receives cash payments for some items, and sells others on credit.

Margot is requesting a loan of 2000 Soles to buy more medical clothing and equipment (like blood pressure gauges and stethoscopes) in Lima.

Margot’s goal for the future is to open her own store in Ayacucho to sell medical equipment.

loans.use: Buy medical clothing and equipment (blood pressure gauges, stethoscopes)

loans.name: Gorretti

texts.en:
N. Gorretti is 32 years old. She has 10 years of experience in operating a retail shop. She sells most of the fast-moving consumer goods in Ibanda town. The success of Gorreti’s business can be attributed to her good conduct and customer courtesy.

Due to an increase in her consumer base, Gorretti is requesting a loan to purchase more sugar, rice, aitme cards and soft drinks. She hopes to save the income from the business to enable her finish the construction of her rental houses. Gorretti has one son and hopes to see him through all levels of education.

loans.use: Purchase more sugar, rice, aitme cards and soft drinks.

loans.name: Angela De Los Angeles

texts.es: La Señora Ángela de los Ángeles R. Márquez tiene la edad de 57 años, está casada, y no tiene hijos.  La actividad económica es la venta de granos básicos y productos plásticos, y la ubicación de su negocio está en el mercado central. Doña Ángela dio inicio a esta actividad de forma ambulante en las áreas aceras del mercado y algunas veces recorría las calles en busca de clientes. Una vez, un comerciante le comentó que le podría vender su puesto de venta ubicado en el mercado central.  En ese sentido, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para invertir en la compra de más artículos plásticos y granos básicos ya que últimamente sus clientes se han ampliado. Sus sueños son de realizar de su venta una gran distribuidora que ofrezca productos y los distribuya por todo el departamento. Además, a Doña Ángela le gustaría a Dios le regale un poco mas de vida para estar al lado de su esposo, y además seguir trabajando en este negocio.
texts.en:
Ángela de los Ángeles R. Márquez is 57 years old, married, and does not have any children. She sells basic grains and plastic products, and her business is located in the central market. Ángela began this activity as a street vendor in the areas closest to the market and sometimes took to the streets in search of clients. Once, a merchant commented that he would be willing to sell his vending stall located in the central market. In this manner, the loan would be for work capital to invest in the purchase of more plastic articles and basic grains given that lately her clients have increased. Her dream is that her business becomes a major distributor that offers products and distributes them all over her department. Moreover, Ángela would like for God to gift her with a little more life so that she can be at her husband’s side, and continue working in this business.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase of more plastic products and basic grains.

loans.name: Husein

texts.en: Husein R. is 29 years old and lives in Bekaa with his wife and their two children.  For about five years, Husein has owned an accessory shop that sells perfumes, musical disks, phone cards and other goods.  Prior to working in Bekaa, Husein managed a similar shop in Beirut.  Over the years he has developed a technique for maintaining good relationships with his clients and now boasts of a solid network of customers.  In order to further increase this network and attract new customers, Husein is requesting a loan of $1000, which will be used to purchase a greater variety of accessories.

loans.use: To purchase a greater variety of clothes.

loans.name: Pascal

texts.fr:
K. Pascal est né en 1984 à Zoungbomè, 4e arrondissement de la ville de Porto-Novo,capitale administrative et politique du Bénin. Pascal est célibataire sans enfants. Pascal est informaticien de formation.  L’informatique permet à Pascal de gagner sa vie, grâce aux revenus qu'elle mui procure. Mais Pascal ne dispose pas de matériel nécessaire pour bien exercer sa profession et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. C’est donc pour rendre plus performant son atelier que Pascal sollicite un crédit.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
K. Pascal was born in 1984 in Zoungbomè, 4th district in the city of Porto-Novo, administrative and political capital of Benin. Pascal is single and has no children. Pascal was trained as a computer specialist. Computing enables Pascal to earn a living, thanks to the revenue that it generates. But Pascal does not have the necessary equipment to support his job and better serve his clients. To make his business more efficient, Pascal is asking for a loan. The meaning of ALIDé in the local language of Benin, the Fon, is « a path always exists for the poorest ». Benin is a small country in West Africa next to Nigeria where the GNP per capita is $1,500. ALIDé offers special 0% loans to very vulnerable people and is part of a group that will soon launch a microinsurance program for the beneficiaries of microcredit.

Translated from French by Isabelle Barres, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy computer supplies

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en:
Mavis D. is 26 years old. She is a married mother of three children who are all currently in the basic school. She lives with her children and husband in a family house in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana. She works to make some income to support her husband financially. She trades in maize. She procures bags of maize from the farmers in the nearby communities. Mavis distributes the maize to the retailers in her community and supplies the food vendors. 
She has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize in bulk to increase her stock. She intends to trek to other markets to do business. Mavis desires to improve her standard of living and support her children in school.

loans.use: To procure bags of maize

loans.name: Balemaya (La Parenté) Group

texts.fr:
Balemaya est un regroupement de quatre femmes du  village de Kimparana (région de Ségou). Elles ont en moyenne 31 ans, mariées et mères d’au moins 2  enfants vivant dans des foyers polygames. 
Elles mènent différentes activités telles la vente de produits de beauté, de fruits et légumes etc.
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis trois ans. Le montant du prêt est passé de 50.000 FCFA au premier prêt à 200.000 FCFA pour le sixième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, des produits cosmétiques et des légumes et fruits.  
Les femmes du groupe Balemaya se procurent de leurs marchandises à Bamako et à Kimparana  et vendent leurs articles à la  maison, au marché et aux foires des villages environnants.
En plus du remboursement des intérêts du prêt,  elles utiliseront une partie de leur revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Balemaya is a group of four women of the village of Kimparana (Ségou region). They average 31 years of age and 2 children each, and they are all married mothers living in polygamous households. They work in different businesses, such as selling beauty products, fruit, vegetables, etc.

To expand their businesses, the group members decided to join the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso three years ago. The loan amounts have gone from 50,000 francs CFA for the first loan to 200,00 francs for the sixth solidarity loan (group loan). All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid. The current loan will be used to buy cosmetics, vegetables, and fruit.

The group members procure their merchandise in Bamako and in Kimparana, and they sell their goods at the house, at the marketplace, and at the fairs of surrounding villages. In addition to making loan interest payments, they will use a portion of their revenues to address common family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, fruit, and vegetables

loans.name: Azalia Graciela

texts.es: La Sra.Z. tiene una pulpería desde hace un año operando bajo el nombre de Pulpería y Variedades  "AZALIA" su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación. ella es casada y madre de 4 hijos, todos dependen al 100% de ellos, tres de sus hijos estudian en la secundaria y primaria de los centros educativos publicos de la ciudad.  La Sra Azalia es una mujer muy emprendedora con deseos de superacion y quiere dar todo lo mejor para sus hijos para que ellos se preparen y sean personas de bien en su vida, su negocio le genera los recursos finanacieros para cumplir con las obligaciones en el hogar, ella nos comento que esta muy feliz porque todo le va saliendo bien y que espera que con este credito ella pueda mejorar en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Z. has a owned a grocery store for a year, operating under the name Pulpería y Variedades "AZALIA" (Azalia Grocery and Varieties). Her business is located in her home. She is married and a mother to four children, all of whom are 100% dependent on her. Three of her children are in the city's public high school or elementary school. Azalia is an entrepreneurial woman with desires to get ahead and she wants to give the best to her children so that they are prepared and may have good lives. Her business generates the financial resources to pay the bills at home. She has commented that she is very happy because everything is going well and she hopes that, with this loan, she may improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase butter, sugar, rice, soap, toilet paper, coffee and refreshments.

loans.name: Annet Nambi‘S Group

texts.en:
Annet, 48, is married and has six children, all between the ages of 15 and 30. Three of her children attend school, while the rest already work. Annet's elder brother is helping her pay the school fees. Annet also takes care of additional family members and lives in a three-room house with no piped water. She lives and works on the outskirts of Kampala. Annet earns income selling vegetables from a rented stall. She sells to an average of 30 people per day and works six days per week. Annet’s main monthly expenses include rent for the stall, school fees, and medication. She does not incur any transportation costs, because she buys the produce from a place close to her business location. Annet's main business challenges are related to the weather, especially the rainy season which disturbs the customer flow, and the seasonality of the produce that she sells. 
Annet is the leader of a 5-member loan group. She has been with MCDT for over six years and is now asking for her 12th loan which she will share with her group mates. Annet plans to use her loan share to increase the stock of produce, buying directly from farmers, and hopes to also build several rental rooms on a plot of land that she was able to buy using her previous loans.
.

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
FATOU S. est une femme mariée agée d'une cinquantaine d'année et qui est très active;elle est membre de la mutuelle depuis six ans et a toujours remboursé ses prets sans difficulté
elle vend du petit déjeuner,des tissus et diverses autres marchandises;elle demande un nouveau pret pour renforcer son fonds de roulement
texts.en:
Fatou S. is a married woman around 50 who is very active. She has been a member of the credit union for 6 years and has always reimbursed her loans without difficulty.

She sells breakfast, cloth, and various other merchandise. She is asking for a new loan to add to her working capital.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to add to her working capital

loans.name: Regina

texts.es:
Regina  es socia del Bancomunal 24 D. Octubre.  
Regina es casada tiene 64 años, tiene dos hijos D. 27 y 26 años que trabajan y estudian.
Regina le regalaron un carro y ha elL. no le gusta manejar y decidió alquilarlo y con el tiempo con su esposo compro otro auto y lo alquilo, por su parte se dedico al negocio D. polos dando servició D. bordado y se esta dedicando a L. compra y venta D. polos D. exportación.   
DesD. que Regina esta en Finca aprendió el manejo del negocio y a saber invertir.
Regina necesita un préstamo D. 1600 soles, para L. compra D. repuestos D. carro, para hacerle mantenimiento a su carro que va pasar revisión técnica  
El sueño D. Regina es tener un menimarket.
texts.en:
Regina is a member of the October 24 Communal Bank Group. She is 64 years old, married, and has two children (ages 27 and 26) who are working and studying.

Regina was given a car, but she doesn’t like to drive. So she decided to rent it out, and eventually her husband bought another car to use as a rental. She dedicates most her time to her business buying and selling embroidered sweaters for export.

Since joining FINCA, Regina has learned how to manage her business and expanded her investment knowledge. She needs a loan of 1600 soles to purchase spare parts to maintenance her car so that it will pass inspection.

Regina’s dream is to open her own mini-market.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts

loans.name: Начминисо

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Шарипова Начминисо женщина, которая работает в средней школе учительницей математики. Она кроме своей мало оплачиваемой работы, занимается откормом скота. А продаёт её муж.На следующий кредит Начминисо хочет купить две коровы и корм для них. Сейчас у неё три коровы и маленький телёнок.Она благодарит инвесторов за финансирование и понимание.

loans.use: откорм и продажа скота

loans.name: Mrs. Yom Say Village Bank Group

texts.en: Fifteen people who all live in Chrou Pisei village in Kandal Province comprise this village bank loan, and Mrs. Yom S. is the village bank president selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a 0.5-hectare field upon which she cultivates rice. The rainy season is the time to cultivate rice, but she cannot do so because she needs to plow the field first; thus, she is requesting a loan to hire a laborer with two oxen for this purpose and to buy more fertilizer to support the field.  Her husband, Mr. Tep Phin, helps his wife with the farming. Mrs. Yom S. is 46 years old and the mother of two children who are both employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: To hire a laborer with two oxen in order to plow her rice field and buy more fertilizers to support the field later.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia es socia del Banco Comunal Arco Iris.
Antonia es casada, tiene 50 años y 5 hijos, Antonia tiene un puesto en el mercado Playa Grau en donde vende cereales, además viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región de donde compra carne, queso y cereales.
Antonia necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de chuño (papa deshidratada).
Los sueños de Antonia son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y mejorar su negocio.

loans.use: Para la compra de chuño (papa deshidratada).

loans.name: Edoh Kossi Laurent

texts.fr: Ce jeune homme a ouvert une baraque de vente de cartes de recharges servant également lieu de cabine téléphonique. Il a débuté ce commerce depuis 2007 à Lomé et cette activité lui permet de subvenir à ses propres besoins. Il s’est abonné auprès des deux prestataires de téléphonie mobile à Lomé, à savoir Togocel et Moov, ce qui lui permet de bénéficier de beaucoup de réduction. Des revendeuses ambulantes de ces cartes viennent s’approvisionner chez lui, ce qui lui permet de réaliser de bonnes affaires. Pour lancer une nouvelle commande, il sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter en nombre considérable des cartes de recharges Togocel et Moov. Il est célibataire et sans enfant.
texts.en:
This young man has opened a stand selling rechargeable phone cards and providing a telephone booth. He began this work in 2007 in Lomé, and the business allows him to support himself. He has accounts with two cell phone providers in Lomé, Togocel and Moov, which allows him a good reduction in cost. Young women who sell his cards walking to and fro in the streets come to buy them from him, and that brings in a tidy profit. In order to put in a new order, he is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy a considerable number of recharge cards for Togocel and Moov. He is single and has no children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of charge cards for cell phones

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat du mil

loans.name: Yin

texts.en: Mrs. Yin P. is a villager in Damnak Roveang village in Takeo province. She is a sand seller. Her husband, Mr. Au Sorn, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. Although this couple tries to work hard, they still don't earn enough income to support their family. Thus, Mrs. Yin P. decided to ask for a loan to buy two cows for breeding and plowing the field. She is 44 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory and the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy two cows for breeding and plowing

loans.name: Hannington's Group

texts.en:
S. Hannington is a 28-year-old determined hardworking and strong man who sells shoes and has a hardware shop. Hannington is the father of two children, ages 4 and 7 years old. His main business challenge is having limited capital but, otherwise, his business is doing well. He ensures that he has enough stock for his business. His dream is to build rentals as well as to educate his children to the university level. He needs a loan to help restock his hardware shop with more goods and to buy more shoes for resale.
S. Hannington is the leader of his group in Mukono.

loans.use: To buy more hardware products and shoes for resale
